analyzed: bskal pa bzang po la sogs pa phung po lnga'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The Fortunate Aeon is of the nature of five aggregates.

translated: Some aeons are not like this,

analyzed: smon lam dang dge ba'i @125b rtsa ba'i dbang gis shin tu ring pa nyid kyi phyir ro //

original: dper na bskal pa skar ma lta bu ste de'i 'grib pa'i dus nyid las ji skad brjod pa'i bar gyi bskal pa'i tshad kyi bar gyi bskal pa stong phrag nyi shu yod pa'i phyir ro //

translated: For example, the Star-like Aeon, because of the duration of its decrease, has twenty thousand aeons of the same measure as the aeon of the humans of Kuru.

analyzed: de ltar bzang po la sogs pa bskal pa chen po grangs kyi gnas gzhan drug cur son par thob pa ni grangs med pa zhes brjod do //
translated: The Fortunate Aeon is the sixty-first great aeon; it is said to be incalculable because it is beyond the number sixty.

original: de nas bzlas nas slar yang bgrang bar bya ste de lta bu grangs med pa gsum zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de nas bzlas nas slar yang bgrang bar bya ste de lta bu grangs med pa gsum zhes brjod do //
translated: Then, beginning again with one, one counts the aeons until sixty is reached; this is said to be one incalculable.

original: de lta bu'i bskal pa grangs med pa gsum la sangs rgyas nyid 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de lta bu'i bskal pa grangs med pa gsum la sangs rgyas nyid 'byung ngo //
translated: Three of these incalculables are required for the acquisition of the knowledge of all the aspects.

original: de ltar bskal pa grangs med pa dang pos tshogs kyis nas brtsams nas sa dang po'i bar rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar bskal pa grangs med pa dang pos tshogs kyis nas brtsams nas sa dang po'i bar rdzogs par byed do //
translated: Thus, the first incalculable eon is from the beginning of the collection until the first stage is completed.

original: gnyis pas ni dri ma med pa la sogs pa sa drug go //
analyzed: gnyis pas ni dri ma med pa la sogs pa sa drug go //
translated: The second is from the first stage up to the sixth stage, the stainless stage.

original: gsum pas ni mi g-yo ba'i sa nas brtsams nas sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar ro zhes mdo las so //
analyzed: gsum pas ni mi g-yo ba'i sa nas brtsams nas sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar ro zhes mdo las so //
translated: The third is from the seventh stage, the far reaching stage, up to the stage of buddhahood.

original: gzhan rnams na re gsum du chos mthun pa'i phyir bskal pa grangs med pa gsum zhes brjod kyi don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan rnams na re gsum du chos mthun pa'i phyir bskal pa grangs med pa gsum zhes brjod kyi don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: Others say: Three incalculable eons are mentioned because they are similar in three ways, but not ultimately.

original: de ltar ni tshogs kyis rdzogs par byed pa la bskal pa grangs med pa gcig 'da'o //
analyzed: de ltar ni tshogs kyis rdzogs par byed pa la bskal pa grangs med pa gcig 'da'o //

analyzed: de'i de ma thag par mos par byed pa'i sa rdzogs par byed pa la bskal pa grangs med pa gnyis so //
translated: The second incalculable eon is from the beginning of the first stage up to the completion of the stage of devoted engagement.

original: de'i rjes su rab tu dga' ba'i sa nas bzung ste chos kyi sprin gyi bar so sor bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gsum rnams kyis byang chub sems dpa'i sa rdzogs nas /

translated: After that, beginning with the stage of the joyous, he perfects the bodhisattva stages in three incalculable eons each, up to the stage of the cloud of Dharma.

original: sangs rgyas kyis  kun du 'od thob par byed do zhes pa de ltar bskal pa grangs med pa sum cu rtsa gsum gyis sangs rgyas nyid thob po zhe'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis  kun du 'od thob par byed do zhes pa de ltar bskal pa grangs med pa sum cu rtsa gsum gyis sangs rgyas nyid thob po zhe'o //
translated: Then he attains the buddha stage of universal illumination. Thus, in thirty-three incalculable eons, he attains buddhahood.

original: sangs rgyas nam 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nam 'byung zhe na /
translated: When do the buddhas appear?

original: skye dgu'i tshe lo brgyad khri pa 'grib pa nas brtsams nas mi rnams tshe lo brgya par 'gyur ba'i bar 'dir sangs rgyas rnams 'dir 'byung ngo //

translated: The buddhas appear in this world when the life expectancy of humans has decreased from eighty thousand years to one hundred years.

original: sngar ni ma yin te sems can yid 'byung ba dka' ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar ni ma yin te sems can yid 'byung ba dka' ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: They do not appear before that, because it is difficult for beings to be disgusted with suffering then.

translated: They do not appear later, because at that time the five degenerations of life expectancy, eon, afflictions, views, and sentient beings are extremely prevalent.

original: gnyis kyis srog dang yo byad rgud par byed la gnyis kyis dge ba'i phyogs rgud par byed cing gcig gis bdag gi dngos po rgud pa ste gzugs tshad dang nad med pa dang stobs dang blo dang dran pa dang brtson 'grus dang brtan pa rnams nyams pa'i @126a
analyzed: gnyis kyis srog dang yo byad rgud par byed la gnyis kyis dge ba'i phyogs rgud par byed cing gcig gis bdag gi dngos po rgud pa ste gzugs tshad dang nad med pa dang stobs dang blo dang dran pa dang brtson 'grus dang brtan pa rnams nyams pa'i @126a
translated: Two cause the degeneration of life and resources. Two cause the degeneration of virtue. One causes the degeneration of one's own entity, that is, the degeneration of form, size, health, strength, intelligence, memory, diligence and firmness.ğŸ”½ğŸ”½

original: * // phyir ro ;
analyzed: * // phyir ro ;
translated: Two diminish life and wealth, two diminish the side of virtue, and one diminishes the substance of the self, because it diminishes form, size, health, strength, intelligence, memory, effort, and firmness.

original: / rang sangs rgyas rnams ni 'phel ba dang 'grib pa la'ang 'byung ngo //
analyzed: / rang sangs rgyas rnams ni 'phel ba dang 'grib pa la'ang 'byung ngo //
translated: Pratyekabuddhas arise in both increasing and decreasing eons.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba rnams ni mi rnams kyi tshe lo dpag tu med pa nas brgyad khri pa'i bar la ste /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba rnams ni mi rnams kyi tshe lo dpag tu med pa nas brgyad khri pa'i bar la ste /
translated: Universal monarchs arise when the lifespan is immeasurable up to when it is 80,000 years.

analyzed: 'og tu ma yin la skye gnas su 'am yang na chu skyes kyi snying por rdzus te skye ba'o //
translated: They are not born in lower realms. They are born miraculously in a lotus flower or in the heart of a lotus flower.

original: de rnams kyang bar snang la 'ongs ba'i gser dang dngul dang zangs dang lcags kyi 'khor lo can gling bzhi dang gsum dang gnyis dang gcig gi bdag po /

translated: They are the lords of the four continents, three continents, two continents, and one continent, possessing a wheel of gold, silver, copper, and iron, respectively.

original: 'khor lo dang glang po dang rta dang nor bu dang bud med dang khyim bdag dang blon po'i rang bzhin gyi rin po che bdun dang ldan pa /
analyzed: 'khor lo dang glang po dang rta dang nor bu dang bud med dang khyim bdag dang blon po'i rang bzhin gyi rin po che bdun dang ldan pa /

analyzed: phas bsu rang 'gro g-yul bshams dang // mtshon brtsams pas rgyal gnod pa med pa ste /
translated: He is victorious without violence, through being welcomed, through going by himself, through arranging a battle, and through taking up arms.

original: mtshon gyis kyang rgyal bar byed cing gnod pa med la /
analyzed: mtshon gyis kyang rgyal bar byed cing gnod pa med la /
translated: He is victorious through taking up arms without violence.

original: rgyal nas sems can dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams la 'god par byed do //
analyzed: rgyal nas sems can dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams la 'god par byed do //
translated: Having been victorious, he establishes sentient beings in the ten wholesome courses of action.

analyzed: gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu dus gcig la 'khor los sgyur ba gnyis 'byung ba med de /
translated: Two universal monarchs do not arise simultaneously in one four-continent world.

original: 'gran zla med pa'i las byas pa'i phyir sangs rgyas bzhin no //
analyzed: 'gran zla med pa'i las byas pa'i phyir sangs rgyas bzhin no //
translated: Because they have created karma that is not to be shared, like the appearance of a buddha.

original: 'o na gcig tu de bzhin gshegs pa gnyis dag lhan cig tu mi 'byung ba ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gcig tu de bzhin gshegs pa gnyis dag lhan cig tu mi 'byung ba ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why do two Tathagatas not appear simultaneously?

original: sku de lta bu tshogs pas gdul bar bya ba'i skye bo mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sku de lta bu tshogs pas gdul bar bya ba'i skye bo mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible for two such bodies to exist simultaneously.

original: gus pa dang rings pa'i don du yang ste sangs rgyas gcig la shin tu gus par 'gyur te 'di 'dra ba rnyed par dka'o zhes sems shing /
analyzed: gus pa dang rings pa'i don du yang ste sangs rgyas gcig la shin tu gus par 'gyur te 'di 'dra ba rnyed par dka'o zhes sems shing /
translated: They are also devoted and quick, for they are devoted to a single Buddha, thinking, This kind of Buddha is difficult to find.

original: 'di gshegs pa'am yongs su mya ngan las 'das na mgon med par 'gyur du 'ong zhes bstan pa sgrub pa la shin tu rings par byed do //
analyzed: 'di gshegs pa'am yongs su mya ngan las 'das na mgon med par 'gyur du 'ong zhes bstan pa sgrub pa la shin tu rings par byed do //
translated: They are quick to practice the teaching, thinking, If he passes away or enters parinirvÄá¹‡a, we will be without a protector.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan rnams na ni sangs rgyas rnams yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan rnams na ni sangs rgyas rnams yod pa nyid de /
translated: Buddhas exist in other world systems.

original: mang po rnams mnyam du tshogs la 'jug pa mthong ba'i phyir dang gcig tu mang po rnams cig car 'byung ba mi rung ba de 'byung ba la gegs ci yang med pas 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan rnams su nges par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mang po rnams mnyam du tshogs la 'jug pa mthong ba'i phyir dang gcig tu mang po rnams cig car 'byung ba mi rung ba de 'byung ba la gegs ci yang med pas 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan rnams su nges par 'byung ngo //
translated: For many are seen entering the assembly together, and it is not possible for many to appear simultaneously in one place. Since there is no obstacle to their appearance, they certainly appear in other world systems.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku mang pos gdul bar bya ba dang / sems can gyi don srid na ni 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu de bzhin gshegs pa mang po rnams cig car 'byung ba 'gal ba med de ye shes kyi nus pa thogs pa med pa nyid na'ang cig car yang sems can gyi don la 'jug pa'i phyir te
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku mang pos gdul bar bya ba dang / sems can gyi don srid na ni 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu de bzhin gshegs pa mang po rnams cig car 'byung ba 'gal ba med de ye shes kyi nus pa thogs pa med pa nyid na'ang cig car yang sems can gyi don la 'jug pa'i phyir te
translated: If the benefit of sentient beings depends on many bodies of a Buddha, then it is not contradictory for many Tathagatas to appear simultaneously in one world system, because even though the power of their exalted wisdom is unobstructed, they still engage in the benefit of sentient beings simultaneously.

original: / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ser sna dang phrag dog la sogs @126b pa'i dri ma dang bral ba dang rgyu mnyam por 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ser sna dang phrag dog la sogs @126b pa'i dri ma dang bral ba dang rgyu mnyam por 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: This is because the Tathagatas are free from the stains of miserliness, jealousy and so on and they engage in the same cause.

original: kha cig na re dus gcig tu de bzhin gshegs pa du ma med de gcig kho nas sems can gyi don bya ba thams cad nus pa'i phyir zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re dus gcig tu de bzhin gshegs pa du ma med de gcig kho nas sems can gyi don bya ba thams cad nus pa'i phyir zhe'o //
translated: Some say: Many Tathagatas do not appear simultaneously because one alone is able to perform all the activities that benefit sentient beings.

original: rtag tu sangs rgyas gcig nyid de de kho nas sku tshe mtha' yas par byin gyis rlob par nus pa'i phyir ro zhes cis mi 'dod /
analyzed: rtag tu sangs rgyas gcig nyid de de kho nas sku tshe mtha' yas par byin gyis rlob par nus pa'i phyir ro zhes cis mi 'dod /
translated: Why not assert that there is always only one Buddha, since he alone is able to bless his lifespan to be limitless?

original: rgyu'i stobs las gzhan rnams kyang 'byung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu'i stobs las gzhan rnams kyang 'byung ngo zhe na /
translated: The others arise from the power of causes.ğŸ”½If that is so, then at one time, from the power of causes alone, infinite Tathagatas would appear in infinite world-realms. What is the contradiction?

original: de ltar na rgyu'i stobs nyid las 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa rnams su de bzhin gshegs pa mtha' yas pa cig car 'gyur bas 'gal ba ci yod rim gyis ni 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu yang de rnams 'byung ba gnas pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de ltar na rgyu'i stobs nyid las 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa rnams su de bzhin gshegs pa mtha' yas pa cig car 'gyur bas 'gal ba ci yod rim gyis ni 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu yang de rnams 'byung ba gnas pa kho na'o //
translated: If they appear gradually, then it is impossible for them to appear even in one world-realm.

original: byung ba de rnams ni yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byung ba de rnams ni yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those who have appeared do not enter parinirvana.

original: chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dag gis yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dag gis yod pa kho na'o //
translated: They exist only through the Dharma Body and the Complete Enjoyment Body.

original: bsod nams dang mi ldan pa rnams la snang bar mi 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig yin gyi bsod nams chung ba'am che ba ji lta bar yang dag par dmigs so //
analyzed: bsod nams dang mi ldan pa rnams la snang bar mi 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig yin gyi bsod nams chung ba'am che ba ji lta bar yang dag par dmigs so //
translated: They are only not seen by those who do not have merit. They are perceived correctly by those who have merit, whether small or great.

original: 'o na 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa dag 'jig rten gyi khams ci tsam du 'dod ce na stong gsum mo //
analyzed: 'o na 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa dag 'jig rten gyi khams ci tsam du 'dod ce na stong gsum mo //
translated: How many world-realms are included in the desire of the Tathagatas here? Three thousand world-systems.

original: gzhan rnams na re gling bzhi pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: gzhan rnams na re gling bzhi pa'o zhes so //
translated: Others say four continents.

original: de la mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus te dbang po rnams dang gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya ste /
analyzed: de la mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus te dbang po rnams dang gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya ste /
translated: The faculties are the eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body.ğŸ”½ğŸ”½The objects are form, sound, smell, taste, and tactility.

original: yul rnams dang bcu gzugs kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: yul rnams dang bcu gzugs kyi phung po'o //
translated: The eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body faculties, and the objects of form, sound, smell, taste, and tangible objects are the form aggregate.

original: gzhan na re rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'ang ngo zhes so //
analyzed: gzhan na re rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'ang ngo zhes so //
translated: Others say that non-revealing form is also included in the form aggregate.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis te 'byung ba rnams dang 'byung ba las gyur pa rnams so //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis te 'byung ba rnams dang 'byung ba las gyur pa rnams so //
translated: That is also of two types: the elements and those derived from the elements.

original: de la 'byung ba chen po bzhi rnams ni sa dang chu dang me dang rlung gi khams te reg bya'i nang du 'dus so //
analyzed: de la 'byung ba chen po bzhi rnams ni sa dang chu dang me dang rlung gi khams te reg bya'i nang du 'dus so //
translated: The four great elements are the earth, water, fire, and wind elements, which are included in the tactile base.

original: lhag ma'i reg bya ni 'jam pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma'i reg bya ni 'jam pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: The remaining tactile objects are smoothness, roughness, and so on.

original: mig la sogs pa bcu rnams 'byung ba las gyur pa kho na ste 'byung ba rnams la yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa bcu rnams 'byung ba las gyur pa kho na ste 'byung ba rnams la yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The ten such as the eye are only derived from the elements because they exist in dependence on the elements.

original: dper na rtsva dang shing la sogs pa rgyur byas nas yod pa khyim dang bud shing rgyur byas nas me bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na rtsva dang shing la sogs pa rgyur byas nas yod pa khyim dang bud shing rgyur byas nas me bzhin te /
translated: For example, they are like a house that exists in dependence on grass, wood, and so on, and like fire that exists in dependence on fuel.

original: de bzhin du 'byung ba rnams la brten nas mig la sogs pa nye bar skye ba ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'byung ba rnams la brten nas mig la sogs pa nye bar skye ba ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs zhes brjod do //
translated: Likewise, the eye, etc. which are produced in dependence on the elements are called derived form.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gang gi tshe 'byung ba chen po rnams gzugs brnyan bzhin rang bzhin med pa de'i tshe de'i rgyu can 'byung ba las gyur pa mig dang gzugs la sogs pa rang bzhin med pa nyid du bde blag tu rtogs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gang gi tshe 'byung ba chen po rnams gzugs brnyan bzhin rang bzhin med pa de'i tshe de'i rgyu can 'byung ba las gyur pa mig dang gzugs la sogs pa rang bzhin med pa nyid du bde blag tu rtogs so //
translated: Therefore, when the great elements are without intrinsic nature like a reflection, then it is easily understood that the eye, form, etc. which are caused by the elements are also without intrinsic nature.

original: gzhan yang 'dod pa'i khams su dbang po las phyi rol pa ni rdul phra rab kyi rdzas brgyad par skye'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'dod pa'i khams su dbang po las phyi rol pa ni rdul phra rab kyi rdzas brgyad par skye'o //
translated: Moreover, in the desire realm, external to the faculties, the substance of the atom is produced with eight substances.

original: de la rdzas brgyad rnams ni 'di lta ste 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg bya rnams so //
analyzed: de la rdzas brgyad rnams ni 'di lta ste 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg bya rnams so //
translated: The eight substances are the four great elements and form, smell, taste, and texture.

original: nang gi bdag nyid lus kyi dbang po can ni rdzas dgu pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid lus kyi dbang po can ni rdzas dgu pa'o //
translated: The internal body faculty is produced with nine substances.

original: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po can ni dbang po gzhan ldan te rdzas bcu pa'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po can ni dbang po gzhan ldan te rdzas bcu pa'o //
translated: The eye faculty, etc. are produced with ten substances, since they possess another faculty.

original: sgra dang bcas pa ni slar yang 'di rnams rdul phra rab kyi rdzas dgu dang bcu pa dang bcu gcig par skye'o //
analyzed: sgra dang bcas pa ni slar yang 'di rnams rdul phra rab kyi rdzas dgu dang bcu pa dang bcu gcig par skye'o //
translated: The sound is the nine substances of the atom, plus the tenth, and the eleventh.

original: de la rdzas brgyad pa'i rdul phra rab la rdzas brgyad po de rnams se 'bru'i sa bon ltar rang bzhin so sor rnam par gnas pa ni med do //
analyzed: de la rdzas brgyad pa'i rdul phra rab la rdzas brgyad po de rnams se 'bru'i sa bon ltar rang bzhin so sor rnam par gnas pa ni med do //
translated: The atom with eight substances does not have the eight substances existing separately, like the seeds of the myrobalan fruit.

original: 'o na ci zhe na btung ba la sogs pa la ko la dang ku lad tha dad bu ram dang bse yab la sogs pa'i khu ba bzhin 'dres par gyur nas rnam par gnas so //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na btung ba la sogs pa la ko la dang ku lad tha dad bu ram dang bse yab la sogs pa'i khu ba bzhin 'dres par gyur nas rnam par gnas so //
translated: What is it like? It is like the juice of sugar cane, or the juice of the date palm, etc., mixed with water.

original: de la @127b rdul phra rab la re re'ang rdzas bdun bdun las tha dad par ma grub pa nyid kyi phyir rang bzhin grub pa med de /
analyzed: de la @127b rdul phra rab la re re'ang rdzas bdun bdun las tha dad par ma grub pa nyid kyi phyir rang bzhin grub pa med de /
translated: In that case, since each atom is not established as different from the seven substances, it has no established nature.

original: phan tshun ltos pa nyid kyis skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun ltos pa nyid kyis skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it arises by mutual dependence.

original: rnam pa thams cad du med pa yang ma yin te re re'ang rdzas bdun bdun rnams rgyur byas nas nye bar dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du med pa yang ma yin te re re'ang rdzas bdun bdun rnams rgyur byas nas nye bar dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not completely nonexistent, because each is observed as the cause of the seven substances.

original: rigs pa 'di rdzas bcu dang bcu gcig gi rdul phra rab rnams la yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs pa 'di rdzas bcu dang bcu gcig gi rdul phra rab rnams la yang shes par bya'o //
translated: This reasoning should be understood in regard to the atoms of the ten or eleven substances.

original: de ltar dbang po dang yul rnams gzugs brnyan lta bu'o //
analyzed: de ltar dbang po dang yul rnams gzugs brnyan lta bu'o //
translated: Thus, the sense faculties and the objects are like reflections.

original: de las skyes pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba yang ste gzugs brnyan dang 'dra ba'i rten dang dmigs pa las skyes pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de las skyes pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba yang ste gzugs brnyan dang 'dra ba'i rten dang dmigs pa las skyes pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The mind and mental factors that arise from them are also like reflections, because they arise from a support and an object that are like reflections.

original: gzhan yang ji ltar 'byung ba chen po rnams phan tshun ltos nas skye ba nyid kyi phyir rang bzhin grub pa med pa de bzhin du sems dang sems las byung ba yang ste phan tshun gyi stobs las bskyed pas grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang ji ltar 'byung ba chen po rnams phan tshun ltos nas skye ba nyid kyi phyir rang bzhin grub pa med pa de bzhin du sems dang sems las byung ba yang ste phan tshun gyi stobs las bskyed pas grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, just as the great elements are not established by nature because they arise in mutual dependence, so too the mind and mental factors are not established by nature because they are produced by the power of each other.

original: rang bzhin pa rnams ni gzugs brnyan lta bu nyid la shin tu mi 'jug go //
analyzed: rang bzhin pa rnams ni gzugs brnyan lta bu nyid la shin tu mi 'jug go //
translated: The essentialists do not at all engage with the fact that they are like reflections.

original: de bzhin du mtshon cha dang mtshan nyid la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mtshon cha dang mtshan nyid la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to weapons and characteristics.

original: de las ni mkhrang ba nyid dang mkhregs pa nyid dang sra ba nyid de 'dzin pa'i las can no //
analyzed: de las ni mkhrang ba nyid dang mkhregs pa nyid dang sra ba nyid de 'dzin pa'i las can no //
translated: From it, solidity, hardness, and resistance arise.

original: chu'i khams ni gsher ba nyid dang snum pa nyid de sdud pa'i las can no //
analyzed: chu'i khams ni gsher ba nyid dang snum pa nyid de sdud pa'i las can no //
translated: The water element is fluidity and cohesion; its function is to hold together.

original: me ni dro ba nyid de smin pa nyid dang skems pa'i las can no //
analyzed: me ni dro ba nyid de smin pa nyid dang skems pa'i las can no //
translated: Fire is heat; its function is to mature and evaporate.

original: rlung ni yang zhing g-yo ba nyid de 'phel ba dang 'gro bar byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: rlung ni yang zhing g-yo ba nyid de 'phel ba dang 'gro bar byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Wind is motion; its function is to increase and move.

original: 'di ltar 'phel ba ni cha shas lhag po bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'phel ba ni cha shas lhag po bskyed pa'o //
translated: Increase is the production of a surplus.

original: 'byung ba chen po 'di rnams kyi yang gcig gang na yod pa de na lhag ma rnams te /ğŸ”½gang gi phyir rdo la sogs pa sa'i rdzas la sdud pa la sogs pa'i las mthong ba las chu dang me dang rlung rnams yod pa nyid du rjes su dpag go //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po 'di rnams kyi yang gcig gang na yod pa de na lhag ma rnams te / gang gi phyir rdo la sogs pa sa'i rdzas la sdud pa la sogs pa'i las mthong ba las chu dang me dang rlung rnams yod pa nyid du rjes su dpag go //
translated: Wherever one of the great elements is found, there are the others.ğŸ”½In earth, which is the substance of solidity, the functions of cohesion, etc., are seen, and the existence of water, fire, and wind is inferred.

original: chu la gru 'dzin pa dang dro ba dang 'bab pa mthong ba'i phyir sa dang me dang rlung rnams so //
analyzed: chu la gru 'dzin pa dang dro ba dang 'bab pa mthong ba'i phyir sa dang me dang rlung rnams so //
translated: In water, which is the substance of fluidity, the functions of supporting, heat, and motion are seen, and the existence of earth, fire, and wind is inferred.

original: me 'bar ba la bstan pa dang gong bur 'dril ba dang g-yo ba mthong ba'i phyir sa dang chu dang rlung rnams so //
analyzed: me 'bar ba la bstan pa dang gong bur 'dril ba dang g-yo ba mthong ba'i phyir sa dang chu dang rlung rnams so //
translated: Earth, water, and wind are seen because of the appearance of fire, the compact form, and movement.

original: rlung la 'dzin pa dang grang ba dang dro ba'i reg pa mthong ba'i las sa dang chu dang me rnams so //
analyzed: rlung la 'dzin pa dang grang ba dang dro ba'i reg pa mthong ba'i las sa dang chu dang me rnams so //
translated: Earth, water, and fire are seen because of the function of holding, cold, and heat in the wind.ğŸ”½Space exists as the greatest, but it is not an element, because it is uncompounded, and it does not generate the specific characteristics of common and uncommon karma.

original: nam mkha' ni chen po nyid du yod mod 'byung ba nyid ni ma yin te 'dus ma byas pa nyid kyis na thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa'i las kyi khyad par bskyed pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes pas nam mkha' 'byung ba chen po mağŸ”½yin no // mig gi dbang po ni mig gi zlum @128a * //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni chen po nyid du yod mod 'byung ba nyid ni ma yin te 'dus ma byas pa nyid kyis na thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa'i las kyi khyad par bskyed pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes pas nam mkha' 'byung ba chen po ma yin no // mig gi dbang po ni mig gi zlum @128a * //
translated: Therefore space is not an element.

original: skor na mig 'bras kyi nang na gnas pa mi mthong ba rgun 'brum gyi 'bras bu'i tshad tsam pa zi ra'i me tog dang 'dra bar gnas pa shin tu dang ba'i pags pas g-yogs pa'o //
analyzed: skor na mig 'bras kyi nang na gnas pa mi mthong ba rgun 'brum gyi 'bras bu'i tshad tsam pa zi ra'i me tog dang 'dra bar gnas pa shin tu dang ba'i pags pas g-yogs pa'o //
translated: The eye faculty is not seen in the eye socket, but it is located in the eye, like a grape, the size of a grape, and it is located like a jasmine flower, covered by a very clear skin.

original: rna ba'i dbang po ni gro ga gcus pa lta bu rna ba'i nang na gnas pa'o //ğŸ”½sna'i dbang po ni dril bu'i nang gi lce lta bu'o //
analyzed: rna ba'i dbang po ni gro ga gcus pa lta bu rna ba'i nang na gnas pa'o // sna'i dbang po ni dril bu'i nang gi lce lta bu'o //
translated: The ear sense-faculty is located in the interior of the bhÅ«rja-like cavities of the ears.ğŸ”½The nose sense-faculty is like two thistledown pellets.

original: lce'i dbang po ni zla ba phyed pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: lce'i dbang po ni zla ba phyed pa lta bu'o //
translated: The tongue sense-faculty is like a half-moon.

original: lus kyi dbang po ni lus lta bur gnas so //
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po ni lus lta bur gnas so //
translated: The body sense-faculty is like the body.

original: lnga po 'di rnams rang gi don dmigs pa la dbang byed pa nyid kyi phyir dbang po rnams so //
analyzed: lnga po 'di rnams rang gi don dmigs pa la dbang byed pa nyid kyi phyir dbang po rnams so //
translated: These five are sense-faculties because they exercise controlling power with regard to the perception of their own objects.

original: gzugs kyi skye mched ni kha dog dang dbyibs shes pa rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye mched ni kha dog dang dbyibs shes pa rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: The visible-form sense-sphere is twofold: color and shape.

original: kha dog ni sngon po dang ser po dang dmar po dang dkar po dang sprin dang du ba dang rdul dang khug rna dang grib ma dang nyi 'od dang snang ba dang chun pa'o //
analyzed: kha dog ni sngon po dang ser po dang dmar po dang dkar po dang sprin dang du ba dang rdul dang khug rna dang grib ma dang nyi 'od dang snang ba dang chun pa'o //
translated: Color is blue, yellow, red, white, cloud, smoke, dust, mist, shadow, sunshine, light, and darkness.

original: dbyibs ni ring po dang thung du dang lham pa dang zlum po dang mthon po dang dma' ba dang / dbyibs mnyam pa dang dbyibs mi mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: dbyibs ni ring po dang thung du dang lham pa dang zlum po dang mthon po dang dma' ba dang / dbyibs mnyam pa dang dbyibs mi mnyam pa'o //
translated: Shape is long, short, square, round, high, low, even, and uneven.

original: nyi 'od ni nyi ma'i 'od de ;
analyzed: nyi 'od ni nyi ma'i 'od de ;
translated: Sunshine is the light of the sun.

original: / snang ba ni zla ba dang skar ma dang me dang sman dang nor bu rnams kyi 'od do //
analyzed: / snang ba ni zla ba dang skar ma dang me dang sman dang nor bu rnams kyi 'od do //
translated: Light is the radiance of the moon, stars, fire, gems, and medicinal herbs.

original: sgra ni zin pa dang ma zin pa dang gnyis ka'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu can no //
analyzed: sgra ni zin pa dang ma zin pa dang gnyis ka'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu can no //
translated: Sound is caused by the great elements that are appropriated, unappropriated, and both.

original: zin pa ni sems dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: zin pa ni sems dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The appropriated are those that are associated with mind.

original: ma zin pa ni sen mo dang skra la sogs pa gang gcad pa la nad med pa'o //
analyzed: ma zin pa ni sen mo dang skra la sogs pa gang gcad pa la nad med pa'o //
translated: The unappropriated are those that are not associated with mind, such as the sound of wood or bamboo splitting.

original: dri ni gsal lo ;
analyzed: dri ni gsal lo ;
translated: Smell is clear.

original: / ro ni rnam pa drug ste mngar ba dang sgyur ba dang lan tshva dang tsha ba dang kha ba dang bska ba'i bye brag gis so //
analyzed: / ro ni rnam pa drug ste mngar ba dang sgyur ba dang lan tshva dang tsha ba dang kha ba dang bska ba'i bye brag gis so //
translated: Taste is of six kinds: sweet, sour, salty, pungent, bitter, and astringent.

original: reg bya ni bcu gcig gi bdag nyid de 'byung ba chen po bzhi rnams dang / 'jam pa nyid dang / rtsub pa nyid dang / lci ba nyid dang / yang ba nyid dang / grang ba dang / bkres pa dang skam pa'o //
analyzed: reg bya ni bcu gcig gi bdag nyid de 'byung ba chen po bzhi rnams dang / 'jam pa nyid dang / rtsub pa nyid dang / lci ba nyid dang / yang ba nyid dang / grang ba dang / bkres pa dang skam pa'o //
translated: Touch is of eleven kinds: the four great elements, smoothness, roughness, heaviness, lightness, cold, hunger, and thirst.

original: lto ba'i nang gi gang lus kyi dbang pos reg par bya ba de bkres pa ste bza' ba mngon par 'dod par byed pa dang / skom pa ni btung ba mngon par 'dod pa ste rgyu las 'bras bu btags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lto ba'i nang gi gang lus kyi dbang pos reg par bya ba de bkres pa ste bza' ba mngon par 'dod par byed pa dang / skom pa ni btung ba mngon par 'dod pa ste rgyu las 'bras bu btags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Hunger is that which causes the desire to eat, which is the object of the body faculty that is in the stomach. Thirst is the desire to drink, which is the desire for water. The cause is designated by the effect.

original: chu dang me'i khams shas che ba'i 'byung ba 'dus na 'jam pa nyid do //
analyzed: chu dang me'i khams shas che ba'i 'byung ba 'dus na 'jam pa nyid do //
translated: When the elements are combined with a predominance of the water and fire elements, there is smoothness.

original: sa dang rlung shas chen rtsub pa nyid do //
analyzed: sa dang rlung shas chen rtsub pa nyid do //
translated: When the earth and wind elements predominate, there is roughness.

original: sa dang chu shas che na lci ba nyid do //
analyzed: sa dang chu shas che na lci ba nyid do //
translated: When the earth and water elements predominate, there is heaviness.

original: me dang rlung shas che na yang ba nyid do //
analyzed: me dang rlung shas che na yang ba nyid do //
translated: When the fire and wind elements predominate, there is lightness.

original: chu dang rlung shas che na grang ba'o //
analyzed: chu dang rlung shas che na grang ba'o //
translated: When the water and wind elements predominate, there is cold.

original: rlung shas che na bkres so //
analyzed: rlung shas che na bkres so //
translated: When the wind element predominates, there is hunger.ğŸ”½When the fire and wind elements predominate, there is thirst.

original: me dang rlung shas che na skom pa'o zhes pa dbang po lnga'i yul rnams so //
analyzed: me dang rlung shas che na skom pa'o zhes pa dbang po lnga'i yul rnams so //
translated: These are the objects of the five faculties.

original: de la mig la sogs pa lnga rnams @128b ni rang gi 'bras bu rnam par shes pa las rjes su dpag par bya ba nyid kyi phyir yid kyi rnam par shes pas rnam par shes par bya ba kho na'o //
analyzed: de la mig la sogs pa lnga rnams @128b ni rang gi 'bras bu rnam par shes pa las rjes su dpag par bya ba nyid kyi phyir yid kyi rnam par shes pas rnam par shes par bya ba kho na'o //
translated: The five beginning with the eye are to be inferred from their effect, i.e., consciousness, and therefore are to be known by the mental consciousness alone.

original: gzugs la sogs pa lnga rnams ni mig la sogs pa lnga'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyis rnam par shes par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa lnga rnams ni mig la sogs pa lnga'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyis rnam par shes par bya ba'o //
translated: The five beginning with form are to be known by the five beginning with the eye consciousness.

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni dngos por yod pa ma yin no zhes sngar bsgrubs zin to //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni dngos por yod pa ma yin no zhes sngar bsgrubs zin to //
translated: Non-informative form does not exist as a thing, as was previously established.

original: de'i phyir bcu po nyid gzugs su rung /
analyzed: de'i phyir bcu po nyid gzugs su rung /
translated: Therefore, only the ten are suitable as form.

original: gang rnams gang du gnod par bya ba dang thogs par bya ba'o zhes pas thogs pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs rnams so //
analyzed: gang rnams gang du gnod par bya ba dang thogs par bya ba'o zhes pas thogs pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs rnams so //
translated: They are the forms that are obstructive and resistant, i.e., that which obstructs and is obstructed.

original: de rnams kyi phung po ni gzugs kyi phung por bshad do //
analyzed: de rnams kyi phung po ni gzugs kyi phung por bshad do //
translated: The aggregate of those is explained as the form aggregate.

original: tshim par bya ba dang yongs su gdung bar byed pa dang de gnyis las rnam par grol ba'i yul gyi rang gi ngo bo mngon sum du bya bas yul nyams su myong ba rnam par shes pa'i nyams su myong ba rig pa ni tshor ba zhes brjod do
analyzed: tshim par bya ba dang yongs su gdung bar byed pa dang de gnyis las rnam par grol ba'i yul gyi rang gi ngo bo mngon sum du bya bas yul nyams su myong ba rnam par shes pa'i nyams su myong ba rig pa ni tshor ba zhes brjod do
translated: The experience of the object is the experience of consciousness, which is called feeling vedana, because it is the direct experience of the nature of the object, which is the cause of satisfaction, frustration, or neither.

original: // de la bye brag smra ba rnams na re sems ni gtso bo yin la sems las byung ba rnams ma yin no //
analyzed: // de la bye brag smra ba rnams na re sems ni gtso bo yin la sems las byung ba rnams ma yin no //
translated: Vaibhasikas say: Mind is primary, mental factors are not.

original: de rnams ni sems kyi 'di rnams sam sems la yod pa rnams yin pas sems kyi bya ba'i rang bzhin te tha dad du grub bo //
analyzed: de rnams ni sems kyi 'di rnams sam sems la yod pa rnams yin pas sems kyi bya ba'i rang bzhin te tha dad du grub bo //
translated: They are the activities of mind, existing in the mind, and they are established as distinct.

original: chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i dus su ni shes rab sems las byung ba cha shas kyang gsal la /
analyzed: chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i dus su ni shes rab sems las byung ba cha shas kyang gsal la /
translated: When phenomena are thoroughly differentiated, the mental factor of wisdom is also clear.

original: la la la lar chos gtso bo ste /
analyzed: la la la lar chos gtso bo ste /
translated: Sometimes, phenomena are primary.

original: dper na mngon par yid ches pa'i dus na dad pa la sogs pa zag pa med pa'i phung po lnga'i tshogs pa lta bu'o zhes so //
analyzed: dper na mngon par yid ches pa'i dus na dad pa la sogs pa zag pa med pa'i phung po lnga'i tshogs pa lta bu'o zhes so //
translated: For example, when one has full conviction, the five uncontaminated aggregates are a collection of faith and so on.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa pa rnams na re sems kyi bya ba'i rang bzhin sems kyi gnas skabs kyi khyad par sems las byung ba ste sems las tha dad pa ma yin no zhes so //ğŸ”½dbu ma pa rnams na re kun rdzob tu ma brtags na nyams dga' ba nyid kyi phyir ji lta ba de lta ste kha cig tu de nyid dang 'ga' zhig tu gzhan nyid lta bu tha snyad byed la don dam par ni de nyid dang gzhan nyid du
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa pa rnams na re sems kyi bya ba'i rang bzhin sems kyi gnas skabs kyi khyad par sems las byung ba ste sems las tha dad pa ma yin no zhes so // dbu ma pa rnams na re kun rdzob tu ma brtags na nyams dga' ba nyid kyi phyir ji lta ba de lta ste kha cig tu de nyid dang 'ga' zhig tu gzhan nyid lta bu tha snyad byed la don dam par ni de nyid dang gzhan nyid du
translated: The YogÄcÄras say that mental activities are the special states of mind, and are not different from mind.

original: yang mi rigs so //
analyzed: yang mi rigs so //
translated: The Madhyamikas say that conventionally, when not analyzed, they are just that, since they are pleasant to experience. They are described as being the same or different, as appropriate. But ultimately, it is not tenable that they are the same or different.

original: tshor ba de yang lus kyi dang sems kyi'o //
analyzed: tshor ba de yang lus kyi dang sems kyi'o //
translated: Feeling is also bodily and mental.

original: slar yang rnam pa gsum ste bdag dang sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: slar yang rnam pa gsum ste bdag dang sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is also threefold: related to the faculties of pleasure, pain, and neither pleasure nor pain.

original: slar yang rnam pa lnga ste bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba dang btang snyoms kyi dbang po rnams so //
analyzed: slar yang rnam pa lnga ste bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba dang btang snyoms kyi dbang po rnams so //
translated: It is also fivefold: related to the faculties of pleasure, pain, mental pleasure, mental pain, and indifference.

original: de la gzugs can gyi dbang po la brten pa'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / @129a * //
analyzed: de la gzugs can gyi dbang po la brten pa'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / @129a * //
translated: The first is concomitant with the consciousness that depends on a physical sense faculty.ğŸ”½

original: bsam gtan gsum pa na yid kyi yang ste sim pa'i tshor ba ni bde ba'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa na yid kyi yang ste sim pa'i tshor ba ni bde ba'i dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of pleasure is the pleasant feeling that is associated with the consciousness of the five sense faculties and the mental faculty in the third absorption.

original: gzugs can gyi dbang po'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa sim pa ma yin pa'i tshor ba ni sdug bsngal gyi phung po'o //
analyzed: gzugs can gyi dbang po'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa sim pa ma yin pa'i tshor ba ni sdug bsngal gyi phung po'o //
translated: The faculty of pain is the unpleasant feeling that is associated with the consciousness of the five sense faculties.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa tshim pa'i tshor ba ni bde ba'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa tshim pa'i tshor ba ni bde ba'i dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of pleasure is the pleasant feeling that is associated with mental consciousness.

original: yid nyid tshim pa ma yin pa ni yid mi bde ba'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: yid nyid tshim pa ma yin pa ni yid mi bde ba'i dbang po'o //

analyzed: thams cad kyi nyid sim pa yang ma yin sim pa ma yin pa yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba ni btang snyoms kyi dbang po'o //
translated: Mental pleasure and mental pain are feelings that are associated with mental consciousness.

original: gang gi phyir sems kyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal phal cher rnam par rtog pa las skyes shing lus kyi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems kyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal phal cher rnam par rtog pa las skyes shing lus kyi ni ma yin te /

original: yul gyi dbang las dgra bcom pa rnams la yang skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul gyi dbang las dgra bcom pa rnams la yang skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they arise in the Arhats from the power of the object.ğŸ”½They are also of six types, from those that arise from eye contact to those that arise from mind contact.

original: slar yang rnam pa drug ste mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba nas yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba ji srid pa'i bar ro zhes pa tshor ba'i phung po brjod zin to //
analyzed: slar yang rnam pa drug ste mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba nas yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba ji srid pa'i bar ro zhes pa tshor ba'i phung po brjod zin to //
translated: The aggregate of feeling has been discussed.

original: 'dir bum pa dang snam bu dang gzugs la sogs pa 'dus byas rnams la 'dus byas su thun mong ba nyid na'ang so so rang gi rgyu dang rkyen rnams la khyad par yod do //
analyzed: 'dir bum pa dang snam bu dang gzugs la sogs pa 'dus byas rnams la 'dus byas su thun mong ba nyid na'ang so so rang gi rgyu dang rkyen rnams la khyad par yod do //
translated: Here, in regard to conditioned things such as pots, cloth, form, etc., although they are all alike in being conditioned, there is a difference in their individual causes and conditions.

original: de'i khyad par las kyang lto ldir ba la sogs pa'i phan tshun khyad par yod do //
analyzed: de'i khyad par las kyang lto ldir ba la sogs pa'i phan tshun khyad par yod do //
translated: And from the difference in those, there is a difference in their individual characteristics, such as bulbous, etc.

original: khyad par de nyid mtshan ma zhes brjod de das don rnams khyad par du rjes su dpag par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par de nyid mtshan ma zhes brjod de das don rnams khyad par du rjes su dpag par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: That difference is called a sign because by it, one infers the difference in the objects.

original: bum pa nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan ma de sems las byung ba'i chos gang gis 'dzin pa dang 'du shes pa dang yongs su gcod par byed pa de ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid 'du shes zhes brjod do //
analyzed: bum pa nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan ma de sems las byung ba'i chos gang gis 'dzin pa dang 'du shes pa dang yongs su gcod par byed pa de ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid 'du shes zhes brjod do //
translated: The mental factor that apprehends, conceives, and determines the sign of a vase, etc., is called conception that has the nature of apprehending signs.

original: 'di la bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i ming dang lhan cig don gcig la 'jug pa'i 'du shes ni ming gi don gsal bar byed cing 'du shes kyis shes par byed do //
analyzed: 'di la bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i ming dang lhan cig don gcig la 'jug pa'i 'du shes ni ming gi don gsal bar byed cing 'du shes kyis shes par byed do //
translated: Vaibhasikas say: Conception that engages one object simultaneously with a nonassociated name clarifies the meaning of the name and causes it to be understood by conception.

original: de ni ming dang mtshan ma dang don gyi brdas shes pa rnams kyi gsal ba ste /
analyzed: de ni ming dang mtshan ma dang don gyi brdas shes pa rnams kyi gsal ba ste /
translated: It clarifies the objects of knowledge of names, signs and meanings.

original: de rnams dag las ming nges par byed cing ming las kyang don no //
analyzed: de rnams dag las ming nges par byed cing ming las kyang don no //
translated: It causes the ascertainment of names from them and the ascertainment of objects from names.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ngag ming la 'jug cing ming gis don gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ngag ming la 'jug cing ming gis don gsal bar byed do //
translated: Therefore speech engages names and names clarify objects.

original: brda la ma byad ba ni mi gsal ba'i 'du shes kyis ming gis don rtogs par mi byed la /
analyzed: brda la ma byad ba ni mi gsal ba'i 'du shes kyis ming gis don rtogs par mi byed la /
translated: Those who are not familiar with the conventions of names do not understand objects through names due to unclear conception.

original: ming gis don rtogs su 'jug par yang mi byed do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ming gis don rtogs su 'jug par yang mi byed do zhes zer ro //
translated: It does not cause the understanding of the meaning through the name.

original: de yang gzhan du rnam par dpyad zin to //
analyzed: de yang gzhan du rnam par dpyad zin to //
translated: This has already been analyzed elsewhere.

original: rigs pa ni //
analyzed: rigs pa ni //
translated: The reasoning is as follows:

original: phyi rol du'am yid @129b la'ang rung ste gang du'ang sgra dang 'dres med la //
analyzed: phyi rol du'am yid @129b la'ang rung ste gang du'ang sgra dang 'dres med la //
translated: Whether externally or internally, the meaning is not mixed with the sound.

original: slar yang yi ge'i rnam pa dang 'dres don gyi rnam pa cung zad spro //
analyzed: slar yang yi ge'i rnam pa dang 'dres don gyi rnam pa cung zad spro //
translated: Moreover, the aspect of the meaning is slightly expanded, mixed with the aspect of the letters.

original: mi bden bdag nyid du gnas gang yang blo nyid kyis zhen pa //
analyzed: mi bden bdag nyid du gnas gang yang blo nyid kyis zhen pa //
translated: Whatever remains with an unreal nature is conceived by the mind itself.

original: de dag phyi rol dang ni ngag la nges par 'dzin te de phyir rnam par rtog par gzhag / ces so //
analyzed: de dag phyi rol dang ni ngag la nges par 'dzin te de phyir rnam par rtog par gzhag / ces so //
translated: They apprehend it as external and in speech. Therefore, it is posited as conceptualization.

original: 'du shes de yang rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: 'du shes de yang rnam pa drug ste /
translated: That conception is also of six types:

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i par ro zhes pa 'du shes kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i par ro zhes pa 'du shes kyi phung po'o //
translated: Conjoined with eye consciousness up to conjoined with mental consciousness. This is the aggregate of conception.

original: 'du byed kyi phung po ni sems byung ste /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po ni sems byung ste /
translated: The aggregate of formation is mental factors.

original: de las tshor ba dang 'du shes dag byung ste rtsod pa'i rtsa ba nyid dang 'khor ba'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir phung po logs su byas so //
analyzed: de las tshor ba dang 'du shes dag byung ste rtsod pa'i rtsa ba nyid dang 'khor ba'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir phung po logs su byas so //
translated: Feeling and conception are separate aggregates because they are the root of dispute and the cause of cyclic existence.

original: rtsod pa'i rtsa ba ni gnyis te 'dod pa la lhag par chags pa dang lta ba la lhag par chags pa'o //
analyzed: rtsod pa'i rtsa ba ni gnyis te 'dod pa la lhag par chags pa dang lta ba la lhag par chags pa'o //
translated: There are two roots of dispute: attachment to sense objects and attachment to views.

original: de dag gi gtso bo'i rgyu ni go rims bzhin du tshor ba dang 'du shes dag go //
analyzed: de dag gi gtso bo'i rgyu ni go rims bzhin du tshor ba dang 'du shes dag go //
translated: Feeling and conception are the principal causes of those, respectively.

original: 'khor ba'i rgyur gyur pa yang de dag ste tshor ba la chags pa dang 'du shes phyin ci log par 'khor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rgyur gyur pa yang de dag ste tshor ba la chags pa dang 'du shes phyin ci log par 'khor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are also the cause of cyclic existence, because one transmigrates due to attachment to feeling and due to the error of conception.

original: de las gzhan pa'i sems las byung ba rnams ni sems pa dang reg pa dang yid la byed pa dang 'dun pa dang mos pa dang dad pa dang brtson 'grus dang dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab dang rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bag yod
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i sems las byung ba rnams ni sems pa dang reg pa dang yid la byed pa dang 'dun pa dang mos pa dang dad pa dang brtson 'grus dang dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab dang rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bag yod
translated: Other mental factors are volition, contact, attention, aspiration, resolution, faith, effort, mindfulness, concentration, wisdom, conceptuality, investigation, and vigilance.

original: pa dang bag med pa dang / yid 'byung ba dang / dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang shin tu sbyangs pa ma yin pa dang / rnam par 'tsho ba dang rnam par mi 'tsho ba dang / ngo tsha dang khrel yod pa dang btang snyoms dang rnam par grol ba dang dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams dang mi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams dang lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba rnams dang /
analyzed: pa dang bag med pa dang / yid 'byung ba dang / dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang shin tu sbyangs pa ma yin pa dang / rnam par 'tsho ba dang rnam par mi 'tsho ba dang / ngo tsha dang khrel yod pa dang btang snyoms dang rnam par grol ba dang dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams dang mi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams dang lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba rnams dang /
translated: roots of virtue, roots of nonvirtue, neutral roots,ğŸ”½fetters, bonds,ğŸ”½anusayas, secondary afflictions, entanglements,ğŸ”½contaminants, floods, bonds, appropriators, knots,

original: kun du sbyor ba rnams dang 'ching ba rnams dang / phra rgyas rnams dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang kun nas dkris pa rnams dang / zag pa rnams dang chu bo rnams dang sbyor ba rnams dang nye bar len pa rnams dang mdud pa rnams dang sgrib pa rnams dang shes pa rnams dang bzod pa rnams te 'du byed rnams so //
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba rnams dang 'ching ba rnams dang / phra rgyas rnams dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang kun nas dkris pa rnams dang / zag pa rnams dang chu bo rnams dang sbyor ba rnams dang nye bar len pa rnams dang mdud pa rnams dang sgrib pa rnams dang shes pa rnams dang bzod pa rnams te 'du byed rnams so //
translated: obscurations, knowledges, and acceptances.

original: de la sems pa ni sems mngon par 'du byed pa yid kyi las te /
analyzed: de la sems pa ni sems mngon par 'du byed pa yid kyi las te /
translated: Mental attention is the mental action that is the formation of the mind.

original: sems bya ba dang bcas pa'i rang bzhin thob pas de dang de la 'jug par byed pa'i las can gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: sems bya ba dang bcas pa'i rang bzhin thob pas de dang de la 'jug par byed pa'i las can gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Its action is to cause the mind to engage in this or that object, because it causes the mind to obtain a nature that is accompanied by activity.

original: de yang rnam pa gsum ste dge ba dang mi dge ba dang @130a * //ğŸ”½lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gsum ste dge ba dang mi dge ba dang @130a * // lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: It is of three types: virtuous, nonvirtuous, and indeterminate.

original: yang mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pas drug go //
analyzed: yang mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pas drug go //
translated: It is also of six types, because it is associated with eye consciousness, etc.

original: reg pa ni pha dang ma dang bur gzhag pa bya ba dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams 'dus pa ste /
analyzed: reg pa ni pha dang ma dang bur gzhag pa bya ba dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams 'dus pa ste /
translated: Contact is the coming together of the faculty, the object, and the consciousness.

original: dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams 'dus pa yod pa na bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba bskyed pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i dbang po'i 'gyur ba yongs su gcod pa gang yin pa 'dra ba tsam gyis bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba
analyzed: dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams 'dus pa yod pa na bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba bskyed pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i dbang po'i 'gyur ba yongs su gcod pa gang yin pa 'dra ba tsam gyis bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba
translated: When the faculty, the object, and the consciousness come together, there is the determination of the change in the faculty that is compatible with the production of the feeling of pleasure, etc.

original: skyed par byed pa de ni sems las byung ba reg pa zhes brjod de //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa de ni sems las byung ba reg pa zhes brjod de //
translated: That which causes the generation is called the mental factor contact.

original: dbang po'i rnam par 'gyur ba la de dang 'dra ba las reg go zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: dbang po'i rnam par 'gyur ba la de dang 'dra ba las reg go zhes byas nas so //
translated: Because it is said that contact is from the likeness to the transformation of the sense faculty.

original: de'i phyir dbang po'i bye brag gis mig gi 'dus te reg pa nas yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang po'i bye brag gis mig gi 'dus te reg pa nas yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i bar ro //
translated: Therefore, by the distinction of sense faculty, there is contact from eye contact to mind contact.

original: chos mngon par yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: chos mngon par yang gsungs pa /
translated: It is also said in the Abhidharma:

original: gsum 'dus pa na dbang po'i 'gyur ba yongs su gcod pa ni reg pa ste tshor ba skyed pa'i brten byed pa'i las can no zhes so //
analyzed: gsum 'dus pa na dbang po'i 'gyur ba yongs su gcod pa ni reg pa ste tshor ba skyed pa'i brten byed pa'i las can no zhes so //
translated: When the three are assembled, the determination of the transformation of the sense faculty is contact. Its function is to support the generation of feeling.

original: 'dus go zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu dang rgyu'i dngos por gnas pa gsum po rnams gang phan tshun du reg pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus go zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu dang rgyu'i dngos por gnas pa gsum po rnams gang phan tshun du reg pa'o //
translated: The three that exist in the state of cause and effect mutually contact each other.

original: yid la byed pa ni sems yul la phyogs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: yid la byed pa ni sems yul la phyogs par byed pa ste /
translated: Attention is that which directs the mind to the object.

original: yul la bstod pa dang bcas pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: yul la bstod pa dang bcas pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It has the meaning of inclining toward the object.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnyen po'i chos te rgyun mi dmigs pa gcig pa'i rgyu yin la yid la byed pa ni yul las de'i skad cig sems 'phro bar mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnyen po'i chos te rgyun mi dmigs pa gcig pa'i rgyu yin la yid la byed pa ni yul las de'i skad cig sems 'phro bar mi byed pa'o //
translated: Concentration is the factor that is the antidote to distraction, because it is the cause of the non-distraction of mind. Attention is the cause of the non-scattering of mind to other objects.

original: 'dun pa ni rnam par shes pa'i byed par 'dod pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'dun pa ni rnam par shes pa'i byed par 'dod pa nyid do //
translated: Desire is the desire for the activity of consciousness.

original: sred pa las 'dun pa tha dad de /
analyzed: sred pa las 'dun pa tha dad de /
translated: Desire is distinguished from craving.

original: ji ltar la cha ni shing tshan mo dag mi 'bral bar byed pa'i rgyu yin pa de bzhin du sred pa ni sems yul la mngon par chags pa las mi 'bral ba'i rgyu yin la 'dun pa ni bya ba'i bsam pa nyid tsam yin pas so //
analyzed: ji ltar la cha ni shing tshan mo dag mi 'bral bar byed pa'i rgyu yin pa de bzhin du sred pa ni sems yul la mngon par chags pa las mi 'bral ba'i rgyu yin la 'dun pa ni bya ba'i bsam pa nyid tsam yin pas so //
translated: Just as a yoke is the cause for the non-separation of a set of oxen, so craving is the cause for the non-separation of mind from attachment to an object, because desire is merely the intention to act.

original: mos pa ni sems rang gi yul la gang rang gi ngo bor mos pas te phye ma leb me la bzhin du lhag par mos pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: mos pa ni sems rang gi yul la gang rang gi ngo bor mos pas te phye ma leb me la bzhin du lhag par mos pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Interest is the mental factor that is the inclination of mind toward its object, because it is the delight in the nature of the object, like a moth's delight in a flame.

original: yid la byed pa ni yul yid la byed pa ste der ni yid kyi dbang du byas la 'dir ni yul gyi'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa ni yul yid la byed pa ste der ni yid kyi dbang du byas la 'dir ni yul gyi'o //
translated: Attention is the mental factor that directs mind to its object. In the latter case, mind is controlled by mind. In the former case, mind is controlled by its object.

original: dad pa ni bden pa dang dkon mchog dang las kyi 'bras bu rnams la yod pa nyid dang yon tan can nyid dang nus pa nyid du mngon par yid ces pa'o //
analyzed: dad pa ni bden pa dang dkon mchog dang las kyi 'bras bu rnams la yod pa nyid dang yon tan can nyid dang nus pa nyid du mngon par yid ces pa'o //
translated: Faith is the clarity of mind with regard to the truth, the Jewels, and the results of action, which is the conviction that they exist, that they are good qualities, and that they are able to act.

original: de dbye na ni de yod pa nyid la mngon par yid ches pa'i rnam pa'i dad pa dang yon tan can nyid la @130b rab tu dang ba'i rnam pa dang / nus pa nyid la bdag gi sa thob pa'ang 'grub par nus so zhes mngon par 'dod pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: de dbye na ni de yod pa nyid la mngon par yid ches pa'i rnam pa'i dad pa dang yon tan can nyid la @130b rab tu dang ba'i rnam pa dang / nus pa nyid la bdag gi sa thob pa'ang 'grub par nus so zhes mngon par 'dod pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: When it is divided, there are three types: faith that has the aspect of conviction that they exist, faith that has the aspect of clarity about good qualities, and faith that has the aspect of desire, thinking, â€œI will attain the stage of the noble ones and be able to act.â€

original: bden pa ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa bzhi po rnams so //
analyzed: bden pa ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa bzhi po rnams so //
translated: The truths are the four truths of suffering and so on.

original: rnam pa gnyis kyang ste kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa dag go //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis kyang ste kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa dag go //
translated: There are also two types of truths: conventional truths and ultimate truths.

original: brtson 'grus ni dge ba la spro ba'o ;
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni dge ba la spro ba'o ;
translated: Diligence is enthusiasm for virtue.

original: / dran pa ni gang byas pa dang byed bzhin pa dang bya ba'i las rnams la sems kyi brjed pa med pa dang sems mngon par brjod pa de'o //
analyzed: / dran pa ni gang byas pa dang byed bzhin pa dang bya ba'i las rnams la sems kyi brjed pa med pa dang sems mngon par brjod pa de'o //
translated: Mindfulness is the mind not forgetting what has been done, what is being done, and what should be done, and it is the expression of the mind.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni sems rtse gcig pa nyid de /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni sems rtse gcig pa nyid de /
translated: Concentration is the one-pointedness of mind.

original: rtse gcig tu dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rtse gcig tu dmigs pa'o //
translated: It is the single-pointed observation of an object.

original: shes rab ni chos rnams rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ste the tshom bzlog pa'i las can no //
analyzed: shes rab ni chos rnams rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ste the tshom bzlog pa'i las can no //
translated: Wisdom is the discernment of dharmas. Its function is to eliminate doubt.

original: gang dngos po la gang zag dang chos kyi bdag rang gi blos yan lag rnam par phye nas gang rang gi ngo bo tshol ba ste /
analyzed: gang dngos po la gang zag dang chos kyi bdag rang gi blos yan lag rnam par phye nas gang rang gi ngo bo tshol ba ste /
translated: It is the investigation of the nature of things, having divided them into persons and dharmas, with oneâ€™s own mind.

original: gang zag dang chos rnams la rang gi ngo bo brtags pa na rang bzhin med pa nyid kyis cung zad kyang mi dmigs so //ğŸ”½rtog pa ni gang dang ldan pa las rnam par shes pa bum pa'i ring ba dang mdzes pa tsam bzhin du rags pa'i dmigs pa yongs su gcod pa de kun du rtog pa'i ming can no //
analyzed: gang zag dang chos rnams la rang gi ngo bo brtags pa na rang bzhin med pa nyid kyis cung zad kyang mi dmigs so // rtog pa ni gang dang ldan pa las rnam par shes pa bum pa'i ring ba dang mdzes pa tsam bzhin du rags pa'i dmigs pa yongs su gcod pa de kun du rtog pa'i ming can no //
translated: When one examines the nature of persons and dharmas, one does not observe the slightest thing, because they are essenceless.ğŸ”½Imagination is the mental factor that, when it is present, causes consciousness to apprehend a gross object, just as a pot or a piece of cloth is apprehended. It is called imagination because it is the name of the mental factor that imagines.

original: dpyod pa ni bum pa rnying pa dang brtan pa zhes phra mo lta bar zhugs pa'i sems las byung ba'i chos so //
analyzed: dpyod pa ni bum pa rnying pa dang brtan pa zhes phra mo lta bar zhugs pa'i sems las byung ba'i chos so //
translated: Discrimination is the mental factor that, when it is present, causes consciousness to apprehend a subtle object, as when one thinks, â€œThis is an old pot,â€ or â€œThis is a new pot.â€

original: bag med pa ni dge ba'i chos rnams mi sgom pa ste mi sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: bag med pa ni dge ba'i chos rnams mi sgom pa ste mi sgrub pa'o //
translated: Carelessness is the non-cultivation of the wholesome factors, i.e., their non-practice.

original: bag yod ni de las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: bag yod ni de las bzlog pa'o //
translated: Carefulness is the opposite of that.

original: yid 'byung ba ni chos gang dang ldan pa las sems 'khor ba'i skyon mthong ba nyid las 'khor ba las yid 'byung ba ste de ni nyon mongs pa spong ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i yang dag pa'i shugs so //
analyzed: yid 'byung ba ni chos gang dang ldan pa las sems 'khor ba'i skyon mthong ba nyid las 'khor ba las yid 'byung ba ste de ni nyon mongs pa spong ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i yang dag pa'i shugs so //
translated: Disgust is the disgust with the lifecycle which arises from the very perception of the faults of the lifecycle on the part of one who possesses the factors of that disgust. It is the momentum of rightness which is favorable to the abandonment of the defilements.

original: mchog tu dga' ba ni sems rab tu dga' ba dang chags pa ste yid bde ba las tha dad du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba ni sems rab tu dga' ba dang chags pa ste yid bde ba las tha dad du gyur pa'o //
translated: Supreme joy is the delight and attachment of the mind, i.e., mental satisfaction which is distinguished from the rest.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa ni lus dang sems dag las su rung pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa ni lus dang sems dag las su rung pa'o //
translated: Agility is the serviceability of the mind and body.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa ma yin pa ni lus dang sems dag gi lci ba nyid dang rmugs pa dang gnyid kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa ma yin pa ni lus dang sems dag gi lci ba nyid dang rmugs pa dang gnyid kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: Non-agility is the heaviness of the mind and body, i.e., the nature of torpor and sleepiness.

original: rnam par 'tshe ba ni chos gang dang ldan pa las khro ba'i rkyen gyis thal lcag la sogs pas gzhan la tho 'tshams pa de'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'tshe ba ni chos gang dang ldan pa las khro ba'i rkyen gyis thal lcag la sogs pas gzhan la tho 'tshams pa de'o //
translated: Violence is the harmfulness to others on the part of one who possesses the factors of that violence, i.e., the striking of others with the hand, etc., on account of anger.

original: de dang 'gal ba'i chos ni rnam par mi 'tshe ba'o //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba'i chos ni rnam par mi 'tshe ba'o //
translated: Non-violence is the dharma that is the opposite of that.

original: ngo tsha na gang gi dbang gis bdag nyid dang chos kyi dbang du byas pas sdig pa las bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: ngo tsha na gang gi dbang gis bdag nyid dang chos kyi dbang du byas pas sdig pa las bzlog pa ste /
translated: Shame is the dharma that, by the power of oneself and the Dharma, turns one away from evil.

original: de ni sdig pa la mi 'jug pa'i rgyu'i chos ngo tsha zhes bya @131a * //
analyzed: de ni sdig pa la mi 'jug pa'i rgyu'i chos ngo tsha zhes bya @131a * //
translated: It is the dharma that is the cause of not engaging in evil, and is called shame.

original: ba'o ; / khrel yod ni gzhan la ltos nas skyon rnams kyis ngo tsha bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: ba'o ; / khrel yod ni gzhan la ltos nas skyon rnams kyis ngo tsha bar byed pa'o //
translated: Embarrassment is being ashamed of faults in relation to others.

original: btang snyoms ni chos gang gis dmigs pa la sems mnyam du 'jug pa ste de ni sems mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: btang snyoms ni chos gang gis dmigs pa la sems mnyam du 'jug pa ste de ni sems mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: Equanimity is the dharma by which the mind engages its object evenly. It is the equality of mind.

original: des ni sems rjes su chags par mi byed khong khro bar mi byed do //ğŸ”½de yang dgra bcom pa rnams kyi ye shes kyang ldan pa so sor brtags pa'i btang snyoms te /
analyzed: des ni sems rjes su chags par mi byed khong khro bar mi byed do // de yang dgra bcom pa rnams kyi ye shes kyang ldan pa so sor brtags pa'i btang snyoms te /
translated: By that, the mind is neither attached nor averse.ğŸ”½That is the equanimity of the arhats that is associated with wisdom.

original: so so skye bo rnams kyi ni ye shes dang ldan pa ma yin pa so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms so //
analyzed: so so skye bo rnams kyi ni ye shes dang ldan pa ma yin pa so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms so //
translated: The equanimity of ordinary beings is the equanimity that is not associated with wisdom.

original: rnam par grol ba ni sems dri ma med pa nyid de nyon mongs pa la sogs pa spangs pa yod na rnam par grol ba mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba sems las byung ba'i chos skye bo de la dge legs kyi don ni dge ba'i don
analyzed: rnam par grol ba ni sems dri ma med pa nyid de nyon mongs pa la sogs pa spangs pa yod na rnam par grol ba mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba sems las byung ba'i chos skye bo de la dge legs kyi don ni dge ba'i don
translated: Liberation is the mind free from defilements. When the afflictions and so on are abandoned, there is what is called liberation, nirvana, a phenomenon that arises in the mind.ğŸ”½The meaning of auspiciousness is the meaning of virtue.

original: te rnam par grol ba yang nye bar 'tshe ba mtha' dag las log pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa nyid kyi phyir phyin ci log med pa'i dge ba ste nad med pa nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: te rnam par grol ba yang nye bar 'tshe ba mtha' dag las log pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa nyid kyi phyir phyin ci log med pa'i dge ba ste nad med pa nyid bzhin no //
translated: Liberation is also nonerroneous virtue because it is the very nature of turning away from all harm, just like being free from illness.

original: lam gyi bden pa ni de thob pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir dge ba'o //
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa ni de thob pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir dge ba'o //
translated: The truth of the path is virtuous because it is the cause for attaining that.

original: de las gzhan pa'i bden pa gnyis ni zag pa dang bcas pa ste rnam par smin pa 'dod pa nyid kyis rjes su mthun pa'i gzugs brnyan mngon par 'grub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i bden pa gnyis ni zag pa dang bcas pa ste rnam par smin pa 'dod pa nyid kyis rjes su mthun pa'i gzugs brnyan mngon par 'grub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The other two truths are contaminated because they are the desired result of karmic maturation, and they are the cause for the manifestation of a corresponding image.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams ni gsum ste 'dod chags med pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang ; gti mug med pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams ni gsum ste 'dod chags med pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang ; gti mug med pa'o //
translated: The roots of virtue are three: absence of greed, absence of hatred, and absence of delusion.

original: de la 'dod chags med pa ni sred pa dang 'gal ba'i chos te dngos po rnams la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de la 'dod chags med pa ni sred pa dang 'gal ba'i chos te dngos po rnams la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Absence of greed is the dharma that is the opposite of greed, characterized by non-attachment to things.

original: zhe sdang med pa ni khong khro dang 'gal ba'i chos te sems can rnams la mnar sems med pa nyid mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: zhe sdang med pa ni khong khro dang 'gal ba'i chos te sems can rnams la mnar sems med pa nyid mtshan nyid can no //
translated: Absence of hatred is the dharma that is the opposite of anger, characterized by non-violence toward sentient beings.

original: gti mug med pa ni ma rig pa dang 'gal ba'i chos te shes rab kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gti mug med pa ni ma rig pa dang 'gal ba'i chos te shes rab kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Absence of delusion is the dharma that is the opposite of ignorance, characterized by wisdom.

original: 'di rnams ni rang nyid dge ba dge ba gzhan rnams kyi rtsa bar gyur pa shing gi rtsa ba bzhin bskyed pa dang gnas pa dang 'phel ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams ni rang nyid dge ba dge ba gzhan rnams kyi rtsa bar gyur pa shing gi rtsa ba bzhin bskyed pa dang gnas pa dang 'phel ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: These are themselves virtuous and are the roots of other virtues, like the roots of a tree, the cause of generation, abiding, and growth.

original: 'di las bzlog pas na gsum ni mi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams te 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug go //
analyzed: 'di las bzlog pas na gsum ni mi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams te 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug go //
translated: The three roots of nonvirtue are the opposites of these: greed, hatred, and delusion.

original: de la 'dod par gtogs pa'i 'dod chags thams cad ni chags pa mi dge ba'i rtsa ba'o //
analyzed: de la 'dod par gtogs pa'i 'dod chags thams cad ni chags pa mi dge ba'i rtsa ba'o //
translated: All attachment belonging to the realm of desire is the root of demerit which is passion.

original: zhe sdang thams cad kyang ngo //
analyzed: zhe sdang thams cad kyang ngo //
translated: All hatred is also so.

original: 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i gti mug ma gtogs pa 'dod pa na spyod pa'i ma rig pa thams cad ni gti @131b mug mi dge ba'i rtsa ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i gti mug ma gtogs pa 'dod pa na spyod pa'i ma rig pa thams cad ni gti @131b mug mi dge ba'i rtsa ba'o //
translated: All ignorance belonging to the realm of desire, except for the delusion which is the afflicted view of the self and the extreme, is the root of demerit which is delusion.

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba rnam gsum ste srid pa dang ma rig pa dang blo'o //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba rnam gsum ste srid pa dang ma rig pa dang blo'o //
translated: There are three roots of the indeterminate: existence, ignorance, and intellect.

original: de la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'jigs tshogs dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i gti mug ma gtogs par nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad mi dge ba ste mi 'dod pa'i rnam par smin pa can nyidğŸ”½kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'jigs tshogs dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i gti mug ma gtogs par nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad mi dge ba ste mi 'dod pa'i rnam par smin pa can nyidğŸ”½kyi phyir ro //
translated: All the major and minor defilements, except for the afflicted view of the self and the extreme and the delusion associated with them, belonging to the realm of desire, are indeterminate because they have an indeterminate ripening.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad dang 'dod pa'i khams su'ang 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa gsum ste 'di thams cad lung du ma bstan pa'o //ğŸ”½de la gang dang gang zhig sred pa dang ma rig pa dang shes rab lung du ma bstan pa de thams cad ni lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba ste /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad dang 'dod pa'i khams su'ang 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa gsum ste 'di thams cad lung du ma bstan pa'o // de la gang dang gang zhig sred pa dang ma rig pa dang shes rab lung du ma bstan pa de thams cad ni lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba ste /
translated: All the afflictions and branch afflictions of the form and formless realms and the three views of the perishable composite and so on of the desire realm are neutral.

original: rang nyid lung du ma bstan pa nyid kyi phyir dang / lung du ma bstan pa gzhan gyi rtsa ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang nyid lung du ma bstan pa nyid kyi phyir dang / lung du ma bstan pa gzhan gyi rtsa ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Among them, craving, ignorance and neutral wisdom are the roots of neutral states because they are neutral by nature and they are the roots of other neutral states.

original: lung du ma bstan pa gzhan ni rtsa ba ma yin te mi brtan pa nyid dang steng du 'jug pa nyid las rtsa ba dang chos mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa gzhan ni rtsa ba ma yin te mi brtan pa nyid dang steng du 'jug pa nyid las rtsa ba dang chos mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Other neutral states are not roots because they are unstable and they are not roots since they are not similar to roots in terms of being above ground.

original: yang chos mngon par gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang chos mngon par gsungs pa /
translated: Again, the AbhidharmakoÅ›a declares:

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum rnams dang / ngo tsha dang khrel yod pa rang bzhin gyis dge ba ste phan pa'i sman bzhin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum rnams dang / ngo tsha dang khrel yod pa rang bzhin gyis dge ba ste phan pa'i sman bzhin no //
translated: The three roots of virtue, shame and embarrassment are naturally virtuous, like beneficial medicine.

original: de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pas ni chos gzhan dge ba rnams te sman dang bsres pa'i chu bzhin no //ğŸ”½de rnams kyis kun nas bslang bas ni sems dang ngag gi las dag dang bye brag tu smra ba'i 'dod pas sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa thob pa la sogs pa dge ba rnams kyang ste sman dang 'dres pa'i chu las yang dag par byung ba'i 'o
analyzed: de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pas ni chos gzhan dge ba rnams te sman dang bsres pa'i chu bzhin no // de rnams kyis kun nas bslang bas ni sems dang ngag gi las dag dang bye brag tu smra ba'i 'dod pas sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa thob pa la sogs pa dge ba rnams kyang ste sman dang 'dres pa'i chu las yang dag par byung ba'i 'o
translated: Those that are concomitant with them are virtuous phenomena other than those, like water mixed with medicine.
