translated: One who is inflated by that view is hostile to others.

original: rgyu rnam pa gsum rnams kyis re re yang skyed par byed de gal te phra rgyas spangs pa ma yin par gyur pa dang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang yul nye bar gnas par gyur na'o //
analyzed: rgyu rnam pa gsum rnams kyis re re yang skyed par byed de gal te phra rgyas spangs pa ma yin par gyur pa dang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang yul nye bar gnas par gyur na'o //
translated: Each is generated by three causes: if the negative tendency is not abandoned, if one engages in incorrect mental application and if the object is present.

original: de 'di rnams rgyu dang yul dang sbyor ba'i stobs rnams su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de 'di rnams rgyu dang yul dang sbyor ba'i stobs rnams su 'gyur ro //
translated: These are the power of cause, object and application.

original: phra rgyas drug po 'di rnams kyang lus dang ngag dang sems kyi rgyud nyon mongs par byed pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa rnams su yang brjod do //
analyzed: phra rgyas drug po 'di rnams kyang lus dang ngag dang sems kyi rgyud nyon mongs par byed pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa rnams su yang brjod do //
translated: These six proclivities are also called defilements because they defile the stream of body, speech, and mind.

original: gang nyon mongs pa de rnams nye ba'i nyon mongs pa yang ngo //
analyzed: gang nyon mongs pa de rnams nye ba'i nyon mongs pa yang ngo //
translated: Those that are defilements are also secondary defilements.

original: gang gzhan sems las byung ba'i chos nyon mongs pa can sgyu la sogs pa de rnams ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa kho na ste sems nyon mongs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gzhan sems las byung ba'i chos nyon mongs pa can sgyu la sogs pa de rnams ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa kho na ste sems nyon mongs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The other defiled mental activities such as deceit are only secondary defilements because they defile the mind.

original: de la sgyu ni gzhan slu ba ste /
analyzed: de la sgyu ni gzhan slu ba ste /
translated: Among them, deceit is the concealment of ones faults.

original: gang gis rnam par rmongs par byed pa'am gang las gzhan rnams kyi bsam pa mi shes par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gang gis rnam par rmongs par byed pa'am gang las gzhan rnams kyi bsam pa mi shes par 'gyur la /
translated: It is that by which one is confused or by which others are caused to be confused about ones intentions.

original: sgyu ma bzhin du rang gi ngo bo sbas nas sems ji bzhin ma yin pa'i bdag nyid du 'jug ste /
analyzed: sgyu ma bzhin du rang gi ngo bo sbas nas sems ji bzhin ma yin pa'i bdag nyid du 'jug ste /
translated: Like a magician, one conceals ones own nature and engages in activity with a false identity.

original: chos gang dang ldan pa las pha rol rnams slu bar byed pa de sgyu'o //
analyzed: chos gang dang ldan pa las pha rol rnams slu bar byed pa de sgyu'o //
translated: It is that by which one deceives others because one possesses a certain mental quality.

original: rgyags shing dregs pa ni rgyags pa ste gang gi dbang las gzhan rnams la lus dang sems kyi rgyun mi gus pa dang bcas par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rgyags shing dregs pa ni rgyags pa ste gang gi dbang las gzhan rnams la lus dang sems kyi rgyun mi gus pa dang bcas par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Arrogance is the swelling up of the mind due to considering one's own excellence in regard to social class, physical appearance, power, possessions, wisdom, etc.

original: rnam par 'tshe ba ni khro ba'i rkyen gyis thal lcag la sogs pa rdeg pa'i rgyu'i chos so //
analyzed: rnam par 'tshe ba ni khro ba'i rkyen gyis thal lcag la sogs pa rdeg pa'i rgyu'i chos so //
translated: Violence is the quality of being the cause of striking others with the hand, etc., due to the condition of anger.

original: 'tshig pa ni sdig pa dang 'grogs pa ste so rnams kyis zas 'dzin pa bzhin du sdig pas btsir nas gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'tshig pa ni sdig pa dang 'grogs pa ste so rnams kyis zas 'dzin pa bzhin du sdig pas btsir nas gnas pa'o //
translated: Spite is the quality of being squeezed by evil, like food in the jaws of a rodent.

original: 'khon du 'dzin pa ni mi mdza' ba dang rjes su 'brel pa ste sems la khro bar bya ba'i dngos po lan mang du byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'khon du 'dzin pa ni mi mdza' ba dang rjes su 'brel pa ste sems la khro bar bya ba'i dngos po lan mang du byed pa'o //
translated: Resentment is the quality of being associated with hostility, the quality of the mind's repeated consideration of an object of anger.

original: g-yo ni chos gang dang ldan pa las ji ltar gnas pa'i rigs pa dang mi rigs pa 'khyog po mi gsal bar 'jug pa de ste sems kyi rgyun gya gyu'o //
analyzed: g-yo ni chos gang dang ldan pa las ji ltar gnas pa'i rigs pa dang mi rigs pa 'khyog po mi gsal bar 'jug pa de ste sems kyi rgyun gya gyu'o //
translated: Guile is the quality by which the mind enters into what is proper and improper in a crooked and unclear way, like a stream that flows in many directions.

original: de la 'di rnams kyi rgyu dang rgyags pa dag 'dod chags kyi dri ma'i rgyu mthun pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'di rnams kyi rgyu dang rgyags pa dag 'dod chags kyi dri ma'i rgyu mthun pa'o //
translated: Among these, the causes of these five, and arrogance, are the natural outflow of the impurity of passion.

original: 'khon du 'dzin pa dang rnam par 'tshe ba ni khong khro'i'o //
analyzed: 'khon du 'dzin pa dang rnam par 'tshe ba ni khong khro'i'o //
translated: Hostility and violence are of anger.

original: 'tshig pa ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: 'tshig pa ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Scorn is of the overesteeming of morality and asceticism.

original: g-yo ni log par lta ba'i'o //
analyzed: g-yo ni log par lta ba'i'o //
translated: Dissimulation is of false view.

original: kun nas dkris pa rnam pa bcu ste rmugs pa dang gnyid dang rgod pa dang 'gyod pa @134a * //
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa rnam pa bcu ste rmugs pa dang gnyid dang rgod pa dang 'gyod pa @134a * //
translated: There are ten entanglements: torpor, sleep, excitation, regret,

original: dang phrag dog dang ser sna dang ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa khro ba dang 'chab pa'o //
analyzed: dang phrag dog dang ser sna dang ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa khro ba dang 'chab pa'o //
translated: envy, avarice, lack of conscience, shamelessness, anger, and hypocrisy.

original: rmugs pa ni 'di 'dar ba nyid dang lus dang ngag dag lci ba nyid du gyur pas sems dmigs pa rtogs pa la las su mi rung ba'o //
analyzed: rmugs pa ni 'di 'dar ba nyid dang lus dang ngag dag lci ba nyid du gyur pas sems dmigs pa rtogs pa la las su mi rung ba'o //
translated: Torpor is the heaviness of body and mind, a lack of ability to control body and mind, and a lack of clarity of the mind.

original: gnyid ni gnyid de rnam par shes pa lnga 'jug pa dang 'gal ba'i chos yid kyi rnam par shes pa'ang blun par 'gyur ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: gnyid ni gnyid de rnam par shes pa lnga 'jug pa dang 'gal ba'i chos yid kyi rnam par shes pa'ang blun par 'gyur ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: Sleep is the withdrawal of the mind and mental factors into the body, a condition similar to the knotting up of a thread. It is a condition of the five collections of consciousness. It is a cause of the dulling of mental consciousness.

original: gnyid mthug po'i gnas skabs na ni rig pa med la gnyid dang bral ba na sngar gyi shes pas 'dus byas pa las blo de lta bu'i rnam pa rnams 'byung ste de'i phyir lus ni sgyu ma yin no zhes kyang zer ro //
analyzed: gnyid mthug po'i gnas skabs na ni rig pa med la gnyid dang bral ba na sngar gyi shes pas 'dus byas pa las blo de lta bu'i rnam pa rnams 'byung ste de'i phyir lus ni sgyu ma yin no zhes kyang zer ro //
translated: In the state of deep sleep, there is no awareness. When one is free from sleep, the mind arises in the form of those cognitions that were previously conditioned. Therefore, the body is like an illusion.

original: ngo tsha med pa ni chos gang dang ldan pa las bdag nyid la ltos nas 'dzem pa dang bral zhing sdig pa la 'jug pa ste de rang bzhin gyis ngan pa'i chos so //
analyzed: ngo tsha med pa ni chos gang dang ldan pa las bdag nyid la ltos nas 'dzem pa dang bral zhing sdig pa la 'jug pa ste de rang bzhin gyis ngan pa'i chos so //
translated: Shamelessness is the absence of self-respect, which is the cause of engaging in evil. It is a naturally bad quality.

original: khrel med pa ni de nyid gzhan la ltos pas so //
analyzed: khrel med pa ni de nyid gzhan la ltos pas so //
translated: Lack of embarrassment is the absence of respect for others.

original: khro ba ni sems can dang sems can ma yin pa'i yul la sems rab tu khro ba tsam ste da ltar 'byung 'gyur gyis sems de nyid drag po nyid du byed pa ste gtum pa'o //
analyzed: khro ba ni sems can dang sems can ma yin pa'i yul la sems rab tu khro ba tsam ste da ltar 'byung 'gyur gyis sems de nyid drag po nyid du byed pa ste gtum pa'o //
translated: Anger is the mere irritation of the mind toward sentient beings and non-sentient beings. It is the state of making the mind itself strong and fierce through present and future irritation.

original: 'chab pa ni sdig pa sbed pa'o //
analyzed: 'chab pa ni sdig pa sbed pa'o //
translated: Concealment is the hiding of evil.

original: kun nas sbrel te kun nas bcings nas gnas pas kun nas dkris pa rnams te dge ba'i phyogs la 'jug pa dang shin tu 'gal ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas sbrel te kun nas bcings nas gnas pas kun nas dkris pa rnams te dge ba'i phyogs la 'jug pa dang shin tu 'gal ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: They are called entanglements because they entangle and bind one to the suffering of cyclic existence.

original: 'di rnams la yang rmugs pa dang gnyid dang khrel med pa rnams ni ma rig pa'i rgyu mthun pa'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams la yang rmugs pa dang gnyid dang khrel med pa rnams ni ma rig pa'i rgyu mthun pa'o //
translated: Among these, torpor, sleep, and lack of conscience are the natural outcome of ignorance.

original: 'gyod pa ni the tshom gyi rgyu mthun pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyod pa ni the tshom gyi rgyu mthun pa'o //
translated: Regret is the natural outcome of doubt.

original: ngo tsha med pa dang rgod pa dang ser sna rnams dang 'dod chags kyi rgyu mthun pa'o //
analyzed: ngo tsha med pa dang rgod pa dang ser sna rnams dang 'dod chags kyi rgyu mthun pa'o //
translated: Shamelessness, excitation, and avarice are the natural outcome of attachment.

original: khro ba dang phrag dog dang khong khros kun bslang ba'o //
analyzed: khro ba dang phrag dog dang khong khros kun bslang ba'o //
translated: Anger and envy are motivated by anger.

original: 'chab pa ni sred pa'am ma rig pa'i rgyu mthun te /
analyzed: 'chab pa ni sred pa'am ma rig pa'i rgyu mthun te /
translated: Concealment is the natural outcome of craving or ignorance.

original: 'di rnams dri ma bcu rnams dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'di rnams dri ma bcu rnams dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams so //
translated: These are the ten defilements and secondary afflictions.

original: zag pa rnam gsum ste 'dod pa dang srid pa dang ma rig pa'i zag pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa rnam gsum ste 'dod pa dang srid pa dang ma rig pa'i zag pa'o //
translated: There are three contaminations: the contaminations of desire, existence, and ignorance.

original: de la ma rig pa ma gtogs pa gzhan 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa kun nas dkris pa bcu dang bcas pa rnams ni 'dod pa'i zag pa'o //
analyzed: de la ma rig pa ma gtogs pa gzhan 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa kun nas dkris pa bcu dang bcas pa rnams ni 'dod pa'i zag pa'o //
translated: The other proclivities, i.e., the ten envelopments of the realm of desire, with the exception of ignorance, are the impure influence of the realm of desire.

original: ma rig pa bor ba'i phra rgyas nyid gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa lung du ma bstan pa kha nang du bltas nas 'jug pa mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa rnams ni srid pa'i zag pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa bor ba'i phra rgyas nyid gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa lung du ma bstan pa kha nang du bltas nas 'jug pa mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa rnams ni srid pa'i zag pa'o //
translated: The proclivities of the realm of fine-materiality and of the realm of immateriality, i.e., the indeterminate proclivities, which are the object of internal mental-consciousness, which are in a state of composure, with the exception of ignorance, are the impure influence of existence.

original: khams gsum pa'i ma rig pa ni ma rig pa'i zag pa'o //
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i ma rig pa ni ma rig pa'i zag pa'o //
translated: The ignorance of the three realms is the impure influence of ignorance.ğŸ”½This is the root of all the defilements; that is why it is distinguished.ğŸ”½The impure influences are so called because they flow out from the wound of the six sense-spheres, from the peak of existence down to the hells.

original: 'di ni nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi rtsa bar gyur pa ste de'i phyir logs su rnam par gzhag go / srid pa'i @134b rtse mo nas mnar med pa'i bar du skye mched drug gi rma nas 'dzag pa'i phyir rab 'di rnams kyis zag par byed pa'am rgyudğŸ”½yul la gnas par byed pa'i phyir zag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi rtsa bar gyur pa ste de'i phyir logs su rnam par gzhag go / srid pa'i @134b rtse mo nas mnar med pa'i bar du skye mched drug gi rma nas 'dzag pa'i phyir rab 'di rnams kyis zag par byed pa'am rgyudğŸ”½yul la gnas par byed pa'i phyir zag pa'o //
translated: Or else, they are impure influences because they cause the mind to remain attached to objects.

original: chu bo rnams ni bzhi ste de la lta ba rnams las gzhan pa 'dod pa dang srid pa dang ma rig pa'i zag pa rnams kho na 'dod pa dang srid pa dang ma rig pa'i chu bo gsum mo //
analyzed: chu bo rnams ni bzhi ste de la lta ba rnams las gzhan pa 'dod pa dang srid pa dang ma rig pa'i zag pa rnams kho na 'dod pa dang srid pa dang ma rig pa'i chu bo gsum mo //
translated: The flood of sensuality consists of the three contaminants of sensuality, existence, and ignorance that are not included in the floods of views and ignorance.

original: khams gsum pa'i lta ba rnams lta ba'i chu bo ste bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i lta ba rnams lta ba'i chu bo ste bzhi pa'o //
translated: The flood of views consists of the afflicted views of the three realms.

original: khyer bas na chu bo ste de rnams kyis de dang ldan pa khyer bas te de'i rjes su sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyer bas na chu bo ste de rnams kyis de dang ldan pa khyer bas te de'i rjes su sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are floods because one is carried away by them. One who possesses them is carried away by them, because one is made to accomplish their subsequent existence.

original: sbyor ba rnams ni chu bo bzhi po kho na ste sdug bsngal sna tshogs la kun du sbyor bas ldan par byed pa'am yang yang du rjes su 'brel pa yul rnams la sbyor bar byed pas sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba rnams ni chu bo bzhi po kho na ste sdug bsngal sna tshogs la kun du sbyor bas ldan par byed pa'am yang yang du rjes su 'brel pa yul rnams la sbyor bar byed pas sbyor ba'o //
translated: The yokes are the four floods, because they yoke one to various sufferings, they cause one to possess them, or they yoke one to objects again and again.

original: nye bar len pa rnams bzhi ste 'dod pa'i sbyor ba nyid ma rig pa dang bcas pa 'dod pa'i nye bar len pa dang lta ba'i sbyor ba nyid tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs ma gtogs pa'i lta ba nye bar len pa dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs kyi
analyzed: nye bar len pa rnams bzhi ste 'dod pa'i sbyor ba nyid ma rig pa dang bcas pa 'dod pa'i nye bar len pa dang lta ba'i sbyor ba nyid tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs ma gtogs pa'i lta ba nye bar len pa dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs kyi
translated: There are four appropriators: the appropriator of desire realm is the preparation for the desire realm itself along with ignorance. The appropriator of view is the preparation for the view of the desire realm itself, except for the view of ethics and vows.

original: nye bar len pa dang srid pa'i sbyor ba nyid ma rig pa bsnan pa rmugs pa dang rgod pa dang bcas pa ni bdag tu smra ba'i nye bar len pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pa dang srid pa'i sbyor ba nyid ma rig pa bsnan pa rmugs pa dang rgod pa dang bcas pa ni bdag tu smra ba'i nye bar len pa'o //
translated: The appropriator of ethics and vows is the preparation for the view of the desire realm itself, except for the view of ethics and vows. The appropriator of self is the preparation for existence itself, along with ignorance, lethargy, and excitation.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs kyi nye bar len pa lta ba rnams las ci'i phyir phyung zhe na /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs kyi nye bar len pa lta ba rnams las ci'i phyir phyung zhe na /
translated: Why are the views that are the appropriator of ethics and vows extracted from the appropriator of the desire realm?

original: lam gyi dgra zlar gyur pa nyid kyi phyir dang phyogs gnyi ga slu bar byed pa nyid kyi phyir te gang gi phyir khyim pa rnams 'dis bslus te mi bza' ba la sogs pa rnams la lam du 'du shes pas so //
analyzed: lam gyi dgra zlar gyur pa nyid kyi phyir dang phyogs gnyi ga slu bar byed pa nyid kyi phyir te gang gi phyir khyim pa rnams 'dis bslus te mi bza' ba la sogs pa rnams la lam du 'du shes pas so //
translated: Because they are enemies of the path and because they deceive both sides. Because they deceive householders, who perceive that which is not to be eaten and so on as the path.

original: rab tu byung ba rnams kyang ste 'dod pa'i yul yongs su spangs pas dag par rtogs pas 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba rnams kyang ste 'dod pa'i yul yongs su spangs pas dag par rtogs pas 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and those who have gone forth, because they have abandoned objects of desire and have realized purity.

original: 'dod pa la sogs pa nye bar len pas na nye bar len pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'dod pa la sogs pa nye bar len pas na nye bar len pa rnams so //
translated: They are called appropriators because they appropriate the body.

original: mdud yin pa rnams ni bzhi yin zhing 'dod pa'i khams kho na ste /
analyzed: mdud yin pa rnams ni bzhi yin zhing 'dod pa'i khams kho na ste /
translated: The knots are four in number and belong only to the realm of desire.

original: ma rig pa dang gnod sems dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang 'di bden par mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang gnod sems dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang 'di bden par mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: They are ignorance, malice, esteeming of morality and ascetic practices, and dogmatic fanaticism.

original: ma rig pa nyid lus kyi mdud pa ste rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i 'dod pa thob pa rnams la mi 'chad par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa nyid lus kyi mdud pa ste rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i 'dod pa thob pa rnams la mi 'chad par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Ignorance itself is the knot of the body, because it is the cause of the non-cessation of the various kinds of desire for the attainment of the body.

original: de bzhin du lhag ma la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lhag ma la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same method applies to the rest.

original: sgrib pa rnams ni lnga ste 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang gnod sems dang rmugs pa dang gnyid dang rgod 'gyod dang the tshom mo //
analyzed: sgrib pa rnams ni lnga ste 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang gnod sems dang rmugs pa dang gnyid dang rgod 'gyod dang the tshom mo //
translated: The obscurations are five in number: desire for sense-objects, malice, torpor, languor, restlessness and worry, and doubt.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kho na sgrib pa rnams te shin tu mi dge ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kho na sgrib pa rnams te shin tu mi dge ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The obscurations are only in the realm of desire, because they are very unwholesome.

original: dge ba'i phyogs la sgrib par byed pa nyid kyi phyir sgrib pa @135a * //
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs la sgrib par byed pa nyid kyi phyir sgrib pa @135a * //
translated: They are obscurations because they obscure the wholesome side.

original: rnams so // gnyid dang rmugs pa dang sgrib pa gcig tu brjod pa dang rgod pa dang 'gyod pa gnyis dag kyang gcig pa rgyu ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: rnams so // gnyid dang rmugs pa dang sgrib pa gcig tu brjod pa dang rgod pa dang 'gyod pa gnyis dag kyang gcig pa rgyu ci yin zhe na /
translated: Why are sleep and lethargy described as one obscuration, and why are excitement and regret described as one?

original: zas dang zas ma yin pa dang bya ba gcig pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zas dang zas ma yin pa dang bya ba gcig pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they have the same nutriment, non-nutriment, and function.

original: gnyid dang rmugs pa dag zas gcig pa ni chos lnga ste /
analyzed: gnyid dang rmugs pa dag zas gcig pa ni chos lnga ste /
translated: Sleep and lethargy have the same nutriment, which is five dharmas:

original: rmya ba dang mi dga' ba dang g-yal ba dang kha zas kyi dod ma shes pa dang sems zhum pa nyid do //
analyzed: rmya ba dang mi dga' ba dang g-yal ba dang kha zas kyi dod ma shes pa dang sems zhum pa nyid do //
translated: weariness, distaste, drowsiness, not knowing how to discriminate the nutriment of food, and mental depression.

original: zas ma yin pa ni snang ba'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: zas ma yin pa ni snang ba'i 'du shes so //
translated: Non-nutriment is the perception of light.

original: bya ba yang gcig ste gnyis kas kyang sems zhum par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba yang gcig ste gnyis kas kyang sems zhum par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They have the same function, because both cause the mind to be depressed.

original: rgod pa dang 'gyod pa dag gi zas bzhi ste nye du'i rnam par rtog pa ljongs kyi rnam par rtog pa dang mi 'chi ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang sngon dgod pa dang rtses pa dang yongs su spyad pa rnams rjes su dran par gyur pa'o zhes pa'o
analyzed: rgod pa dang 'gyod pa dag gi zas bzhi ste nye du'i rnam par rtog pa ljongs kyi rnam par rtog pa dang mi 'chi ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang sngon dgod pa dang rtses pa dang yongs su spyad pa rnams rjes su dran par gyur pa'o zhes pa'o
translated: The four foods of agitation and remorse are:ğŸ”½1) reflection on relatives, 2) reflection on the country, 3) reflection on death, and 4) recollection of former times of laughter, play, and enjoyment.

original: // zas ma yin pa zhi gnas so //
analyzed: // zas ma yin pa zhi gnas so //
translated: The food of agitation is the four foods of remorse.

original: bya ba yang gcig ste gnyi ga yang sems nye bar ma zhi ba 'jug par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba yang gcig ste gnyi ga yang sems nye bar ma zhi ba 'jug par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The function of both is the same, because both cause the mind to be unquiet.ğŸ”½If all the defilements are obscurations, why are only five taught?

original: gang gi tshe nyon mongs pa thams cad sgrib pa yin na ci'i phyir lnga kho na bshad ce na phung po la gnod pa dang the tshom za bar byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe nyon mongs pa thams cad sgrib pa yin na ci'i phyir lnga kho na bshad ce na phung po la gnod pa dang the tshom za bar byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they harm the aggregates and cause doubt.

original: gang gi phyir 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang gnod sems dag gi tshul khrims kyi phung po gnod pa byed do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang gnod sems dag gi tshul khrims kyi phung po gnod pa byed do //
translated: Because desire for sense-pleasures and malice harm the aggregate of morality.

original: gnyid dang rmugs pas shes rab kyi phung po la'o //
analyzed: gnyid dang rmugs pas shes rab kyi phung po la'o //
translated: Sleepiness and torpor harm the aggregate of wisdom.

original: rgod pa dang 'gyod pas ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po la'o //
analyzed: rgod pa dang 'gyod pas ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po la'o //
translated: By agitation and regret, with regard to the aggregate of concentration.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab dag med na bden pa rnams la the tshom za bar 'gyur ro zhes pa de'i phyir lnga'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab dag med na bden pa rnams la the tshom za bar 'gyur ro zhes pa de'i phyir lnga'o //
translated: Since there is no concentration and insight, one doubts the truths. Therefore, there are five.

original: shes pa rnams ni bcu gnyis te sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang lam dang zad pa dang mi skye ba dang chos dang rjes su dang gzhan gyi sems dang kun rdzob dang yongs su 'dris ba dang sgra ji bzhin shes pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa rnams ni bcu gnyis te sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang lam dang zad pa dang mi skye ba dang chos dang rjes su dang gzhan gyi sems dang kun rdzob dang yongs su 'dris ba dang sgra ji bzhin shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledges are twelve: of suffering, origin, cessation, path, of elimination, of non-production, of phenomena, of subsequent, of the mind of another, of convention, of thorough familiarization, and of the way things are.ğŸ”½The acceptances are eight: the acceptance of the doctrine with regard to suffering, and so on.

original: bzod pa rnams ni brgyad de sdug bsngal la chos byas pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa'o zhes pa sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams brjod zin to //
analyzed: bzod pa rnams ni brgyad de sdug bsngal la chos byas pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa'o zhes pa sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams brjod zin to //
translated: Thus the formations concomitant with mind have been explained.ğŸ”½The formations not concomitant with mind are also accepted as being of the same type as the mind.

original: sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed rnams kyang 'gal zhig khas len par byed pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed rnams kyang 'gal zhig khas len par byed pa 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: pa dang ma tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: pa dang ma tshogs pa'o //
translated: 1. acquisition, 2. non-acquisition, 3. the attainment of non-perception, 4. the attainment of cessation, 5. non-perception, 6. the faculty of life, 7. homogeneity, 8. the object-field, 9. the acquisition of the aggregates, 10. the object-field of birth, 11. birth, 12. old age, 13. duration, 14. impermanence, 15. the collection of names, 16. the collection of words, 17. the collection of syllables, 18. the collection of unconditioned dharmas.

original: de la thob pa ni rnyed pa dang yang dag par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de la thob pa ni rnyed pa dang yang dag par ldan pa'o //
translated: Acquisition is the possession of what has been obtained.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis ni ma thob pa dang nyams pa rnyed pa dang thob pa yang dag par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis ni ma thob pa dang nyams pa rnyed pa dang thob pa yang dag par ldan pa'o //
translated: It is of two kinds: acquisition of what has not been obtained and of what has been lost; and acquisition of what has been obtained and not lost.

original: bzlog pa las ma thob pa'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa las ma thob pa'o //
translated: The opposite of acquisition is non-acquisition.

original: thob pa dang ma thob pa 'di dag kyang rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa rnams kyi lung du ma bstan pa dang dge ba'i las dad pa dang thos pa dang bsam pa las byung ba la sogs pa rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: thob pa dang ma thob pa 'di dag kyang rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa rnams kyi lung du ma bstan pa dang dge ba'i las dad pa dang thos pa dang bsam pa las byung ba la sogs pa rnams kyi ste /
translated: Also, obtainment and nonobtainment are neutral and virtuous karma of those belonging to one's own mindstream, such as faith, hearing, and contemplation.

original: so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa dang so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa dag gi yang ngo //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa dang so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa dag gi yang ngo //
translated: Also, they are the cessations of analytical and nonanalytical cessation.ğŸ”½The meditative attainment of nondiscernment is the cessation of minds and mental factors that is preceded by the discernment of definite emergence of those who are free of attachment to the desire realm but are not free of attachment to higher realms.

original: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni dge rgyas kyi 'dod chags dang bral la gong ma'i 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i nges par 'byung ba'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba'i yid la byed pas sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams 'gog pa gang yin
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni dge rgyas kyi 'dod chags dang bral la gong ma'i 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i nges par 'byung ba'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba'i yid la byed pas sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams 'gog pa gang yin
translated: The meditative attainment of nondiscernment is the cessation of minds and mental factors that is preceded by the discernment of definite emergence of those who are free of attachment to the desire realm but are not free of attachment to higher realms.

original: pa'o // 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni ci yang med pa'i skye mched la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i zhi bar gnas pa'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba'i yid la byed pas gang sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: pa'o // 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni ci yang med pa'i skye mched la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i zhi bar gnas pa'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba'i yid la byed pas gang sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams 'gog pa'o //
translated: Cessation is the cessation of mind and mental factors by the attention that is preceded by the perception of peace, which is free from attachment to the sphere of nothingness.

original: 'du shes med pa pa ni 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i 'bras bu ste ;
analyzed: 'du shes med pa pa ni 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i 'bras bu ste ;
translated: The state of nonperception is the result of the meditative attainment of nonperception.

original: 'du shes med pa'i sems can gyi lhar skyes pa'i gang sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i sems can gyi lhar skyes pa'i gang sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams 'gog pa'o //
translated: It is the cessation of mind and mental factors of one who is born among the gods who are devoid of conception.

original: srog gi dbang po ni khams gsum pa'i tshe'o //
analyzed: srog gi dbang po ni khams gsum pa'i tshe'o //
translated: The faculty of life force is the life of sentient beings in the three realms.

original: rigs mthun pa nyid ni sems can mtshungs pa dang sems can 'dra ba nyid de sems can rnams don gcig par mngon par 'dod pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: rigs mthun pa nyid ni sems can mtshungs pa dang sems can 'dra ba nyid de sems can rnams don gcig par mngon par 'dod pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Homogeneity is the similarity of sentient beings and the similarity of sentient beings' states. It is the cause for the desire of sentient beings to have the same purpose.

original: skye ba ni phung po mngon par grub pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba ni phung po mngon par grub pa'o //
translated: Birth is the manifestation of the aggregates.

original: rga ba ni phung po yongs su smin pa'o //
analyzed: rga ba ni phung po yongs su smin pa'o //
translated: Aging is the maturation of the aggregates.

original: gnas pa ni skyes pa'i chos rnams ma zhig pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa ni skyes pa'i chos rnams ma zhig pa'o //
translated: Duration is the non-disappearance of things that have arisen.

original: mi rtag pa nyid ni skyes pa'i chos rnams 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid ni skyes pa'i chos rnams 'jig pa'o //
translated: Impermanence is the disappearance of things that have arisen.

original: ming gi tshogs ni ming gi tshig bla dvags 'di'o //
analyzed: ming gi tshogs ni ming gi tshig bla dvags 'di'o //
translated: The collection of names is the designation of a name.

original: tshig gi tshogs ni yi ge yongs su rdzogs pa 'di'o //
analyzed: tshig gi tshogs ni yi ge yongs su rdzogs pa 'di'o //
translated: The collection of words is the complete expression of a word.

original: yi ge'i tshogs ni yi ge rnams so //
analyzed: yi ge'i tshogs ni yi ge rnams so //
translated: The collection of letters is the letters.

original: ma tshogs pa ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams ma tshang ba'o //
analyzed: ma tshogs pa ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams ma tshang ba'o //
translated: Non-collection is the incompleteness of causes and conditions.

original: tshogs pa ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams ma tshang ba med pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs pa ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams ma tshang ba med pa'o //
translated: Collection is the completeness of causes and conditions.

original: theg pa chen po'i chos mngon pa kun las btus par gsungs pa ni so so'i skye bo gang zhe na /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i chos mngon pa kun las btus par gsungs pa ni so so'i skye bo gang zhe na /
translated: The Abhidharma of the Mahayana teaches: What is an ordinary person?

original: 'phags pa'i chos rnams @136a * //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos rnams @136a * //
translated: It is one who has not obtained the noble dharmas.

original: ma thob pa'o zhes pa de ma thob pa'i nang du 'dus so //
analyzed: ma thob pa'o zhes pa de ma thob pa'i nang du 'dus so //
translated: This is included in the non-obtainment of those.

original: de bzhin du mgyogs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du mgyogs pa gang zhe na /
translated: Similarly, what is swift?

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu myur du 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu myur du 'byung ba'o //
translated: It is the swift arising of causes and effects.

original: go rims gang zhe na /
analyzed: go rims gang zhe na /
translated: What is sequence?

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu cig car ma yin par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu cig car ma yin par 'byung ba'o //
translated: It is the arising of causes and effects without simultaneity.

original: dus gang zhe na /
analyzed: dus gang zhe na /
translated: What is time?

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu rgyun du 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu rgyun du 'byung ba ste /
translated: The past is the continuity of cause and effect that has occurred.

original: 'di yod na de la gang rgyu dang 'bras bu byung zin la 'gags zin pa de 'das pa'i dus zhes gdags so //
analyzed: 'di yod na de la gang rgyu dang 'bras bu byung zin la 'gags zin pa de 'das pa'i dus zhes gdags so //
translated: When this exists, that which is the cause and effect that has occurred and has ceased is designated as the past time.

original: gang ma byung ba de ma 'ongs par ro //
analyzed: gang ma byung ba de ma 'ongs par ro //
translated: That which has not occurred is the future.

original: gang byung las 'gags pa de da ltar ba zhes par ro //
analyzed: gang byung las 'gags pa de da ltar ba zhes par ro //
translated: That which has occurred and has ceased is the present.

original: yul gang zhe na /
analyzed: yul gang zhe na /
translated: What is a place?

original: phyogs bcu rnams na rgyu dang 'bras bu yod pa ste /
analyzed: phyogs bcu rnams na rgyu dang 'bras bu yod pa ste /
translated: It is the ten directions in which cause and effect exist.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu phyogs bcu khyab pa la yul du btags pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu phyogs bcu khyab pa la yul du btags pa'o //
translated: The ten directions pervaded by cause and effect are designated as a place.

original: grangs gang zhe na /
analyzed: grangs gang zhe na /
translated: What is number?

original: 'du byed rnams kyi so so tha dad pa ste bdag nyid gcig pa tha dad pa med pa nyid la gnyis dang gsum la sogs pa'i grangs mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyi so so tha dad pa ste bdag nyid gcig pa tha dad pa med pa nyid la gnyis dang gsum la sogs pa'i grangs mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes pa'o //
translated: It is the individual distinction of formations, because the number two, three, etc., do not occur in the absence of the individual distinction of a single self.

original: thob pa la sogs pas 'di rnams kyang khyad par gzhan spong ba las ldog pa tha dad bzhin du rnam par gzhag gi de kho na nyid du ni ma yin no zhes theg pa chen po dang tshad ma rnam 'grel la sogs par legs par dpyad do //
analyzed: thob pa la sogs pas 'di rnams kyang khyad par gzhan spong ba las ldog pa tha dad bzhin du rnam par gzhag gi de kho na nyid du ni ma yin no zhes theg pa chen po dang tshad ma rnam 'grel la sogs par legs par dpyad do //
translated: Thus, they are established as distinct from other attributes by the exclusion of their opposites, but not in reality. This has been well analyzed in the Mahayana and in the Pramanavarttika.

original: de'i phyir ldan par yin pa'i 'du byed rnams rdzas su med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ldan par yin pa'i 'du byed rnams rdzas su med pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, the formations that are associated are certainly not substantially existent.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams ni mdor na rnam pa gnyis te spang bar bya ba dang blang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams ni mdor na rnam pa gnyis te spang bar bya ba dang blang bar bya ba'o //
translated: The formations that are associated are, in brief, of two kinds: those that are to be abandoned and those that are to be adopted.

original: de la spang bar bya ba ni nyon mongs pa bcu rnams so //
analyzed: de la spang bar bya ba ni nyon mongs pa bcu rnams so //
translated: Among them, those that are to be abandoned are the ten afflictions.

original: de rnams kyi nang du shin tu sbyangs pa ma yin pa dang mi dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang lung du ma bstan pa dang lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba dang kun du sbyor ba dang 'ching ba dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang
analyzed: de rnams kyi nang du shin tu sbyangs pa ma yin pa dang mi dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang lung du ma bstan pa dang lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba dang kun du sbyor ba dang 'ching ba dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang
translated: Among them, those that are not pliancy, those that are nonvirtuous, those that are roots of nonvirtue, those that are neutral, those that are roots of the neutral, those that are fetters, those that are bonds, those that are secondary afflictions,

original: kun nas dkris pa dang zag pa dang chu bo dang sbyor ba dang nye bar len pa dang mdud pa dang sgrib pa rnams te ji lta ba de ltar brjod zin to //
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa dang zag pa dang chu bo dang sbyor ba dang nye bar len pa dang mdud pa dang sgrib pa rnams te ji lta ba de ltar brjod zin to //
translated: The entanglements, the floods, the bonds, the clingings, the underlying tendencies, and the obstructions are as already explained.

original: nyon mongs pa'i rgyu can kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems pa la sogs pa rnams kyang ji ltar srid par spang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rgyu can kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems pa la sogs pa rnams kyang ji ltar srid par spang bar bya ba'o //
translated: The afflicted entities that are caused by the afflictions, as well as the wholesome and indeterminate volition, etc., are also to be abandoned as appropriate.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang kun 'byung gi bden pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa'i kun rdzob kyi shes pa'ang spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang kun 'byung gi bden pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa'i kun rdzob kyi shes pa'ang spang bar bya'o //
translated: The truth of suffering and the truth of the origin of suffering, as well as the conventional knowledge that is accompanied by impurity, are also to be abandoned.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di thams cad nyon mongs pa spangs na spong bar byed do zhes pas nyon mongs pa spong bar byed pa kho na so sor rtog par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di thams cad nyon mongs pa spangs na spong bar byed do zhes pas nyon mongs pa spong bar byed pa kho na so sor rtog par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: For this very reason, it is said that all of these are abandoned when the afflictions are abandoned. Thus, it is only the abandonment of the afflictions that is considered to be the thorough knowledge of the way things are.

original: sems las byung ba lhag ma rnams ni @136b blang bar bya'o zhes pa 'du byed kyi phung po brjod zin to //
analyzed: sems las byung ba lhag ma rnams ni @136b blang bar bya'o zhes pa 'du byed kyi phung po brjod zin to //
translated: The remaining mental factors are to be adopted. Thus, the aggregate of volition has been discussed.

original: rnam par shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is consciousness?

original: gang don 'dzin pa dang yongs su gcod pa rnam par rig cing rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang don 'dzin pa dang yongs su gcod pa rnam par rig cing rtogs pa'o //
translated: It is the perception and cognition of the object.

original: dper na nor bu rnams ni nye bar gyur par gzhag pa'i tshon gyi rjes su byed par 'gyur te de bzhin du rnam par shes pa yul gyi rnam pa can du nye bar skye bzhin pa ni yul yongs su gcod par byed do //
analyzed: dper na nor bu rnams ni nye bar gyur par gzhag pa'i tshon gyi rjes su byed par 'gyur te de bzhin du rnam par shes pa yul gyi rnam pa can du nye bar skye bzhin pa ni yul yongs su gcod par byed do //
translated: For example, when a gem is placed near something, it assumes the aspect of that thing. In the same way, consciousness, which is born with the aspect of the object, apprehends the object.

original: yul gyi rnam pa tsam yang rnam par shes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yul gyi rnam pa tsam yang rnam par shes pa ma yin te /
translated: But the aspect of the object is not consciousness,

original: yul kho na'i rnam par shes pa nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul kho na'i rnam par shes pa nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that the object itself is consciousness.

original: don gyi rnam pa las rnam par shes pa phyi rol yang ma yin te de la don gyi rnam pa med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gyi rnam pa las rnam par shes pa phyi rol yang ma yin te de la don gyi rnam pa med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is consciousness external to the aspect of the object, because it would follow that the object would be without an aspect.

original: rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'i rnam pas phyi rol gyi don du btags la phyi rol gyi don gyis kyang rnam par shes pa btags so zhes pa 'di ltar phan tshun ltos nas rnam par shes pa dang rnam par shes par bya ba grub po //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'i rnam pas phyi rol gyi don du btags la phyi rol gyi don gyis kyang rnam par shes pa btags so zhes pa 'di ltar phan tshun ltos nas rnam par shes pa dang rnam par shes par bya ba grub po //
translated: The consciousness is designated as the external object by the aspect of the object, and the external object is designated as consciousness. Thus, consciousness and the object of consciousness are established by mutual dependence.

original: rnam par shes pa de rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de rnam pa drug ste /
translated: That consciousness is of six kinds:

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind consciousness.

original: gal te yang dbang po dang yul dang yid la byed pa tshogs pa dang snang ba la'ang ji ltar srid pa bzhin brten nas rnam par shes pa skye ba de lta na'ang mig gi rnam par shes pa zhes pa la sogs pas thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu
analyzed: gal te yang dbang po dang yul dang yid la byed pa tshogs pa dang snang ba la'ang ji ltar srid pa bzhin brten nas rnam par shes pa skye ba de lta na'ang mig gi rnam par shes pa zhes pa la sogs pas thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu
translated: Even though consciousness arises in dependence on the coming together of the sense faculty, the object, and mental activity, and on the appearance of the object, just as is possible, still, the conventional expressions â€œeye consciousness,â€ etc.,ğŸ”½are used because of the uncommon cause.

original: kho nas tha snyad gdags te rnga'i sgra dang nas kyi myu gu zhes pa ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: kho nas tha snyad gdags te rnga'i sgra dang nas kyi myu gu zhes pa ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like the expressions â€œsound of the drumâ€ and â€œsprout of barley.â€

original: mar gzhag par bya ba'i dbang po phan pa dang gnod pa dag gis rnam par 'gyur bar gyur na gsal ba dang / zhen pa nyid du rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod do /
analyzed: mar gzhag par bya ba'i dbang po phan pa dang gnod pa dag gis rnam par 'gyur bar gyur na gsal ba dang / zhen pa nyid du rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod do /

original: gzugs rung mtshan nyid can ni gzugs //
analyzed: gzugs rung mtshan nyid can ni gzugs //

original: tshor ba nyams myong bdag nyid do //

original: 'du shes mtshan mar 'dzin pa ste //

original: zhes pa rang gi mtshan nyid rnams gsungs so //

analyzed: du gyur pa ni yod pa ma yin no //

original: 'di ltar phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings te gang du nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba las rnam par grol ba'i phung po tsam mo //
analyzed: 'di ltar phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings te gang du nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba las rnam par grol ba'i phung po tsam mo //
translated: Thus, the realm of nirvana with remainder is the mere aggregates liberated from the bonds of affliction.

original: gzhan so sor brtags min gyi 'gog pa ni gang rgyu dang rkyen ma tshang ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan so sor brtags min gyi 'gog pa ni gang rgyu dang rkyen ma tshang ba ste /
translated: The other, nonanalytical cessation, is the noncompletion of causes and conditions.

analyzed: 'di ltar phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings phung po'i 'ching ba shin tu chad pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: Thus, the realm of nirvana without remainder is characterized by the complete severence of the bonds of the aggregates.

original: 'di gsum yang rdzas su yod pa 'dus ma byas pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'di gsum yang rdzas su yod pa 'dus ma byas pa'o zhes zer ro //

original: gzugs can gyi rdzas med pa tsam ni nam mkha'o //
analyzed: gzugs can gyi rdzas med pa tsam ni nam mkha'o //
translated: Space is the mere absence of physical resistance.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa tsam so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa tsam so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'o //
translated: The mere absence of affliction is analytical cessation.

original: phung po med pa tsam so sor brtags min gyi 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: phung po med pa tsam so sor brtags min gyi 'gog pa ste /
translated: The mere absence of the aggregates is nonanalytical cessation.

original: mar me shi ba ltar yin gyi rdzas su med do zhes mdo sde pa rnams chos ma yin par rtog pa rnams so //
analyzed: mar me shi ba ltar yin gyi rdzas su med do zhes mdo sde pa rnams chos ma yin par rtog pa rnams so //
translated: The Sautrantikas assert that these are not real entities, since they are like the extinction of a lamp.

original: 'dir ni 'dus ma byas chos ma yin la chos ma yin pa yang ma yin te 'dus byas bzhin kho na'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni 'dus ma byas chos ma yin la chos ma yin pa yang ma yin te 'dus byas bzhin kho na'o //
translated: Here, it is not an unconditioned phenomenon, nor is it a non-phenomenon, but rather it is just like a conditioned phenomenon.

original: de bzhin nyid kyang 'dir 'dus ma byas su brjod de chos thams cad gdod ma nas ma skyes ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyang 'dir 'dus ma byas su brjod de chos thams cad gdod ma nas ma skyes ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Suchness is also called unconditioned here because all phenomena are primordially unborn.

original: de bzhin nyid de ni chos kyi dbyings @137b dang so sor rig bya dang rnam par dag pa ste so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa dang so sor brtags min gyi 'gog pa zhes par yang brjod do //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid de ni chos kyi dbyings @137b dang so sor rig bya dang rnam par dag pa ste so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa dang so sor brtags min gyi 'gog pa zhes par yang brjod do //
translated: That suchness is also called the dharmadhatu, the object of individual knowledge, and the perfect, the analytical cessation, and the non-analytical cessation.

original: rnam par shes pa skye ba'i sgo'i don gyi skye mched bcu gnyis rnams so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa skye ba'i sgo'i don gyi skye mched bcu gnyis rnams so //

original: yid kyi skye mched la rnam pa bdun du phye nas khams rnam pa bco brgyad du brjod do //
analyzed: yid kyi skye mched la rnam pa bdun du phye nas khams rnam pa bco brgyad du brjod do //
translated: The eighteen constituents are stated by dividing the mental sense base into seven.

original: mig gi khams dang gzugs kyi khams dang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams nas yid kyi khams dang chos kyi khams dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams ji srid pa'o zhes pa rten drug dang dmigs pa drug pa dang rnam par shes pa drug gi bye
analyzed: mig gi khams dang gzugs kyi khams dang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams nas yid kyi khams dang chos kyi khams dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams ji srid pa'o zhes pa rten drug dang dmigs pa drug pa dang rnam par shes pa drug gi bye
translated: They are explained as eighteen through the distinctions of six supports, six objects, and six consciousnesses.

original: brag gis bco brgyad bshad pa rnams rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i don gyis na khams rnams so //
analyzed: brag gis bco brgyad bshad pa rnams rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i don gyis na khams rnams so //

original: khams bco brgyad po 'di rnams las 'dod pa dang yang dag par ldan pa rnams du zhe na thams cad do //
analyzed: khams bco brgyad po 'di rnams las 'dod pa dang yang dag par ldan pa rnams du zhe na thams cad do //
translated: How many of these eighteen constituents are associated with the desire realm? All of them.

original: gzugs dang yang dag par ldan pa du zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs dang yang dag par ldan pa du zhe na /
translated: How many are associated with the form realm?

original: bcu bzhi ste dri dang ro dang sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa rnams ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: bcu bzhi ste dri dang ro dang sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa rnams ma gtogs pa'o //

original: gzugs med pa dang yang dag par ldan pa rnams du zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs med pa dang yang dag par ldan pa rnams du zhe na /
translated: How many are associated with the formless realm?

original: phyi ma gsum po gang zag dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: phyi ma gsum po gang zag dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The latter three, together with the person.

original: yang dag par mi ldan pa rnams du zhe na /
analyzed: yang dag par mi ldan pa rnams du zhe na /
translated: How many are not associated?

original: de rnams nyid gang zag pa med pa rnams so //ğŸ”½dge ba rnams du /ğŸ”½mi dge ba rnams du /
analyzed: de rnams nyid gang zag pa med pa rnams so // dge ba rnams du / mi dge ba rnams du /
translated: They are the same as the above, but are not associated with the mind.ğŸ”½How many are wholesome?ğŸ”½How many are unwholesome?

original: lung du ma bstan pa rnams du zhe na /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa rnams du zhe na /
translated: How many are neutral?

original: bcu ni rnam pa gsum car te /
analyzed: bcu ni rnam pa gsum car te /
translated: Ten are of three kinds.

original: sems kyi khams bdun dang gzugs dang / sgra dang / chos kyi khams rnams so //
analyzed: sems kyi khams bdun dang gzugs dang / sgra dang / chos kyi khams rnams so //

analyzed: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ni sprul pa'i sems la sogs pa rnams so //

analyzed: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos kyi khams kha cig ma gtogs pa'o //

original: phyi'i du zhe na /
analyzed: phyi'i du zhe na /
translated: How many are external?

original: drug ste gang ma gtogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: drug ste gang ma gtogs pa rnams so //

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa du zhe na /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa du zhe na /

analyzed: gcig kho na yang ste don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med pa'o //

analyzed: de yang spros pa las 'das pa'o //
translated: And that is beyond conceptual elaboration.

analyzed: de la kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i nang du 'dus pa ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang lam gyi bden pa rnams so //

analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa'i rang gi ngo bo ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //

analyzed: de'i phyir bden pa gnyis kho na ste /

analyzed: sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba med do //

original: de'i phyir don dam par sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam par sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa yod pa ma yin te /

original: 'khor ba las yid 'byung ba'i don dang nyan thos rnams kyi dbang du mdzad nas gang zag gi bdag med pa'i de kho na nyid tsam la 'jug pa'i ched du mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i ngo bos de bstan pa 'ba' zhig ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba las yid 'byung ba'i don dang nyan thos rnams kyi dbang du mdzad nas gang zag gi bdag med pa'i de kho na nyid tsam la 'jug pa'i ched du mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i ngo bos de bstan pa 'ba' zhig ste /
translated: For the sake of those who are disgusted with cyclic existence, and for the sake of the hearers, the Buddha taught the reality of the absence of a self of persons alone, in terms of impermanence and so on, in order to introduce them to that.

original: bdag med pa gnyis ka bstan pa'i dbang du byas pa las @138b ni ma yin no zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa gnyis ka bstan pa'i dbang du byas pa las @138b ni ma yin no zhes rtogs par bya'o //

analyzed: gang rnams kun rdzob pa'i rang bzhin la yang skur pa 'debs par byed pa dang / gang dam pa yin pa'i bstan bcos nyan pa la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pas blo gros phyin ci log can rnams /

analyzed: kun rdzob yod pa ma yin pa brdzun pa kho na la rtag pa la sogs pa'i dngos por sgro 'dogs shing gzugs la sogs pa ji ltar snang ba yang ji lta ba de ltar yongs su 'dzin par byed pa de rnams sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i mthar lhung ba'i blos mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'o zhes ji lta ba bzhin du don dam pa'i tshul gyi rgya mtsho shin tu zab mo la mi 'jug pas de'i don du bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i mdor skye ba med pa la sogs
translated: They superimpose permanence and so forth on the unreal, the mere falsity of the relative. They also grasp forms and so forth just as they appear. They fall to the extremes of superimposition and denial.

original: pa bstan pa don dam pa'i dbang du byas pa nyid kho nar gsal par mdzad cing ngo bo nyid med par rnam pa gsum gyi dgongs pa bstan pas dbu ma'i lam mtha' gnyis dang bral ba nges pa'i don kho nar gzhung 'dzugs par mdzad do //
analyzed: pa bstan pa don dam pa'i dbang du byas pa nyid kho nar gsal par mdzad cing ngo bo nyid med par rnam pa gsum gyi dgongs pa bstan pas dbu ma'i lam mtha' gnyis dang bral ba nges pa'i don kho nar gzhung 'dzugs par mdzad do //
translated: With a mind that has fallen to extremes, they do not enter the extremely profound ocean of the way of ultimate reality, just as it is, called â€œfree from the two extremes.â€ For their sake, the Transcendent Conqueror clearly taught in the Definitive Explanation of the Intent SÅ«tra that the teachings on nonarising and so forth are only from the perspective of the ultimate. He also taught the three types of lack of nature, thereby establishing the scriptures as being only of definitive meaning, the middle path free from the two extremes.

original: de la gang ma brtags na yid ches pa mthong ba ji lta ba sgyu ma bzhin du rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i dngos po de gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de la gang ma brtags na yid ches pa mthong ba ji lta ba sgyu ma bzhin du rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i dngos po de gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: That which is seen to be credible when not investigated is the dependent nature, which is like an illusion, an entity that arises in dependence.

original: de yang kun rdzob tu sgyu ma ltar pha rol rkyen gyi stobs kyis skye'i rang bzhin kho na ni ma yin pa sa skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de yang kun rdzob tu sgyu ma ltar pha rol rkyen gyi stobs kyis skye'i rang bzhin kho na ni ma yin pa sa skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Moreover, it is like an illusion in the relative, arising by the power of other conditions, and not by its own nature. Therefore, it is presented as the nature-lessness of production.

original: gang yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de rang bzhin stong pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gang yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de rang bzhin stong pa kho na'o //
translated: Moreover, whatever arises in dependence is empty of intrinsic reality.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid de kho na la gang rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin don dam pa par sgro 'dogs pa de kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid de kho na la gang rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin don dam pa par sgro 'dogs pa de kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The imagined nature is that which superimposes an ultimate intrinsic nature, such as permanence or impermanence, on just that dependent nature.

original: de'i 'di ji ltar kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i 'di ji ltar kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Since that is not established as the characteristic of the imagined,

original: mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
translated: it is presented as the nature-lessness of characteristics.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa 'di yang dngos por na gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kho na la rnam par gzhag ste de kho na la de'i mtshan nyid du brtags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa 'di yang dngos por na gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kho na la rnam par gzhag ste de kho na la de'i mtshan nyid du brtags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This realitylessness is posited only in the relative reality, for the characteristic of that is imagined in it.

original: gang yang chos thams cad don dam par rtag tu rang bzhin gyis ngo bo nyid med par gnas pa de yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: gang yang chos thams cad don dam par rtag tu rang bzhin gyis ngo bo nyid med par gnas pa de yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: That which is the ultimate, the constant, natural realitylessness of all things is the perfect reality.

original: de ni rtag tu sgro btags pa med pa nyid du grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rtag tu sgro btags pa med pa nyid du grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is always established as non-superimposition.

analyzed: gang dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i mdor gsungs pa gang gzhan dbang gi mtshan nyid dang yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid la rnam pa thams cad du kun nas nyon mongs pa pa dang rnam par byang ba pa gtan nas bral ba nyid de de la mi dmigs pa 'di ni stong pa nyid @139a * //
translated: In the Saá¹ƒdhinirmocana SÅ«tra, the characteristic of the relative and the characteristic of the perfect are said to be the complete absence of all defilement and purity, respectively, and the non-apprehension of that is

analyzed: kyi mtshan nyid mtha' dag ces brjod do zhes bya'o //
translated: said to be the characteristic of emptiness.

analyzed: de la yang 'dod chags la sogs pa gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid kun rdzob pa rnams la kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa nyid dang 'khor bar kun du sbyor ba nyid dang gnyen po'i phyogs kyi gegs byed pa nyid la sogs pa dngos po bar sgro btags pa gang yin pa de ni de rnams la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The imagined reality is that which is imagined to exist in things that are dependent realities, such as attachment, as something that is really existent, such as the afflictions that afflict the dependent reality, the bonds that bind one to samsara, the obstacles to the side of the antidotes, and so on.ğŸ”½The perfected reality is the perfected reality that is the unmistaken perfection in the yogiâ€™s conventional reality.

analyzed: rnal 'byor pa'i kun rdzob tu phyin ci ma log par yongs su grub pas yongs su grub pa'i yongs su grub pa'i phyir yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa rnam par byang ba rnams la gang mi mthun pa'i phyogs nges par 'joms
translated: The perfected reality is the factors of enlightenment and so on that are completely purified, which are the certain destruction of the discordant side, the side of the afflictions.

original: par byed pa nyid dang mya ngan las 'das pa la yang dag par sbyor ba nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bor dngos po'i chos nyid du sgro btags pa de ni de rnams la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: par byed pa nyid dang mya ngan las 'das pa la yang dag par sbyor ba nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bor dngos po'i chos nyid du sgro btags pa de ni de rnams la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The imagined characteristic is the superimposition of the nature of entities, such as the nature of the creator and the nature of the one who is connected with nirvana.

original: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo'i chos 'di de gnyis ka'ang rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chos kyi dbyings la mi srid de /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo'i chos 'di de gnyis ka'ang rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chos kyi dbyings la mi srid de /
translated: Both of these characteristics of the imagined are impossible in the realm of the Dharma, which is naturally luminous,

original: don dam par kun nas nyon mongs pa la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par kun nas nyon mongs pa la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because ultimately there is no defilement, etc.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos 'di rnams thams cad kyang don dam par skye ba med par ro gcig pa nyid kyis na rnam par dbye ba mi rigs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //

translated: All these dharmas of defilement and purification are of one taste in non-production ultimately, and it is not possible to distinguish them.

original: de'i phyir gnyis kyi gnyis ka yang stong la yang dag pa'i kun rdzob tu gnyis ka'ang gnas pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i phyogs med pa'i nyes pa yang med de /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyis kyi gnyis ka yang stong la yang dag pa'i kun rdzob tu gnyis ka'ang gnas pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i phyogs med pa'i nyes pa yang med de /
translated: Therefore, both are empty of duality, and since both are present in the correct relative, there is no fault of the absence of the factors of affliction and purification.

original: de skad du'ang 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag phyed dang gsum par gsungs par /
analyzed: de skad du'ang 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag phyed dang gsum par gsungs par /
translated: Thus, it says in the Perfection of Wisdom in 3,500 Lines:

analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa gzugs ni 'dod chags kyi chos can nam 'dod chags dang bral ba'i chos can ma yin no //
translated: SubhÅ«ti, form is not a phenomenon of attachment nor is it a phenomenon of freedom from attachment.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Likewise, it is the same for feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness.

original: gang 'di rnams kyi 'dod chags ma yin pa'i chos nyid dang 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin pa'i chos nyid 'di yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'di rnams kyi 'dod chags ma yin pa'i chos nyid dang 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin pa'i chos nyid 'di yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: This suchness of form that is not attachment and not freedom from attachment, this suchness of feeling, this suchness of perception, this suchness of formation, and this suchness of consciousness that is not attachment and not freedom from attachmentâ€”this is the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du gzugs ni zhe sdang gi chos can nam zhe sdang med pa'i chos can nam gti mug gi chos can nam gti mug med pa'i chos can ma yin no //

translated: Similarly, form is not characterized by hatred, nor is it not characterized by hatred; it is not characterized by delusion, nor is it not characterized by non-delusion.

original: de bzhin du gang rnam par shes pa ji srid pa'i gti mug ma yin pa'i chos nyid dang gti mug dang bral ba yang ma yin pa nyid kyi chos nyid 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin @139b pa'o ;
analyzed: de bzhin du gang rnam par shes pa ji srid pa'i gti mug ma yin pa'i chos nyid dang gti mug dang bral ba yang ma yin pa nyid kyi chos nyid 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin @139b pa'o ;
translated: Similarly, consciousness is not characterized by delusion up to the end of the realm of space, nor is it not characterized by non-delusion. This suchness of consciousness, which is neither delusion nor free from delusion, is the perfection of wisdom.

original: / gzugs ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'am rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: / gzugs ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'am rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba med do //
translated: Form does not become defiled or purified.

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: Similarly, up to consciousness.

original: gang 'di rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin rnam par byang ba ma yin pa 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: gang 'di rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin rnam par byang ba ma yin pa 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes so //
translated: This non-defilement and non-purification of these is the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'o na kun rdzob tu skye'o zhes gsungs pa ma yin nam ;
analyzed: 'o na kun rdzob tu skye'o zhes gsungs pa ma yin nam ;
translated: Well then, isn't it said that it arises conventionally?

original: / de la kun rdzob ces pa 'di ci zhe na /
analyzed: / de la kun rdzob ces pa 'di ci zhe na /
translated: What is this so-called conventional?

original: rang bzhin med pa'i dngos po rnams la yang gang dngos por phyin ci log gi rnam par sgro 'dogs pa 'khrul pa'i blo de ni kun rdzob tu brjod de /
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa'i dngos po rnams la yang gang dngos por phyin ci log gi rnam par sgro 'dogs pa 'khrul pa'i blo de ni kun rdzob tu brjod de /
translated: Things that lack intrinsic reality are said to be conventional, because the confused mind that superimposes the opposite of the way things really are, that is, the superimposition of intrinsic reality, is a concealer.

original: 'di la bsgrib par bya ba'am 'dis de kho na nyid 'gebs pa ltar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la bsgrib par bya ba'am 'dis de kho na nyid 'gebs pa ltar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it acts as if it were obscuring the way things really are or as if it were covering reality.

original: de bzhin du yang mdor gsungs pa ;
analyzed: de bzhin du yang mdor gsungs pa ;
translated: And the sutra teaches this in the same way:

original: kun rdzob tu ni dngos rnams skye //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni dngos rnams skye //
translated: Things arise in the conventional.

original: don dam par ni rang bzhin med //
analyzed: don dam par ni rang bzhin med //
translated: Ultimately, they have no intrinsic reality.

original: rang bzhin med pa gang 'khrul pa //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa gang 'khrul pa //
translated: That which is without intrinsic reality

original: de ni yang dag kun rdzob 'dod //
analyzed: de ni yang dag kun rdzob 'dod //
translated: is asserted to be the correct conventional.

analyzed: ces so // de las byung ba'i phyir des nye bar bstan pa'i dngos po brdzun pa thams cad ni kun rdzob par brjod do //
translated: Because things arise from that, all false things that are taught by that are said to be conventional.

original: de yang thog ma med pa'i 'khrul pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pa'i dbang gis dngos po med pa las dngos po yang dag par yod pa lta bur nye bar ston cing srog chags thams cad la skye ste gang las de'i bsam pa'i dbang gis dngos po brdzun
analyzed: de yang thog ma med pa'i 'khrul pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pa'i dbang gis dngos po med pa las dngos po yang dag par yod pa lta bur nye bar ston cing srog chags thams cad la skye ste gang las de'i bsam pa'i dbang gis dngos po brdzun
translated: Moreover, by the power of the complete maturation of beginningless predispositions for error, things that are unreal appear as if they were real entities and arise for all living beings.

analyzed: pa'i ngo bo thams cad kun rdzob tu yod par brjod de //
translated: From that, due to the power of their thoughts, all things that are false by nature are said to exist conventionally.

analyzed: 'di rnams yang dag par dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin te ji ltar snang ba de kho na nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: ri bong gi rva bzhin du gtan med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin te ma brtags na dga' ba'i rnam par so sor snang ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de ltar ni sgyu ma'i skyes bu la sogs pa la 'khrul pa'i shes pa dang ldan pa'i mi rnams kyis gang gzhag pa'i ngo bo de bzhin du dngos po thams cad la brdzun pa'i rnam pa can gyi shes pas gang sgro btags pa de ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes tha snyad du byas so //

analyzed: sgyu ma'i skyes bu la sogs pa de kho na la yang rnam par shes pa ma bslad pa rnams kyis ji ltar gzhag pa'i ngo bo de bzhin du dngos po thams cad la gang yang dag pa'i tshad mas nges pa'i ngo bo de ni don dam pa'i bden

translated: The nature that is posited by a mistaken consciousness and a nonmistaken consciousness is the two truths, the conventional and the ultimate. In dependence on those, the things that are observed by those with eye disease and so on, such as floating hairs and so on,

analyzed: rnam par rig par smra ba rnams kyi gzung ba dang 'dzin @140a * //
translated: The two aspects of the object and subject of cognition of the VijÃ±ÄnavÄdins are posited as existing conventionally and as not existing ultimately, and so on.

analyzed: pa'i rnam pa gnyis la kun rdzob tu yod pa nyid dang don dam par med pa nyid do zhes pa la sogs par rnam par gzhag pa la ltos pa'i bye brag gis 'gal ba med pa de bzhin du dngos po thams cad la'o //

analyzed: des na de la brten pa'i dbang gis kun rdzob tu dngos po skye'o zhes brjod la /

analyzed: don dam par ni skye ba med do //

analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i don gyi yul can nyid kyi phyir yang dag pa'i thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa thams cad kho na ni don dam par brjod de dam pa 'di'i don yin zhes byas nas so //

original: dngos dang brgyud pas byas pa ni khyad par te /

analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes ni ma yin la dpyod pa med pa tsam yang ma yin no //

analyzed: de'i phyir de rab tu grags pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir dngos po brdzun pa'i ngo bo thams cad ni kun rdzob pa kho na'o //

analyzed: yang na kun rdzob ni 'jig rten gyi grags pa ste /

analyzed: gang yang grags pa'i rjes su 'brang nas rab tu brtags pa /

analyzed: dper na / 'di ni bdag gam sems can med //

original: chos 'di rnams ni rgyu dang bcas //
analyzed: chos 'di rnams ni rgyu dang bcas //

original: des na dngos po gcig la bstan bcos byed pa rnams kyis ngo bo du mar sgro btags pa yod na'ang dngos po phan tshun 'gal ba'i rang bzhin du ma nyid du thal ba med do //

translated: Therefore, although the treatises posit many natures in a single thing, there is no entailment that a thing has many natures that are mutually contradictory in essence.

analyzed: yang na sgyu ma'i don ni kun rdzob kyi don te mi bden pa'i don ni sgyu ma'i don no //

analyzed: sgyu ma'i don 'khrul pa'i shes pa'i ngo bo yin yang shes pa dngos po nyid du thal ba yang ma yin te /

analyzed: gcig la ngo bo nyid du mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: mi bden pa'i ngo bo yang brdzun pa'i phyir 'khrul pa nyid na'ang shes pa bden pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /

analyzed: de dag ni bdag nyid thams cad kyi phan tshun sna tshogs med pa'i phyir dang gcig la cha shas dang cha shas can gyi dngos po mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not have a mutual variety of all aspects, and because it is impossible for a single thing to have parts and a whole.

analyzed: de'i phyir shes pa'ang brdzun gyi phyir shes bya nang gi tshul las 'di khyad par che'o //

analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa pa ni su'ang kun rdzob sgra tsam zhes par 'dod pa med do //

analyzed: gang yang mdo las /
translated: Also, a sÅ«tra says:

analyzed: 'di rnams thams cad ming tsam ste //
translated: All of these are mere names,

analyzed: 'du shes tsam la rab tu gnas // rjod par byed las tha dad pa'i //

analyzed: gang rnams rjod par byed pa dngos por gyur pa kho na dang / brjod par bya ba yang de las gzhan du gyur par rtog par byed de de'i 'dod pa dgag pa'i ched du rjod byed dang brjod par bya ba dag rtog pa la gnas pa nyid kho nar nye bar bstan pa'o //
translated: Here, some imagine that the means of expression is a real entity and that the object of expression is something other than that. In order to refute their opinion, it is taught that the means of expression and the object of expression exist only in the imagination.

analyzed: 'dir 'du shes ni rtog pa ste rtog pa'i ngo bo kho na rjod byed du ming gi sgras mngon par dgongs so //

analyzed: rna ba'i shes pa la snang ba'i don ni ma @141a * //

analyzed: yin te rjod par byed pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not the means of expression.

analyzed: de tsam nyid du zad na yang thams cad gzugs la sogs pa sna tshogs su snang bar mi 'gyur la phung po la sogs pa rnam par gzhag par yang mi 'gyur ro //

analyzed: don dam par sgro btags pa'i ngo bor brjod par bya bzhin pa ni kun rdzob kho nar 'gyur te /

translated: because it is beyond all conceptual elaborations.

translated: That is stated in the sÅ«tras:

translated: O son of the gods, if ultimately the ultimate truth were to become the nature of the object of body, speech, and mind, it would not be counted as a truth, but would be only the conventional truth.

analyzed: yang na dngos po rnams kyi skad cig pa nyid ni kun rdzob po //
translated: Or, the momentariness of things is conventional.

analyzed: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung ba dang ma byung ba dag tu'ang dus thams cad du gnas pa nyid kyi phyir rtag pa'o //

translated: This is illogical, because just as the consciousness that is an inference is engaged in the apprehension of a false generality, and thus it is a conventional entity, still it is asserted to be a valid cognition because it causes one to attain the desired goal.

analyzed: kun rdzob 'ga' zhig kyang rang gi ngo bo brdzun pa yin yang tshul bzhin du thos pa dang bsam pa la sogs pa'i rgyu brgyud pas 'ongs pa nyid kyi phyir 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i don la mi slu ba nyid kyis tshad ma'o zhes
translated: In the same way, although some conventional entities are false in terms of their nature, still they are valid cognitions because they are not deceptive with regard to mundane and transcendent goals, since they are the outcome of a causal continuum that properly includes hearing and contemplation.

translated: All of these presentations of valid cognition and so on are only conventional. This is established in the Thorough Exposition of Valid Cognition and so on. Therefore this is nonsense.

original: kun rdzob thams cad kyang dngos po'i ngo bo ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bsgrubs zin to //
analyzed: kun rdzob thams cad kyang dngos po'i ngo bo ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bsgrubs zin to //

translated: Therefore it is reasonable that the substantial basis of these conventional phenomena, such as trees, is only a concordant aspect that has no beginning and is not an entity.

translated: It is not consciousness and so on, which are entities, because they are incompatible with it.

translated: Therefore, when not analyzed, whatever is imputed to arise, endure, and be destroyed, like illusions, dreams, cities of scent-eaters, emanations, and so on, are posited as conventional truths.

analyzed: gang sgro ma btags par yang dag pa'i tshad mas yongs su nges pa skye ba med pa la sogs pa de ni don dam pa'i bden pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: Whatever is ascertained by valid knowledge without imputation, such as nonarising, is the ultimate truth.

original: de skad du yang chos yang dag par sdud par gsungs pa /
analyzed: de skad du yang chos yang dag par sdud par gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said in the Compendium of Dharma:

analyzed: skye ba med pa ni bden no //

analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa chos rnams mi bden te brdzun pa slu ba'i chos can no zhes so //

analyzed: dngos su na don dam pa ni spros pa thams cad las 'das pa nyid kyi phyir ro ;

analyzed: skye ba dang skye ba med pa dag dus thams cad du gnas pa nyid kyi phyir 'dus ma byas pa'o zhes kyang bstan gyi ;

analyzed: bzhin med pa nyid la 'jug go //

analyzed: kun rdzob tu rnam par shes pa bzhin du phyi'i don yang gnas te ;

analyzed: mngon sum rnam pa gnyis su yang slob dpon rnams kyis rnam par phye ste /

analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi dang / cig shos rnams kyi'o //

analyzed: de la gang cig shos rnams kyi mngon sum de ni don dam pa'i dbang du byas nas ma 'khrul par mi brjod de //

analyzed: gzhan du na ni thams cad rnal 'byor pa kho nar 'gyur gyi tshu rol mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //

original: tha snyad du rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin ji ltar grags pa'i don la mi slu ba tsam la de ma 'khrul par brjod pa 'ba' zhig go //

original: gang yang nyan thos la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i mngon sum de ni gang zag la bdag med pa nyid tsam mngon du byed par zhugs pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: gang yang nyan thos la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i mngon sum de ni gang zag la bdag med pa nyid tsam mngon du byed par zhugs pa nyid kyi phyir /

original: de la mi slu ba nyid kyis mngon sum tshad ma ste /
analyzed: de la mi slu ba nyid kyis mngon sum tshad ma ste /

analyzed: dngos su na de kho na mi slu ba nyid kyis rnam pa thams cad kyi de kho na nyid la so sor ma 'khrul ba ste /

analyzed: de yang de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med pa zhes par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes so //

original: de la tha snyad pa'i mngon sum gyi spyod yul gyi don rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du brdzun par snang ba la yang gang byis pa rnams kyis dngos po pa don dam pa ba'i ngo bo la sogs par sgro btags pa de la rjes su dpag pas
analyzed: de la tha snyad pa'i mngon sum gyi spyod yul gyi don rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du brdzun par snang ba la yang gang byis pa rnams kyis dngos po pa don dam pa ba'i ngo bo la sogs par sgro btags pa de la rjes su dpag pas
translated: In that regard, the objects that are the domain of conventional direct perception appear to be false, like dreams and so on. The superimpositions that childish beings make about them, such as that they are ultimate entities, are undermined by inference.

original: klu'i rgyal po ma dros pas zhus par /

translated: Thus it is said in the RatnÄvalÄ«:ğŸ”½All the dharmas of the world

translated: The yogis and yoginis should completely abandon all those things that are false and never used for the benefit of self or other.
