translated: By investigating conceptualization, one cultivates the recollection of inhalation and exhalation.

original: dbugs rngub pa ni dbugs sdud pa ste 'jug pa'i rlung ngo //
analyzed: dbugs rngub pa ni dbugs sdud pa ste 'jug pa'i rlung ngo //
translated: Inhalation is the gathering of the breath, the wind that enters.

original: dbugs 'byung ba ni dbugs spro ba ste phyir 'gro ba'i rlung ngo //
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba ni dbugs spro ba ste phyir 'gro ba'i rlung ngo //
translated: Exhalation is the dispersion of the breath, the wind that exits.

original: de la dmigs pa'i shes rab ni dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba rjes su dran pa ste dran pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir dran par brjod do //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i shes rab ni dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba rjes su dran pa ste dran pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir dran par brjod do //
translated: The wisdom that has that as its object is the recollection of inhalation and exhalation. It is called recollection because it is the cause of mindfulness.

original: de la lus dang sems dag brlan nas dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba tsam la sems gtad de dbugs 'byung ba dang dbugs rngub pa dag so sor gcig dang gnyis dang / ji srid bcu'i bar du rnam par g-yeng ba med par bgrang bar byed de /
analyzed: de la lus dang sems dag brlan nas dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba tsam la sems gtad de dbugs 'byung ba dang dbugs rngub pa dag so sor gcig dang gnyis dang / ji srid bcu'i bar du rnam par g-yeng ba med par bgrang bar byed de /
translated: Having thus moistened his body and mind, he fixes his attention on the mere in-and-out breathing, counting the in-breaths and out-breaths one by one up to ten without distraction.

original: de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin thob kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin thob kyi bar du'o //
translated: He continues in this way until he attains concentration.

original: 'di ni rlung 'ba' zhig kho na ma yin gyi de rnams ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang de la brten pa'i phung po las gyur pa dang sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyang ngo zhes phung po lngar nye bar rtog par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ni rlung 'ba' zhig kho na ma yin gyi de rnams ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang de la brten pa'i phung po las gyur pa dang sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyang ngo zhes phung po lngar nye bar rtog par byed do //
translated: He does not consider the breath alone, but also the four great elements and the derivative form that is based on them, as well as the mind and mental factors. Thus he contemplates the five aggregates.

original: rlung la dmigs pa'i blo bsgyur nas gong nas gong du dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams la kun du sbyor ro //
analyzed: rlung la dmigs pa'i blo bsgyur nas gong nas gong du dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams la kun du sbyor ro //
translated: Having thus turned his attention to the breath, he applies himself to the wholesome roots in ever increasing measure.

original: de nas zhi gnas rdzogs pa ni lus dang tshor ba dang sems dang chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams gzugs ni gzugs su rung ba'i mtshan nyid can no zhes pa la sogs pa rang gi mtshan nyid kyis dang / stong pa dang bdag med pa nyid dag spyi'i mtshan nyid de des bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas zhi gnas rdzogs pa ni lus dang tshor ba dang sems dang chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams gzugs ni gzugs su rung ba'i mtshan nyid can no zhes pa la sogs pa rang gi mtshan nyid kyis dang / stong pa dang bdag med pa nyid dag spyi'i mtshan nyid de des bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Then, the completion of serenity is the applications of mindfulness of body, feeling, mind, and phenomena, which are cultivated by means of their individual and general characteristics.

original: de la dang po rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rigs can lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la 'jug ste de yang mi gtsang bar 'du shes phyin ci log gi gnyen por ro //
analyzed: de la dang po rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rigs can lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la 'jug ste de yang mi gtsang bar 'du shes phyin ci log gi gnyen por ro //
translated: Among them, one first enters the application of mindfulness of body, which has the individual characteristic of being suitable as form.

original: de nas tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la ste de yang sdug bsngal la bde bar phyin ci log gi gnyen po'o //
analyzed: de nas tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la ste de yang sdug bsngal la bde bar phyin ci log gi gnyen po'o //
translated: Then, one enters the application of mindfulness of feeling, which is the antidote to the misconception of pleasure in pain.

original: de nas kyang sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la ste de yang mi rtag pa la rtag par phyin ci log gi gnyen po'o //
analyzed: de nas kyang sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la ste de yang mi rtag pa la rtag par phyin ci log gi gnyen po'o //
translated: Then, one enters the application of mindfulness of mind, which is the antidote to the misconception of permanence in impermanence.

original: de'i da ma thag tu chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la ste de yang dad pa la sogs pa chos tsam la dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir bdag med pa la bdag tu 'du shes pa'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: de'i da ma thag tu chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la ste de yang dad pa la sogs pa chos tsam la dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir bdag med pa la bdag tu 'du shes pa'i gnyen po'o //
translated: Also, because it focuses on the mere Dharma of faith and so on, it is the antidote to the conception of self in the absence of self.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mdzod du gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mdzod du gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore the AbhidharmakoÅ›a declares:

original: phyin ci log gi gnyen por bzhi //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi gnyen por bzhi //
translated: Four are antidotes to the misconceptions.

original: zhes so // gang gi tshe rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pas chos zhes byas nas phung po lnga la dmigs pa kho na chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin pa de'i tshe mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang stong pa dang bdag med pa'i rnam pa rnams kyis chosğŸ”½thams cad sgom par byed do //
analyzed: zhes so // gang gi tshe rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pas chos zhes byas nas phung po lnga la dmigs pa kho na chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin pa de'i tshe mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang stong pa dang bdag med pa'i rnam pa rnams kyis chos thams cad sgom par byed do //
translated: When one focuses on the five aggregates alone, calling them the Dharma because they hold their own characteristics, then at that time one cultivates all phenomena with the aspects of impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and selflessness.

original: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa bzhi nang du 'dus pa skad cig ma nyid dang gang zag gi bdag med pa'i rnam @154a * //ğŸ”½pa dag tu 'am /
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa bzhi nang du 'dus pa skad cig ma nyid dang gang zag gi bdag med pa'i rnam @154a * //ğŸ”½pa dag tu 'am /
translated: The four aspects of impermanence and so on are included in the internal aspects of momentariness and the selflessness of persons.

original: gang zag gi bdag med pa nang du 'dus pa'i skad cig ma nyid kyi rnam par chos thams cad sgom par byed do //
analyzed: gang zag gi bdag med pa nang du 'dus pa'i skad cig ma nyid kyi rnam par chos thams cad sgom par byed do //
translated: One meditates on all dharmas in the aspect of momentariness, since the selflessness of persons is included in that.

original: dran pa kho na nye bar 'jog pa yin pas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa kho na nye bar 'jog pa yin pas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
translated: The establishment of mindfulness is mindfulness itself, since it is the establishment of mindfulness.

original: gang rnams 'di dran pa nye bar 'jog pas na zhes smra ba de rnams ni shes rab dran pa nye bar gzhag par 'dod do //ğŸ”½de'i rjes su mi dge ba dang dge ba skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dag go rims bzhin du spong ba dang mi skye ba dang 'phel ba dang bskyed pa'i rgyur brtson 'grus yang dag par spong ba rnams te 'di rnams kyis sems yang dag par 'jog pa'i
analyzed: gang rnams 'di dran pa nye bar 'jog pas na zhes smra ba de rnams ni shes rab dran pa nye bar gzhag par 'dod do // de'i rjes su mi dge ba dang dge ba skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dag go rims bzhin du spong ba dang mi skye ba dang 'phel ba dang bskyed pa'i rgyur brtson 'grus yang dag par spong ba rnams te 'di rnams kyis sems yang dag par 'jog pa'i
translated: Those who say that it is the establishment of mindfulness because of the establishment of mindfulness, maintain that the establishment of mindfulness is wisdom.ğŸ”½The four right efforts are the causes of the abandonment of nonvirtue and virtue that have arisen and the nonarising of virtue and nonvirtue that have not arisen, respectively.

original: phyir yang dag 'jog bzhi rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: phyir yang dag 'jog bzhi rnams kyang ngo //
translated: The four bases of supernatural power are the causes of the establishment of mind, since they are the causes of the establishment of mind.

original: de nas brtson 'grus dang ldan pa'i sems las su rung bar 'gyur zhes pas 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / sems kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa gnas nyid kyi phyir rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi rnams so //
analyzed: de nas brtson 'grus dang ldan pa'i sems las su rung bar 'gyur zhes pas 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / sems kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa gnas nyid kyi phyir rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi rnams so //
translated: Thus, the four bases of supernatural powers are the concentration of aspiration, the concentration of effort, the concentration of mind and the concentration of investigation, because they are the bases of supramundane supernatural powers.

original: de ltar ni 'dun pa drag po kho na legs par sbyor ba la sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin skyed par byed pa dang yang dag par spong ba'i brtson 'grus rnams kyis mi dge ba spong zhing dge ba bskyed pa la legs par sbyor
analyzed: de ltar ni 'dun pa drag po kho na legs par sbyor ba la sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin skyed par byed pa dang yang dag par spong ba'i brtson 'grus rnams kyis mi dge ba spong zhing dge ba bskyed pa la legs par sbyor
translated: Thus, strong aspiration alone generates concentration, which is characterized by a single focus of the mind on proper application and through the effort of the perfect abandonments, one properly applies oneself to abandoning nonvirtue and generating virtue.

original: ba dang zhi gnas dang rab tu 'dzin pa dang btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan sems rnams kyis yongs su sbyong ba las dang / ci bdag mi dge ba phra mo rnams kun du spyod dam bdag yongs su brtag par bya'o zhes yang dag par nye bar 'jog pa las te de 'di rnams ni 'dun pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams so //
analyzed: ba dang zhi gnas dang rab tu 'dzin pa dang btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan sems rnams kyis yongs su sbyong ba las dang / ci bdag mi dge ba phra mo rnams kun du spyod dam bdag yongs su brtag par bya'o zhes yang dag par nye bar 'jog pa las te de 'di rnams ni 'dun pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams so //
translated: These are the concentrations of aspiration and so on.

original: 'di rnams skyes pa kun nas dkris pa rnams ring du gyur pa na /
analyzed: 'di rnams skyes pa kun nas dkris pa rnams ring du gyur pa na /
translated: When these have arisen and the entanglements have been removed,

original: bag la nyal rnams spong ba'i ched du slar yang yang dag par spong ba rnams kyis brtson 'grus rtsom pa la spong ba 'du byed brgyad rnams 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bag la nyal rnams spong ba'i ched du slar yang yang dag par spong ba rnams kyis brtson 'grus rtsom pa la spong ba 'du byed brgyad rnams 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: in order to abandon the latent states, one again exerts effort through the correct abandonings. The eight formative factors of abandonment arise:

original: 'dun pa dang brtson 'grus dang dad pa dang shin tu sbyangs pa dang dran pa dang shes bzhin dang sems pa dang btang snyoms so //
analyzed: 'dun pa dang brtson 'grus dang dad pa dang shin tu sbyangs pa dang dran pa dang shes bzhin dang sems pa dang btang snyoms so //
translated: aspiration, effort, faith, pliancy, mindfulness, vigilance, volition, and equanimity.

original: de la nam zhig 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i snyoms 'jug rnams thob par 'gyur snyam pa ni 'dun pa'o //
analyzed: de la nam zhig 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i snyoms 'jug rnams thob par 'gyur snyam pa ni 'dun pa'o //
translated: The will to attain the mundane and supramundane meditative concentrations is will.

original: mi dge ba thams cad 'joms pa'i ched du brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: mi dge ba thams cad 'joms pa'i ched du brtson 'grus so //
translated: Exertion is for the sake of destroying all nonvirtue.

original: gong ma dang khong du chud pa'i chos la dad pa dang de sngon du 'gro ba'i shin tu sbyangs pa dang de la shas bzhin gyi phyogs kyi dran pa dang lhag mthong gi phyogs shes @154b bzhin dang de la yang sems mngon par 'du byed pa'i sems pa
analyzed: gong ma dang khong du chud pa'i chos la dad pa dang de sngon du 'gro ba'i shin tu sbyangs pa dang de la shas bzhin gyi phyogs kyi dran pa dang lhag mthong gi phyogs shes @154b bzhin dang de la yang sems mngon par 'du byed pa'i sems pa
translated: Faith in the higher qualities and in the Dharma that is to be internalized, and the pliancy preceded by that, and the mindfulness that is the side of that, and insight that is the side of that, and the intention that is the mental application to that,

original: dang kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i btang snyoms so //
analyzed: dang kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i btang snyoms so //
translated: and the equanimity that is the absence of afflictions.

original: de ltar 'dun pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang spong ba'i 'du byed rnams dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa nyon mongs pas dben pa /
analyzed: de ltar 'dun pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang spong ba'i 'du byed rnams dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa nyon mongs pas dben pa /
translated: Thus, the basis of supernatural power that possesses will and so on, the meditative concentration and the abandonment applications, is isolated from affliction,

original: srid pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba /
analyzed: srid pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba /
translated: free from attachment to existence,

original: sdug bsngal 'gog pa la brten pa /
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog pa la brten pa /
translated: and it is based on the cessation of suffering.

original: phung po thams cad nye bar spong bas yongs su gyur pa sgom mo //
analyzed: phung po thams cad nye bar spong bas yongs su gyur pa sgom mo //
translated: One meditates on the transformation of all aggregates through the abandonment of all aggregates.

original: de nas yongs su sbyang ba byas pa las nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa bden pa bzhi'i yul can rnam pa bcu drug pa bsgoms pa las byung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de nas yongs su sbyang ba byas pa las nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa bden pa bzhi'i yul can rnam pa bcu drug pa bsgoms pa las byung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: Then, from the purification of the path of insight, there are four roots of virtue that arise from meditation on the sixteen aspects of the four noble truths, which are conducive to penetration.

original: 'dir drod dang rtse mo'i rang bzhin dad pa dang brtson 'grus dang dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab ste lnga ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos bskyed pa la dbang byed pa thob pa yod na dbang po rnams su 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir drod dang rtse mo'i rang bzhin dad pa dang brtson 'grus dang dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab ste lnga ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos bskyed pa la dbang byed pa thob pa yod na dbang po rnams su 'gyur te /
translated: Here, faith, effort, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom, which are the nature of heat and summit, are the faculties when one obtains control over the generation of supramundane dharmas.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams la rab tu sbyor ba ni rtags mthong ba las gong ma'i khyad par skyes pa na nges pa skyes te ston pa dang nyan thos la sogs pa rnams kyi rtog pa la mngon par yid ches pa skye ste de ni 'di'i dad
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams la rab tu sbyor ba ni rtags mthong ba las gong ma'i khyad par skyes pa na nges pa skyes te ston pa dang nyan thos la sogs pa rnams kyi rtog pa la mngon par yid ches pa skye ste de ni 'di'i dad
translated: When one who is engaged in the bases of supernatural power sees the signs, and the special qualities that arise above them are generated, certainty arises and one has full conviction in the thoughts of the teacher, sravakas, and so on. That is faith here.

original: pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: is the faculty of understanding.ğŸ”½ğŸ”½

original: dad pa lhag par las brtson 'grus la sogs pa rnams lhag pa'o //
analyzed: dad pa lhag par las brtson 'grus la sogs pa rnams lhag pa'o //
translated: The faculty of faith is predominant in the cultivation of effort.ğŸ”½The faculty of effort is predominant in the cultivation of the other faculties.

original: de nas dbang po lnga rnams sgom bzhin pa kho na de bzhin du 'phel te ji lta bar bdud la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams kyis mi brdzi ba nyid kyi phyir dang zil gyis mi non pa nyid kyi phyir stobs kyi ming thob ste stobs rnams
analyzed: de nas dbang po lnga rnams sgom bzhin pa kho na de bzhin du 'phel te ji lta bar bdud la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams kyis mi brdzi ba nyid kyi phyir dang zil gyis mi non pa nyid kyi phyir stobs kyi ming thob ste stobs rnams
translated: Then, the five faculties, being cultivated in this way, increase and attain the name of powers because they are not crushed by adverse factors such as faithlessness.

original: ni bzod pa dang chos mchog gi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: ni bzod pa dang chos mchog gi rang bzhin no //
translated: The powers are of the nature of receptivity and the supreme mundane qualities.

original: de nas chos mchog gi de ma thag tu 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i yul can bden pa bzhi'i bden pa mngon par rtogs pa zag pa med pa skad cig bcu drug yang dag par skye ste /
analyzed: de nas chos mchog gi de ma thag tu 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i yul can bden pa bzhi'i bden pa mngon par rtogs pa zag pa med pa skad cig bcu drug yang dag par skye ste /
translated: Then, immediately after the supreme mundane qualities, the sixteen moments of the path of seeing arise, which are pure, i.e., uncontaminated, and have as their object the four noble truths.

original: 'di lta ste sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang chos shes pa dang rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / rjes su shes pa ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang chos shes pa dang rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / rjes su shes pa ste /
translated: They are as follows: receptivity to the knowledge of the dharma with regard to suffering, knowledge of the dharma, receptivity to subsequent knowledge, subsequent knowledge, with regard to the other three truths, knowledge of the dharma, and subsequent knowledge.

original: de bzhin du kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang lam la'o zhes pa bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa'i skad cig bcu drug rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin du kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang lam la'o zhes pa bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa'i skad cig bcu drug rnams so //
translated: These are the sixteen moments that focus on the four truths.

original: de la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang chos shes pa'i skad cig brgyad rnams ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: de la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang chos shes pa'i skad cig brgyad rnams ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po'o //
translated: Among them, the eight moments of perseverance for Dharma knowledge and Dharma knowledge are the antidote to affliction of the desire realm.

original: rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang rjes su shes pa'i skad cig rnams ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang rjes su shes pa'i skad cig rnams ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po'o //
translated: The moments of perseverance for subsequent knowledge and subsequent knowledge are the antidote to affliction of the form and formless realms.

original: de la bzod pa'i skad cig thams cad rnams rkun po 'byin pa bzhin @155a * //ğŸ”½du nyon mongs pa spong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la bzod pa'i skad cig thams cad rnams rkun po 'byin pa bzhin @155a * // du nyon mongs pa spong ba'i phyir /
translated: All moments of perseverance are like thieves who expel a thief.ğŸ”½Because they abandon affliction, they are the nature of the uninterrupted path.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin shes rab kyi bdag nyid kyis sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong ba'i rang bzhin nyon mongs pa'i thob pa rnams gcod pa'o //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin shes rab kyi bdag nyid kyis sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong ba'i rang bzhin nyon mongs pa'i thob pa rnams gcod pa'o //
translated: They are the wisdom that severs the obtainment of affliction that is the nature of seeing suffering and so on.

original: shes pa'i skad cig ma rnams kyang nyon mongs pa spangs pa na sgo 'phar gcod pa'i tshul gyis bya ba dang ldan pa rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong ba des pa'i bdag nyid nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i thob pağŸ”½rnams dang lhan cig skyes zhes kha cig go //
analyzed: shes pa'i skad cig ma rnams kyang nyon mongs pa spangs pa na sgo 'phar gcod pa'i tshul gyis bya ba dang ldan pa rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong ba des pa'i bdag nyid nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i thob pa rnams dang lhan cig skyes zhes kha cig go //
translated: They are said to be simultaneously generated with the obtainment of the nature of seeing the truths of suffering and so on that is free from affliction.

original: gzhan rnams ni rjes su shes pa rnams kho na nges pa'i bdag nyid de bcu gnyis rnams ni mngon du byed pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan rnams ni rjes su shes pa rnams kho na nges pa'i bdag nyid de bcu gnyis rnams ni mngon du byed pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: Subsequent knowledge alone is the nature of definite discrimination and the twelve are actualized.

original: de dang 'di yang dpyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dang 'di yang dpyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be analyzed.

original: 'dir skad cig bco lnga rnams ni mthong ba'i lam ste /
analyzed: 'dir skad cig bco lnga rnams ni mthong ba'i lam ste /
translated: Here the fifteen moments are the path of seeing.

original: de la rnal 'byor pa rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs par brjod do //
analyzed: de la rnal 'byor pa rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs par brjod do //
translated: The yogi is said to be entering the result of stream entry.

original: lam la rjes su shes pa ni bsgom pa'i lam ste /
analyzed: lam la rjes su shes pa ni bsgom pa'i lam ste /
translated: Subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path is the path of meditation.

original: skad cig ma de la rgyun du zhugs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma de la rgyun du zhugs pa kho na'o //
translated: At that moment one is a stream enterer alone.

original: rgyun ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshor 'bab pa'i lam ste de la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshor 'bab pa'i lam ste de la zhugs pa'o //
translated: The stream is the path that leads to the lake of nirvana.

original: gal te thogs na mi'i srid pa bdun kho na dang / bar mdo'i  srid pa bdun dang / de bzhin du lha rnams su'o zhes pa srid pa nyi shu rtsa brgyad du so sor mtshams sbyor ro zhes kha cig go //ğŸ”½bdun kho nar ro zhes gzhan dag go //
analyzed: gal te thogs na mi'i srid pa bdun kho na dang / bar mdo'i  srid pa bdun dang / de bzhin du lha rnams su'o zhes pa srid pa nyi shu rtsa brgyad du so sor mtshams sbyor ro zhes kha cig go // bdun kho nar ro zhes gzhan dag go //
translated: If he is obstructed, he is reborn twenty-eight times: seven times as a human, seven times as a god, and seven times as an animal.ğŸ”½Others say that he is reborn seven times at the most.

analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar thogs na srid pa lan bdun pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Thus, he is called one who goes to the highest.

original: de la snga na med pa shes par bya 'dod pa yod la blta bar bya ba ni med do //
analyzed: de la snga na med pa shes par bya 'dod pa yod la blta bar bya ba ni med do //
translated: In the first case, he has the desire to know the truth but does not see it.

original: 'dir yang mthong ba'i lam la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rtogs pa ni byang chub dang rdzogs pa'i byang chub ste de'i yan lag byang chub kyi yan lag bdun rnams so sor thob ste dran pa dang chos rnam par 'byed pa dang brtson 'grus dang dga'
analyzed: 'dir yang mthong ba'i lam la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rtogs pa ni byang chub dang rdzogs pa'i byang chub ste de'i yan lag byang chub kyi yan lag bdun rnams so sor thob ste dran pa dang chos rnam par 'byed pa dang brtson 'grus dang dga'
translated: Here, the path of insight is enlightenment and perfect enlightenment. The seven members of enlightenment are the attainment of the members of enlightenment, i.e., mindfulness, investigation of the Dharmas, vigor, joy,

original: ba dang shin tu sbyangs pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang btang snyoms so //
analyzed: ba dang shin tu sbyangs pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang btang snyoms so //
translated: and pliancy, concentration, and equanimity.

original: de rnams ni rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi yan lag kyang ngo //
analyzed: de rnams ni rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi yan lag kyang ngo //
translated: They are also the limbs of perfect enlightenment.

original: de la chos rnam par 'byed pa dang brtson 'grus dang dga' ba zhes pa gsum rnams lhag mthong gi phyogs so //
analyzed: de la chos rnam par 'byed pa dang brtson 'grus dang dga' ba zhes pa gsum rnams lhag mthong gi phyogs so //
translated: Among them, the three, investigation of phenomena, effort, and joy, are on the side of insight.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang btang snyoms rnams zhi gnas kyi phyogs so //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang btang snyoms rnams zhi gnas kyi phyogs so //
translated: Pliancy, concentration, and equanimity are on the side of serenity.

original: dran pa ni gnyis ka'i phyogs so //
analyzed: dran pa ni gnyis ka'i phyogs so //
translated: Mindfulness is on both sides.

original: dga' ba ni gang dmigs pa de kho na la yid bde ba'o //
analyzed: dga' ba ni gang dmigs pa de kho na la yid bde ba'o //
translated: Joy is mental satisfaction with regard to just that object.

original: btang snyoms ni lhun gyis grub pa 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: btang snyoms ni lhun gyis grub pa 'byung ba'o //
translated: Equanimity is spontaneous occurrence.

original: dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed par yang @155b gsungs pa /
analyzed: dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed par yang @155b gsungs pa /
translated: The MadhyÄntavibhÄga says:

original: rang bzhin yan lag gnas yan lag / gsum pa nges 'byung yan lag ste //
analyzed: rang bzhin yan lag gnas yan lag / gsum pa nges 'byung yan lag ste //
translated: The natural limbs, the limbs of the basis, the third is the limb of renunciation,

original: bzhi pa phan yon yan lag go //
analyzed: bzhi pa phan yon yan lag go //
translated: and the fourth is the limb of benefit.

original: rnam gsum nyon mongs med yan lag /'di la gzhi dang gnas dang ni //
analyzed: rnam gsum nyon mongs med yan lag /'di la gzhi dang gnas dang ni //
translated: The three are the limb of nonaffliction.

original: rang bzhin gyis ni bstan par 'dod //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ni bstan par 'dod //
translated: It is taught to have the nature of the four foundations.

original: ces so // byang chub kyi gnas dran pa'o //
analyzed: ces so // byang chub kyi gnas dran pa'o //
translated: The foundation of enlightenment is mindfulness.

original: rang bzhin chos rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin chos rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: The nature is the differentiation of phenomena.

original: nges par 'byung ba brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba brtson 'grus so //
translated: The definite emergence is effort.

original: phan yon dga' ba'o //
analyzed: phan yon dga' ba'o //
translated: The benefit is joy.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu gnas ngan len gyi gnyen po shin tu sbyangs pa ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu gnas ngan len gyi gnyen po shin tu sbyangs pa ste /
translated: The antidote to the cause of the afflictions, which is the negative tendency, is pliancy.

original: de'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i gzhi'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i gzhi'o //
translated: Therefore, it is the foundation of the absence of afflictions.

original: gnas ni ting nge 'dzin no //
analyzed: gnas ni ting nge 'dzin no //
translated: The foundation is meditative concentration.

original: rang bzhin ni btang snyoms so ;
analyzed: rang bzhin ni btang snyoms so ;
translated: The nature is equanimity.

original: / de la sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba bcu ste /
analyzed: / de la sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba bcu ste /
translated: There are ten objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering:

original: 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang the tshom ste lnga rnams dang / 'jig tshogs dang / mthar 'dzin pa dang / log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang /ğŸ”½brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lta ba rnams te lnga'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang the tshom ste lnga rnams dang / 'jig tshogs dang / mthar 'dzin pa dang / log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang /ğŸ”½brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lta ba rnams te lnga'o //
translated: the five of attachment, anger, pride, ignorance, and doubt, and the five of the afflicted view of the self, extreme view, wrong view, holding a view as paramount, and holding ethics and religious rituals as paramount.

original: de rnams kho na las bdun ni kun 'byung dang 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: de rnams kho na las bdun ni kun 'byung dang 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba ste /
translated: From among those, seven are objects to be abandoned by seeing the truths of origin and cessation.

original: 'jig tshogs dang / mthar 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lta ba ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs dang / mthar 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lta ba ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: They are the five views except for the afflicted view of the self, extreme view and clinging to rules and ritual as supreme.

original: lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba brgyad de de rnams tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba brgyad de de rnams tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Eight are objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of path. They are the five views except for the afflicted view of the self and extreme view, plus clinging to rules and ritual as supreme and doubt.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba bzhi ste /
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba bzhi ste /
translated: Four are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa'o //
translated: They are desire realm attachment, anger, pride and ignorance.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag na yang thams cad du de rnams kho na khong khro bor ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag na yang thams cad du de rnams kho na khong khro bor ba'o //

original: de nyid kyi phyir dgu bcu rtsa brgyad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dgu bcu rtsa brgyad du 'gyur ro //

original: de ltar sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa mthong ba rnams la slar 'bad pas sgom pa de nyid lam ste /
analyzed: de ltar sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa mthong ba rnams la slar 'bad pas sgom pa de nyid lam ste /

analyzed: phung po gsum pa 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa de sgom ste /
translated: One cultivates the third aggregate, the eightfold noble path,

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang rtog pa dang ngag dang las kyi mtha' dang 'tsho ba dang rtsol ba dang / dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin gyi yan lag rnams so //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang rtog pa dang ngag dang las kyi mtha' dang 'tsho ba dang rtsol ba dang / dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin gyi yan lag rnams so //

analyzed: yang dag pa'i ngag dang las kyi mtha' dang 'tsho ba rnams tshul khrims kyi phung po'o //

analyzed: yang dag pa'i dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin dag ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po'o //

translated: Among these, right view is uncontaminated wisdom.

analyzed: @156a * // yang dag pa'i rtog pa ni dge ba'i kun du rtog pa'o //

analyzed: yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' ni lus kyi dge ba gsum rnams te spong ba'i rang bzhin no //

analyzed: ces so // de la mthong ba'i lam yongs su gcod pa ni yang dag pa'i lta ba'o //
translated: The path of seeing is the correct view.

analyzed: gzhan go bar byed pa ni yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i dag ste yang dag pas kun nas bslang ba'i tshig gis de go bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Correct thought and correct speech are the limbs of teaching others, because one teaches others through speech that is motivated by correct thought.

analyzed: gzhan yid ches par byed pa'i yan lag rnam pa gsum ni yang dag pa'i ngag dang las kyi mtha' dang 'tsho ba rnams so //
translated: The three limbs of causing others to trust are correct speech, correct action, and correct livelihood.

original: de rnams kyis rim pa ji lta bar gsum rnams la yid ches par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de rnams kyis rim pa ji lta bar gsum rnams la yid ches par 'gyur te /
translated: Through these, one causes the three to trust in order.

original: brjod pa dang 'brel ba'i gtam rnam par nges pas shes rab la'o //
analyzed: brjod pa dang 'brel ba'i gtam rnam par nges pas shes rab la'o //

analyzed: bya ba ma yin pa mi byed pa las tshul khrims la'o //
translated: One causes the immoral to trust through correct action, because one does not engage in improper action.

analyzed: chos tsam gyi tshod zin par chos gos la sogs pa la tshol ba las kyang yo byad bsnyungs pa la'o //
translated: One causes the miserly to trust through correct livelihood, because one seeks robes and so on in a manner that is free of worldly attachment.

original: mi mthun phyogs kyi gnyen po'i yan lag gsum rnams ni yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: mi mthun phyogs kyi gnyen po'i yan lag gsum rnams ni yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: The three branches that are antidotes to nonvirtue are right effort, right mindfulness and right samadhi.

original: de rnams ni rim pa bzhin du nyon mongs pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa byid rgod dang / dbang gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs yon tan khyad par can mngon par sgrub pa'i gegs kyi gnyen po'o //
analyzed: de rnams ni rim pa bzhin du nyon mongs pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa byid rgod dang / dbang gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs yon tan khyad par can mngon par sgrub pa'i gegs kyi gnyen po'o //
translated: They are, respectively, the antidote to the affliction that is abandoned by the path of meditation, the antidote to the branch affliction of excitement and dullness and the antidote to the hindrances to accomplishing the special qualities of mastery.

original: 'phags pa ni slob pa rnams te de rnams kyi nyon mongs pa las grol ba mngon du bya ba'i ched du lam 'di bskyed de /
analyzed: 'phags pa ni slob pa rnams te de rnams kyi nyon mongs pa las grol ba mngon du bya ba'i ched du lam 'di bskyed de /
translated: Aryas are those in training. They generate this path in order to manifest liberation from affliction.

original: de'i phyir 'di 'phags pa rnams kyi yan lag brgyad pa zhes pas 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di 'phags pa rnams kyi yan lag brgyad pa zhes pas 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad do //
translated: Therefore it is called the eightfold noble path because it is the eightfold path of the aryas.

original: yan lag 'di rnams langs pa'i yang ste /
analyzed: yan lag 'di rnams langs pa'i yang ste /
translated: These are the limbs of the aryas.

original: lam la mnyam par gzhag pa la ni yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba dang @156b dran pa rnams mi srid do //
analyzed: lam la mnyam par gzhag pa la ni yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba dang @156b dran pa rnams mi srid do //
translated: But right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, and right mindfulness are impossible in one equipoised in the path.

original: 'o na lam la snyoms par zhugs pa de'i tshe yan lag brgyad sgrub pa'i chos su ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na lam la snyoms par zhugs pa de'i tshe yan lag brgyad sgrub pa'i chos su ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can one who is equipoised in the path accomplish the eightfold noble path?

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thob pas de'i rang bzhin zag pa med pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa thob ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thob pas de'i rang bzhin zag pa med pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa thob ste /
translated: One obtains uncontaminated nonindicative virtue by obtaining transcendent virtue.

original: gang thob pas langs kyang slar yang log pa'i ngag la sogs la mi 'jug cing yang dag pa'i dag la sogs pa rnams la yang 'jug go //
analyzed: gang thob pas langs kyang slar yang log pa'i ngag la sogs la mi 'jug cing yang dag pa'i dag la sogs pa rnams la yang 'jug go //
translated: Even when one rises from that equipoise, one does not engage in wrong speech and so on and one engages in right speech and so on.

original: de'i phyir rgyu mtshan la rgyu mtshan can nye bar btags pa las yan lag brgyad nyid de /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu mtshan la rgyu mtshan can nye bar btags pa las yan lag brgyad nyid de /
translated: Therefore the eightfold path is imputed to the cause, the reason, because of the result.

original: gzhan du na lam la mnyam par gzhag pa 'gal lo //
analyzed: gzhan du na lam la mnyam par gzhag pa 'gal lo //
translated: Otherwise, it would contradict that one is equipoised in the path.

original: lam 'di yang tshangs pa mya ngan las 'das pa la phan par spyod pas tshangs par spyod pa ste /
analyzed: lam 'di yang tshangs pa mya ngan las 'das pa la phan par spyod pas tshangs par spyod pa ste /
translated: This path is also pure conduct brahmacarya because it is practiced for the benefit of Brahma, nirvana.

original: mdor tshangs par spyod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mdor tshangs par spyod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is pure conduct in brief?

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the eightfold noble path.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa sde bdun po sum cu rtsa bdun po 'di rnams byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis kyang bsgom par bya ste khyad par ni 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa sde bdun po sum cu rtsa bdun po 'di rnams byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis kyang bsgom par bya ste khyad par ni 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: These thirty-seven, such as the foundations of mindfulness, are also cultivated by bodhisattvas, but their distinctions will be explained later.

original: byang chub ni zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag ste de'i phyogs rjes su mthun pa rnams so zhes pa byang chub kyi phyogs rnams so //
analyzed: byang chub ni zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag ste de'i phyogs rjes su mthun pa rnams so zhes pa byang chub kyi phyogs rnams so //

translated: The nirvana realm that is not a matter of enumeration is the nirvana realm that is taught in terms of what is not an enumeration.ğŸ”½The nirvana realm that is a matter of analysis is the nirvana realm that is taught in terms of analysis.ğŸ”½The nirvana realm that is not a matter of analysis is the nirvana realm that is taught in terms of what is not an analysis.ğŸ”½The nirvana realm that is a matter of designation is the nirvana realm that is taught in terms of designation.ğŸ”½The nirvana realm that is not a matter of designation is the nirvana realm that is taught in terms of what is not a designation.ğŸ”½The nirvana realm that is a matter of expression is the nirvana realm that is taught in terms of expression.

original: ma lus par spangs pa dang nges par spangs pa dang byang bar gyur pa dang zad pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang 'gog pa dang rnam par zhi ba dang nub pa dang 'dus ma byas pa dang blta dka' ba dang g-yo ba med pa dang mi
analyzed: ma lus par spangs pa dang nges par spangs pa dang byang bar gyur pa dang zad pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang 'gog pa dang rnam par zhi ba dang nub pa dang 'dus ma byas pa dang blta dka' ba dang g-yo ba med pa dang mi
translated: The nirvana realm that is not a matter of expression is the nirvana realm that is taught in terms of what is not an expression.ğŸ”½The nirvana realm that is a matter of words is the nirvana realm that is taught in terms of words.ğŸ”½The nirvana realm that is not a matter of words is the nirvana realm that is taught in terms of what is not a word.ğŸ”½The nirvana realm that is a matter of syllables is the nirvana realm that is taught in terms of syllables.ğŸ”½The nirvana realm that is not a matter of syllables is the nirvana realm that is taught in terms of what is not a syllable.ğŸ”½The nirvana realm that is a matter of reasoning is the nirvana realm that is taught in terms of reasoning.ğŸ”½The nirvana realm that is not a matter of reasoning is the nirvana realm that is taught in terms of what is not a reasoning.ğŸ”½The nirvana realm that is a matter of knowledge is the nirvana realm that is taught in terms of knowledge.ğŸ”½The nirvana realm that is not a matter of knowledge is the nirvana realm that is taught in terms of what is not a knowledge.ğŸ”½The nirvana realm that

original: 'dud pa dang 'chi ba med pa dang zag pa med pa dang gnas dang / gling dang skyob pa dang skyabs dang dpung gnyen dang 'chi 'pho med pa dang rims nad med pa dang bde ba dang zhi ba dang dge bar 'gyur ba dang / nad med pa dang mi g-yo ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: 'dud pa dang 'chi ba med pa dang zag pa med pa dang gnas dang / gling dang skyob pa dang skyabs dang dpung gnyen dang 'chi 'pho med pa dang rims nad med pa dang bde ba dang zhi ba dang dge bar 'gyur ba dang / nad med pa dang mi g-yo ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes so //
translated: It is the absence of bowing down, death, outflows, a place, an island, a protector, a refuge, a friend, death, rebirth, fever, happiness, peace, virtue, disease, immobility, and nirvana.

original: de la ma lus par spangs pa zhes pa ni mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de la ma lus par spangs pa zhes pa ni mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: Here, the absence of all is the brief teaching.

original: lhag ma rgyas par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rgyas par bshad pa'o //
translated: The rest is the extensive explanation.

original: nges par spangs pa ni kun nas dkris pa byung ba spangs pa'o //
analyzed: nges par spangs pa ni kun nas dkris pa byung ba spangs pa'o //
translated: Abandonment is the abandonment of the occurrence of the entanglements.

original: byang bar gyur pa ni bag la nyal mthar byed pa'i phyir te bag chags spangs pa'i dbang du byas nas gsungs la /
analyzed: byang bar gyur pa ni bag la nyal mthar byed pa'i phyir te bag chags spangs pa'i dbang du byas nas gsungs la /
translated: Purification is the termination of the latent propensities, because it is taught from the perspective of the abandonment of the traces.

original: rtsa ba med na gtan mi skye ba'i phyir ro zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rtsa ba med na gtan mi skye ba'i phyir ro zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that if there are no roots, there is no arising at all.

original: de slar yang gnyen po mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis su rnam par gzhag ste zad pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes pa'o //ğŸ”½de la mthong ba'i lam gyi bral ba'i dbang du byas nas zad pa ste /
analyzed: de slar yang gnyen po mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis su rnam par gzhag ste zad pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes pa'o // de la mthong ba'i lam gyi bral ba'i dbang du byas nas zad pa ste /
translated: That is again divided into two kinds, by the specific distinctions of the paths of seeing and cultivation, called exhaustion and freedom from attachment.

original: nyon mongs pa'i phung po chung ngu tsam lus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i phung po chung ngu tsam lus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: In regard to that, freedom from attachment is from the point of view of the path of seeing, because only a small mass of afflictions remains.

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyis ni 'dod chags dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyis ni 'dod chags dang bral ba ste /
translated: Freedom from attachment is by the path of cultivation,

original: de ni sa las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rtogs pa rab tu sgom pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni sa las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rtogs pa rab tu sgom pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because one cultivates the realization of freedom from attachment to the stages.ğŸ”½When one is freed by those two, one is freed from future suffering, because one has made it a principle not to be born again.

original: de gnyis kyis bral bar gyur na mi skye ba'i chos nyid du byas pa'i phyi ma la sdug bsngal 'gog pa dang mthong ba'i @158b chos la yid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis bral bar gyur na mi skye ba'i chos nyid du byas pa'i phyi ma la sdug bsngal 'gog pa dang mthong ba'i @158b chos la yid kyi phyir ro //
translated: One is freed from the present suffering, because one is freed from the mental dissatisfaction of the present life.

original: mi bde ba rnam par zhi ba ste de kun du mi spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi bde ba rnam par zhi ba ste de kun du mi spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One is freed from the suffering of pain, because one does not experience that.

original: de'i phyir de'i 'bras bur gyur pa sdug bsngal rnam pa gnyis spangs pa'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa 'gog pa dang rnam par zhi ba'o zhes so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i 'bras bur gyur pa sdug bsngal rnam pa gnyis spangs pa'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa 'gog pa dang rnam par zhi ba'o zhes so //
translated: Therefore, in terms of the abandonment of the two kinds of suffering which are its fruits, it is said to be cessation and peace.

original: nye bar 'tshe ba lhag ma mthar gyur pa bzung nas nub pa zhes pa ste /
analyzed: nye bar 'tshe ba lhag ma mthar gyur pa bzung nas nub pa zhes pa ste /
translated: The remainder of the afflictions are taken as the final limit of injury and are called setting.

original: de ltar byas nas ma lus par spangs pa rgyas par bshad par rig pa bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar byas nas ma lus par spangs pa rgyas par bshad par rig pa bya'o //
translated: Thus, the complete abandonment of the afflictions should be understood as being explained in detail.

original: 'dus ma byas ni mtshan nyid gsum dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni mtshan nyid gsum dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: The unconditioned is free from the three characteristics,

original: 'dus byas las bzlog pas so //
analyzed: 'dus byas las bzlog pas so //
translated: because it is the opposite of the conditioned.

original: blta dka' ba ni sha'i mig dang lha'i mig gi spyod yul las shin tu 'das pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: blta dka' ba ni sha'i mig dang lha'i mig gi spyod yul las shin tu 'das pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is difficult to see because it is beyond the range of the fleshy eye and the divine eye.

original: g-yo ba med pa ni 'gro bar 'pho ba dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir ro ;
analyzed: g-yo ba med pa ni 'gro bar 'pho ba dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir ro ;
translated: It is without movement because it is free from the transmigration of going.

original: / mi 'dud pa ni 'dod pa dang gzugs med pa'i srid pa gsum med pa na srid pa rnams su mi 'dud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / mi 'dud pa ni 'dod pa dang gzugs med pa'i srid pa gsum med pa na srid pa rnams su mi 'dud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not bent because it is not bent in the three existences of desire, form, and formlessness.

original: 'chi ba med pa ni phung po'i bdud dang bral ba'i phyir te 'chi ba'i don rten phung po med pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'chi ba med pa ni phung po'i bdud dang bral ba'i phyir te 'chi ba'i don rten phung po med pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Immortality is because of being free from the demon of the aggregates, because of the absence of the aggregates which are the basis of death.

original: zag pa med pa ni nyon mongs pa'i bdud dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa med pa ni nyon mongs pa'i bdud dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The absence of outflows is because of being free from the demon of afflictions.

original: gnas ni rnam par grol ba'i dga' ba de'i gzhi nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas ni rnam par grol ba'i dga' ba de'i gzhi nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The island is because of being the basis of the joy of liberation.

original: gling ni khams gsum las yongs su chad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gling ni khams gsum las yongs su chad pa'i phyir te /
translated: The continent is because of being separated from the three realms,

original: 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho chen po la thang du gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho chen po la thang du gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa'i don to //
translated: because of being the dry land in the great ocean of cyclic existence.

original: skyob pa ni nye bar 'tshe ba thams cad bzlog pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: skyob pa ni nye bar 'tshe ba thams cad bzlog pa'i phyir te /
translated: The protector is because of turning away all harms,

original: de thob na skye ba la sogs pa'i nye bar 'tshe ba thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de thob na skye ba la sogs pa'i nye bar 'tshe ba thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes pa'i don to //
translated: because of being free from all harms of birth and so on when attaining that.

original: skyabs ni der bsam pa dang sbyor ba 'bras bu yod pa'i gzhi'i gnas yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: skyabs ni der bsam pa dang sbyor ba 'bras bu yod pa'i gzhi'i gnas yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The refuge is because of being the basis of the existence of intention and application there,ğŸ”½because of being the basis of the existence of the result of the path of seeing.

original: der byas pa'i bsam pa dang sbyor ba dag 'bras bu yod pa'i gzhi'i gnas nyid kyis brten par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: der byas pa'i bsam pa dang sbyor ba dag 'bras bu yod pa'i gzhi'i gnas nyid kyis brten par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: because the basis of the existence of the result of the intention and application that are performed is to be relied upon.

original: dpung gnyen ni mchog 'phags pa nyid du 'gro ba'i gzhi'i gnas yin pa'i phyir te dgra bcom pa thob pa'i thabs kyi dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: dpung gnyen ni mchog 'phags pa nyid du 'gro ba'i gzhi'i gnas yin pa'i phyir te dgra bcom pa thob pa'i thabs kyi dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: because it is the basis of the existence of the supreme refuge, which is the attainment of the noble state, because it is the object of the means of attaining the state of an arhat.

original: 'chi 'pho med pa ni ma skyes pa nyid kyis nyams pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho med pa ni ma skyes pa nyid kyis nyams pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The absence of death and rebirth is because the absence of birth makes the occurrence of decline impossible.

original: rims nad med pa ni 'dod pas 'joms pa'i gdung ba thams cad med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rims nad med pa ni 'dod pas 'joms pa'i gdung ba thams cad med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The absence of fever is because all the torments of being destroyed by desire are absent.

original: yongs su gdung ba med pa ni mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba dang 'khrugs pa'i yongs su gdung ba thams cad med pas na bsel bar gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su gdung ba med pa ni mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba dang 'khrugs pa'i yongs su gdung ba thams cad med pas na bsel bar gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The absence of distress is because all distress of sorrow, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and perturbation are absent, and so it is the state of coolness.

original: bde ba ni na ba dang rga ba dang 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa dang bral ba 'phags pa'i gnas pa'i rten nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba ni na ba dang rga ba dang 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa dang bral ba 'phags pa'i gnas pa'i rten nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Bliss is the basis of the holy life, because it is free from the fear of sickness, old age, and death.

original: zhi ba ni dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi rten nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: zhi ba ni dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi rten nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Peace is the basis of all virtuous qualities.

original: bde gzhi nyid ni 'jig @159a * //
analyzed: bde gzhi nyid ni 'jig @159a * //
translated: The basis of happiness is the world beyond,

original: rten las 'das pa'i bde ba'i gzhi nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rten las 'das pa'i bde ba'i gzhi nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is the basis of supramundane happiness.

original: dge bar gyur pa ni sbyor ba bde bas de thob pa'i dmigs pa'i dngos po'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge bar gyur pa ni sbyor ba bde bas de thob pa'i dmigs pa'i dngos po'i phyir ro //
translated: The basis of virtue is the object of the attainment of happiness through practice.

original: nad med pa ni nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i sgrib pa'i nad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nad med pa ni nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i sgrib pa'i nad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Health is the freedom from the sickness of the addictions and so on, which are the obscurations.

original: dper na rgyu gsum gyis nad 'byung ste nyes pa bsags pas dang mi 'phrod pa brten pas dang btang snyoms kyis so //
analyzed: dper na rgyu gsum gyis nad 'byung ste nyes pa bsags pas dang mi 'phrod pa brten pas dang btang snyoms kyis so //
translated: For example, sickness arises from three causes: the accumulation of faults, the use of incompatible things, and indifference.

original: de bzhin kho nar nyon mongs pa'i nad de 'di'i nyes pa rnams ni 'dod pa'i rtog pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin kho nar nyon mongs pa'i nad de 'di'i nyes pa rnams ni 'dod pa'i rtog pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Just so, the sickness of the addictions arises from three causes: the faults of the addictions are the thoughts of desire and so on.

original: stong pa nyid la sogs pa rnams las gzhan thams cad mi 'phrod pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la sogs pa rnams las gzhan thams cad mi 'phrod pa'o //
translated: All things other than emptiness and so on are incompatible.

original: de'i phyir gus pa dang bcas pas phyin ci ma log pa'i de kho na nyid goms pa las med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir gus pa dang bcas pas phyin ci ma log pa'i de kho na nyid goms pa las med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, through the practice of the nonerroneous reality with devotion, one will attain the unmoving, the nirvana, and the supreme state.

original: mi g-yo ba ni yul gyi spros pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba ni yul gyi spros pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The unmoving is free from all distractions of the proliferation of objects.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i 'du shes thams cad bral ba zhi la bde bar gnas pa'i dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i 'du shes thams cad bral ba zhi la bde bar gnas pa'i dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Nirvana is the state of peace, the abode of bliss, free from all discriminations of form, etc.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bdag med pa gnyis ka rtogs pa'i phyir chos kyi rnam par rtog pa rnams la yang bskal pa'i me bzhin du sems shing phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings la mngon par dga' ba med do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bdag med pa gnyis ka rtogs pa'i phyir chos kyi rnam par rtog pa rnams la yang bskal pa'i me bzhin du sems shing phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings la mngon par dga' ba med do //
translated: The bodhisattvas, because they have realized the two selflessnesses, are like a conflagration of the aeon for the discriminations of dharmas. They do not delight in the realm of nirvana with remainder.

original: don dam par ni sangs rgyas nyid kho na phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings de kho nar rnam par mi rtog pa mtha' dag rnam pa thams cad du bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par ni sangs rgyas nyid kho na phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings de kho nar rnam par mi rtog pa mtha' dag rnam pa thams cad du bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In the ultimate sense, only the Buddha, in the realm of nirvana without remainder of aggregates, is completely free from all conceptualization, because he is completely free from all aspects of conceptualization.

original: gang yang bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa de ni gdul bya rnams kyi de lta bu'i bsam pa'i dbang las so //
analyzed: gang yang bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa de ni gdul bya rnams kyi de lta bu'i bsam pa'i dbang las so //
translated: Moreover, the nirvana of the Blessed One is due to the power of such intentions of those to be trained.

original: 'o na gang dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu las yongs su nyams pa 'di ci slar skye 'am zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gang dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu las yongs su nyams pa 'di ci slar skye 'am zhe na /
translated: Now, if one falls away from the fruit of arhatship, does one take rebirth or not?

original: 'di ni med de gang gi phyir 'bras bu las nyams pa mi mchi bas so //
analyzed: 'di ni med de gang gi phyir 'bras bu las nyams pa mi mchi bas so //
translated: This is not so, because one does not fall away from the fruit.

original: 'bras bu las yongs su nyams pa ni su yang dus byed pa med pa kho na ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu las yongs su nyams pa ni su yang dus byed pa med pa kho na ste /
translated: One who has fallen away from the fruit does not die in that state.

original: dge slong rnams 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa dang dran pa nyams pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dge slong rnams 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa dang dran pa nyams pa 'byung ngo //
translated: The Blessed One said, â€œMonks, it is impossible for a noble disciple who has knowledge and is mindful to fall away from arhatship.â€

original: 'on kyang yang myur ba kho nar nub pa dang yongs su zad pa dang yongs su gtugs pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhes mdor gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang yang myur ba kho nar nub pa dang yongs su zad pa dang yongs su gtugs pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhes mdor gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But they quickly disappear and are completely exhausted and completely terminated.

original: gzhan du na tshangs par spyad pa yid brtan du mi rung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na tshangs par spyad pa yid brtan du mi rung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, pure conduct would be unreliable.

original: de yang 'bras bu de las yongs su nyams kyang 'bras bu da dang 'gal ba'i bya ba mi byed de dpa' bo bred kyang mi 'gyel ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de yang 'bras bu de las yongs su nyams kyang 'bras bu da dang 'gal ba'i bya ba mi byed de dpa' bo bred kyang mi 'gyel ba bzhin no //
translated: Even though one regresses from that result, one does not perform the action that conflicts with that result, like a hero who is frightened but does not flee.

original: de la gang la dbang po rtul po rnams ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa bsgom pa @159b la mngon par brtson pa dang po kho nar bdag nyid dul ba dang zhi ba gcig pu mngon par sems pa rnams te de ltar 'dod chags dang bral ba
analyzed: de la gang la dbang po rtul po rnams ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa bsgom pa @159b la mngon par brtson pa dang po kho nar bdag nyid dul ba dang zhi ba gcig pu mngon par sems pa rnams te de ltar 'dod chags dang bral ba
translated: Those who are dull-facultied, who strive to cultivate the truths of suffering, etc., who are initially intent on taming and pacifying themselves alone, and who are free from attachment

original: mngon du byed cing de rnams mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i 'du shes kyis zag pa med pa'i dbyings kho na la gnas so //
analyzed: mngon du byed cing de rnams mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i 'du shes kyis zag pa med pa'i dbyings kho na la gnas so //
translated: in this way manifest nirvana and abide in the uncontaminated realm, perceiving that they have attained nirvana.

original: gang dbang po 'bring po rnams ni bden pa sgom pa la mngon par dga' ba kho na gzhan gyi don la cung zad sred pa rnams te 'dod chags dang bral ba bskyed kyang 'dod chags dang bral ba mngon du mi byed par dus byed cing /
analyzed: gang dbang po 'bring po rnams ni bden pa sgom pa la mngon par dga' ba kho na gzhan gyi don la cung zad sred pa rnams te 'dod chags dang bral ba bskyed kyang 'dod chags dang bral ba mngon du mi byed par dus byed cing /
translated: Those of medium capacity are solely devoted to meditating on the four truths and have a slight craving for the welfare of others. They generate freedom from attachment but do not manifest freedom from attachment and die.

original: de rnams lus kyi chos ston pa mngon par 'dod pa'i dbang gis las dang lam gyi rnam par smin pa las dam pa'i chos nub par 'gyur ba na gzhan gyi gdams ngag la mi ltos par shes bya'i sgrib pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i don gyi rnam par
analyzed: de rnams lus kyi chos ston pa mngon par 'dod pa'i dbang gis las dang lam gyi rnam par smin pa las dam pa'i chos nub par 'gyur ba na gzhan gyi gdams ngag la mi ltos par shes bya'i sgrib pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i don gyi rnam par
translated: Due to their desire to teach the Dharma of the body, when the sublime Dharma is disappearing due to the ripening of karma and the path, they abandon the concepts of apprehendeds and apprehenders, the obscurations of omniscience, in stages.

original: rtog pa dag rim pa bzhin spangs pa dang spangs pa dag rkyen nyid 'di pa tsam gyi byang chub kyi rang byang chub mngon du byas shing rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa bstan pas snod du rung bar byas pa'i gdul bya'i rnam par shes pa la sgra med kyang
analyzed: rtog pa dag rim pa bzhin spangs pa dang spangs pa dag rkyen nyid 'di pa tsam gyi byang chub kyi rang byang chub mngon du byas shing rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa bstan pas snod du rung bar byas pa'i gdul bya'i rnam par shes pa la sgra med kyang

translated: At that time, because of the nature of serenity and insight, and because of the order of expression, the path of union is the supreme nature of the generation of the enlightenment mind, the yoga of nonconceptualization, the relative and ultimate natures of all merit.ğŸ”½

analyzed: @165b log pa'i smon lam las ldog pas smon pa med pa'i bdag nyid do //

translated: It is the nature of non-conditioning, since it turns away from conditioning due to erroneous inversion. Thus, it is the nature of the four doors of liberation.

analyzed: de bzhin du de kho na mig la sogs par dmigs pa las ldog pas nang stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Similarly, it is the nature of emptiness of the internal, since it turns away from the apprehension of suchness as the eye etc.

analyzed: gzugs la sogs par dmigs pa las ldog pas phyi stong ba nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: It is the nature of emptiness of the external, since it turns away from the apprehension of form etc.

analyzed: phyi nang gi rten du dmigs pa las ldog pas phyi nang stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: It is the nature of emptiness of the internal and the external, since it turns away from the apprehension of the internal and the external as a basis.

translated: The internal and the external are the basis of the sense faculties, because the external is not included in the sense faculties, although it is held by the mind.

original: stong pa nyid du dmigs pa las ldog pas stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid du dmigs pa las ldog pas stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: It is the nature of emptiness of emptiness, since it turns away from the apprehension of emptiness.

analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten du lhag par zhen pa las ldog pas chen po stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: It is the nature of emptiness of the great, since it turns away from the over-estimation of the receptacle world.

analyzed: don dam par dmigs pa las ldog pas don dam pa nyid kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: It is the nature of the ultimate, because it turns away from the observation of the ultimate.

analyzed: 'dus byas bsod nams kyi tshogs su dmigs pa las ldog pas 'dus byas stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: It is the nature of the emptiness of the conditioned, because it turns away from the observation of the accumulation of merit in the conditioned.

translated: It is the nature of the emptiness of the unconditioned, because it turns away from the observation of the accumulation of wisdom in the emptiness of the unconditioned.ğŸ”½It is the nature of the emptiness of the extreme of superimposition and denial, because it turns away from the observation of the extreme of superimposition and denial.

original: thog ma dang tha ma'i mtha' dang 'bral ba'i 'khor bar dmigs pa las ldog pas thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma'i mtha' dang 'bral ba'i 'khor bar dmigs pa las ldog pas thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: It is the nature of the emptiness of beginning and end, because it turns away from the observation of saá¹ƒsÄra, which is free from the extreme of beginning and end.

original: dge ba'i phyogs yongs su mi 'dor bar dmigs pas dor ba med pa stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs yongs su mi 'dor bar dmigs pas dor ba med pa stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: It is the nature of the emptiness of non-rejection, because it turns away from the observation of not abandoning the side of virtue.

original: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin du dmigs pa las ldog pas rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin du dmigs pa las ldog pas rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo ste /
translated: The essence of the emptiness of intrinsic nature is the opposite of the observation of the intrinsic nature of all phenomena.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa rnams kyis ma mdzad pa'i phyir chos rnams kyi chos nyid ni rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa rnams kyis ma mdzad pa'i phyir chos rnams kyi chos nyid ni rang bzhin no //
translated: The intrinsic nature of phenomena is their intrinsic nature because it is not made by the Tathagatas and so forth.

original: stobs dang mi 'jigs pa las sogs pa'i ngo ba'i chos kyi skur dmigs pa las ldog pas chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: stobs dang mi 'jigs pa las sogs pa'i ngo ba'i chos kyi skur dmigs pa las ldog pas chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: The essence of the emptiness of all phenomena is the opposite of the observation of the dharmakaya, which has the nature of the powers, fearlessnesses and so forth.

analyzed: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid du dmigs pa las ldog pas rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: The essence of the emptiness of individual characteristics is the opposite of the observation of general and specific characteristics.

analyzed: dmigs pa med par dmigs pa las ldog pas mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: The essence of the emptiness of nonobservation is the opposite of the observation of nonobservation.

original: phan tshun mi dmigs pa'i phyir dmigs pa med pa ni 'dir dus gsum mo //
analyzed: phan tshun mi dmigs pa'i phyir dmigs pa med pa ni 'dir dus gsum mo //
translated: Nonobservation here is the three times, because they are not mutually observed.

analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du dmigs pa las ldog pas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of the essential nature of non-entity is the nature of the reversal from the observation of the essential nature of non-entity.

original: @166a * // dngos po med pa yang 'di yin la ngo bo nyid kyang yin pas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid de sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: @166a * // dngos po med pa yang 'di yin la ngo bo nyid kyang yin pas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid de sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Non-entity is this and it is an essential nature, thus it is the essential nature of non-entity, the essential nature of what is produced from a combination.

original: de ci ltar dngos po med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ci ltar dngos po med pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it a non-entity?

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is dependently arisen.

original: dngos por dmigs pa las ldog pas dngos po stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid de /
analyzed: dngos por dmigs pa las ldog pas dngos po stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid de /
translated: The emptiness of entity is the nature of the reversal from the observation of entity.

analyzed: skye bas na dngos po ste phung po lnga rnams so //
translated: Entity is the five aggregates because they are produced.

original: chos 'ga' zhig kyang thun mong ma yin pa ste dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang sbyin pa la sogs pa sems bskyed pa thams cad kyi gnas skabs kyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: chos 'ga' zhig kyang thun mong ma yin pa ste dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang sbyin pa la sogs pa sems bskyed pa thams cad kyi gnas skabs kyi rang bzhin te /
translated: There is no dharma that is not common, such as the close placements of mindfulness and generosity, which are the nature of all the stages of the generation of bodhicitta.

original: sngar khong du chud pa'i chos phyi mar rjes su 'jug go zhes pa ni rigs pa'o //
analyzed: sngar khong du chud pa'i chos phyi mar rjes su 'jug go zhes pa ni rigs pa'o //
translated: The principle is that the dharmas that were previously understood are applied later.

original: 'ga' zhig ni thun mong ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ni thun mong ma yin pa ste /
translated: Some are not common.
